text: zwart met mooie fijne bruine kraag. aroma van geroosterde en gebrande mouten, chocolade, allemaal wel vrij zacht/ingetogen, smaken van cacao, poederachtig, zacht, glad, melkchocolade, vanille, lactose, suiker zoet, matig/redelijk zoet, geroosterde en gebrande mouten, suiker zoetig, matig gebrand bitter, matig tot redelijke body, zachte co2.

Bottle. Aroma: sweet, dark chocolate, caramel heavy. App: black, thin, tan head. Taste: sweet at first, then fades into a bitter chocolate, hint of coffee. Palate: very smooth, full mouth, medium finish. Overall: very enjoyable, one of my favorite porters.

Rami Rami is drinking a Porter by Founders Brewing Co. at Powiśle

Slodkawy zbozowy palony czekoladowy kawowy owocowy, fajna rownowaga generalnie, niemalo ciala jak na styl, bardzo smaczny ryli

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with slight yeast and with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. This is especially true for its abv. Great chocolate and coffee flavour, making this a great porter. Perfect appearance and a great palate as well, but the aroma could have been stronger.

Dark brown -nearly black with a brown head. Coffee and chocolate are notable in both the flavor and aroma. A little ash comes through. Malty but well balanced by both the hop bitterness and the dark roasted grains. a long malty, burnt grain finish. A good solid porter by any measure.
Chocolate en nariz, en boca más cafetosa y torrefacta. Buen cuerpo, muy equilibrada. Con punto amargo y seco. Cervezón. BB 02/09/2017

Aroma: maltas tostadas, chocolate, café. Apariencia: negro, masivo, cabeza beige. Sabor: ligero dulce. Paladar: maltas tostadas, chocolate, secado. En general: muy bonito Porter, excelentemente equilibrado.

Piana drobna, kremowa, obfita. Kolor prawie czarny, nieprzejrzysty. Bardzo przyjemny, mega czekoladowy zapach, przeplatany kawą cappuccino, ciastem czekoladowym i karmelem. W smaku półsłodkie, głównie mleczna czekolada, kakao, mleko w proszku, karmel i troszkę kawy zbożowej. Niska do średniej, tytoniowa goryczka, niskie wysycenie, gładkie, lekko wyklejające i dość pełne w odbiorze.

Faktycznie Dark, Rich & Sexy, przy tym nieźle pijalne i mega smaczne.
Molt bona porter... equilibrada dalcohol... que per portar més de 6 graus la fa consistent! Que es posin les piles els britànics que els americans els estan passant per davant!

Bottle from Taniguchi. When I realized I hadnt had this Ratebeer Top 50 rated Porter I rushed to pick one up. It is a beautiful beer with a deep inky black with a tan head that is luscious but disappears fast and leaves gobs of lacing.
Savoury roasty dark chocolate flavor with a medium bodied and toasted oats in the finish. A great beer.

Shared bottle at Olut Sabadell. Very dark brown/black with light vanilla head. Liquorice and roasted coffe aroma. Lightly carbonated. Good balance between sweet, bitter although roasted coffee feeling.
Tasted on tap @OlutSBD. Pours dark brown. Aroma of dark chocolate, toffee and hints of coffee. Taste of liquorice and roasted nuts. Slightly hoppy ending. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle [A very big thanks to Maddie for not being in need to bewitch the Founders German market sales agent who succumbed to your natural charms in instantaneousness anyway!]. Quasi black colour with average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, and lacing, tan head. Sweet-ish, chocolately, dark malty aroma, notes of milk chocolate, dark chocolate, hints of coffee and cocoa, hoppy overtones with a touch of grass, hay, weed. Taste is minimally sweet, heavily dark malty, minimally bitter roasty, chocolately, notes of dark chocolate, some caramel, hoppy counterweight with moderate bitterness and a resinous touch, cautious hints of coffee, malt lozenge and treacle, late some blueberry; oily texture, soft, minimally sticky palate, everlasting dark chocolately finish. Outshines the better part of beers boasting about the "Imperial" prefix.

Bottle. Pitch black beer with small, durable beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, strong coffee, roasty, with notes of caramel. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, chocolate, coffee, cocoa, nuts, roasty. Bittersweet cocoa and coffee in the finish. Medium+ body, average carbonation. Very well executed example of the style.

Black with a brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee and malt. Sweet with a burned bitter aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 20A). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch unknown (bottled on 11/10/16 - BBF unknown). AROMA: medium-high roasted malt aroma with notes of coffee and dark chocolate. background of grainy cereal, toffee and herbaceous hops. APPEARANCE: very dark brown color and opaque. slight ruby highlights. medium tanned head with good retention. FLAVOR: moderate-high roasted malt flavor with notes of coffee, dark chocolate, slight nuttyness. medium-high bitterness from hops and roasted grains. finishes dry, roasted and bitter. PALATE: medium-full body with a smooth creaminess. medium-low carbonation. very faint astringency. OVERALL: a very nice and enjoyable american porter.
Fat @Taphouse Kph. Mörkbrun öl med ett ljusbrunt skum. Doft och smak av mörkare choklad, hasselnötter och lätt rostad malt.
W aromacie mleczna kawa. Odrobina czekolady. Nic specjalnego. W smaku szaleństwo. Gorzkie kakao, czekolada. Dosyć wysoko nasycone.

deep dark brown colour, almost one inch dense brown head; aroma of dark chocolate, burnt plum jam, toffee, some coffee, hints of soy sauce and roasted nuts; taste of dark chocolate, dried plum, heavy roasted, almost burnt sunflower seeds, some unripe fruitiness (maybe apple, or even more likely pear), over-toasted rye bread, hints of syrupy notes...and dark chocolate again! amazing porter with a body, which would be perfectly enough even for an imperial porter!

Robe noire et opaque. Robe beige bien persistante. Arômes fumé, café, chocolat. Goût malté, chocolat et café. Le fumé reste en bouche. Texture crémeuse. La carbonatation est fine et peu abondante. 
Bon porter.
Medium roasted and caramel aroma. Black with medium tanned head. Bitter and medium sweet. Full body, bitter aftertaste.

Dark black pour with great brown head. Nose of coffee and chocolate. Flavor is big on roasted malt and nice bite of spice at the end. Great balance and not too much of any one flavor. Nice texture that leads to another sip.

From bottle (10 mo. old) in porter glass. Pours deep dark brown with tan head and aroma of chocolate and licorice. A bit more rich than most porters, maltiness gives way to bitterness on the palate and the licorice reappears

Bottle shared @Pułapka, Gdańsk
Very nice vanilla and strong coffee aroma. Taste is very roasted, with a coffee bitter finish

Aroma: Dark chocolate and coffee
Appearance: Black color with hazy liquid and brown rocky head.
Taste: Medium sweet notes behind heavy bitterness
Palate: Full body with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Long bitter chocolate finish. It remains nicely for a long time.
Overall: I definitely love porter beers. You expect something and you get that.

0.33 bottle. Pours pitch black, with a creamy head. Really nice aroma, you can already feel this is gonna be good: coffee, chocolate, warm roastiness. Taste is really balanced, everything is in the right amount. Couldnt find any off flavors. Nice, full body. Finish is surprisingly herbal. Very, very good!

Grifo en 99Cervezas. 
Vierte marrón oscuro completamente opaco, con espuma de café muy cremosa y adherente, compuesta de burbuja pequeña bastante persistente. Buena carbonatación con algunos hilos de burbujas subiendo a la superficie (sólo visibles en la parte exterior de la copa ya que es imposible ver nada más adentro). 
Intensa en nariz con notas predominantes de café y quizá aun más de regaliz. Notas secas leñosas y un punto herbal muy al fondo. También ciruela pasa bastante seca y melaza, como base de todo lo anterior. Gran complejidad en nariz en un conjunto extraordinariamente expresivo para ser una "simple" Porter. Casi hemos de comprobar su graduación (6,5% ABV) para asegurarnos de que no se trata en realidad de una Imperial Porter. 
De entre los sabores básicos destaca el amargo, con una buena base de dulce y un punto ácido. En el post-gusto el café y la regaliz compiten por reinar, aunque la evolución en boca acaba dando el mando al café, con un sabroso equilibrio final amargo-dulce-ácido. 
Es de cuerpo medio-alto, más bien sedosa, casi carnosa y ligeramente picante. Resulta sorprendentemente refrescante, sobre todo a partir del tercer trago, cuando nuestra lengua se ha acostumbrado a esta expresividad. 
Esta cerveza tiene la intensidad y el peso en boca de una Imperial Porter (o casi) con la bebestibilidad de una Porter normal más ligera. Todo un logro! Una bebida de trago medio que maridará muy bien con cerdo, ternera y sobre todo cordero, así como con quesos fuertes. Total y completamente recomendable. Para repetir siempre que se pueda.

0.33l bottle. Pitch black body with a brown head. Aroma of cocoa, chocolate and coffee with a hint of floral hops. Taste of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, some plums and floral hops. Very nice beer. It is more roasty and less fruity than a regular porter. I would call this a stout, but who cares about styles when the beer is this good?

Kinézetre tökéletes porter, éjfekete ital, krémes, bézs színű presszóhabbal a tetején. Aromái a kakaós nápolyis, erjesztett kávébabos, selymes étcsokoládés háromszög mentén helyezkednek el, ízjegyei is ilyen előjelek által szegélyezve öltenek testet egy sima szerkezetű, gömbölyded elemek olvadékony karaktere alkotta ízvilágban. Kakaós, üres kávés, pirított magvas, hamusra pörkölt malátás elemeit egy karcos, kesernyés komlós karakter helyezi keretbe, a kikezdhetetlen porter-élményt megkoronázva.

Nice pour with a full bodied head. Pours smoothly with an espresso brown appearance. Has a smooth taste which is remnisent of coffee and dark chocolate. I would recommend, however, after one I felt a fuller that I preferred.

Cerveja escura, quase preta, com luzes avermelhadas, creme bege de boa formação e duração. Aroma delicioso de café, cacau, levemente picante, com toques de lúpulos terrosos e notas muito tímidas de castanhas. O sabor predomina o tostado, café, boa presença de cacau e um final moderadamente amargo, com retrogosto persistente. O álcool se faz um pouco presente, mas de maneira bem equilibrada e inserida. Corpo médio, boa cremosidade. Uma porter exemplar.

Pours up dark black, with a thin tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate. Taste has dark chocolate, cocoa, subtle fruity esters, very light roast. Medium body, lots of chocolate, light coffee, and a touch of hops in the finish. Excellent.

Pours deep black with a beautiful brown frothy head. Aroma of dark malts, dark chocolate, deep roasted coffee and a slight nutty note. Flavour is very rich of dark chocolate, espresso coffee, fudge, brownie and a hint of licorice in the end. Rich velvety mouthfeel, medium to full body. So intense and beautiful!
Pours black, opaque with a tan head & an aroma of caramel and wood. Tastes robust of cocoa, malt & mild hops. Ever so slightly sweet. Full-bodied & very well balanced.

Last beer on my second flight in Devilicious, Temecula California on 10th Feb 2017. Another beer I found in this bar that I have wanted to try for ages, so pleased we were recommended this place. Jet black with a tanned top. Roasted, toasted malts in the nose, dark chocolate esters too. Taste has a little fruitiness, but the malts rule this easy drinking, smooth Porter: liked it a lot.

Flasa z beershop.sk. Cierna farba, hneda pena. Vona prazenych sladov, kava, prezrete ovocie, cokolada. Chut prezreteho cerveneho ovocia, horkej cokolady, kavy. Na konci suche kakao, kava. Dlha dochut. Plne telo, stredna nasytenost. Vyborne.

Flaske fra Vinmonopolet Jekta Tromsø delt med DjOeye. Aroma tørr duft, kaffenoter, sjokolade, vanilje. Utseende sort med beige skum. Smak kaffe, vanilje, sjokolade, mocca. En porter i egen klasse med god smak og balanse. Godt øl

Founders Porter:
Aroma; caramel pudding, vanilla nut, milky roasted malts, light chocolate, wow. 
Look; light brown head, black body. 
Taste; chocolate, caramel, dry prune, nuts, vanilla, milky chocolate, smooth cocoa 
and finishes soft tasty chocolate mocca. 
Feel; soft, gentle, fully. 
Overall; top taste, wonderful.

Black in color with a thin tan head that receeds quickly. Thin collar that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla and cherry. Silky texture. Medium-bodied. Sweet at first than finishes with a slight bitterness that lingers in the mouth. Taste like the dry Nesquick. With everything going on in this beer i understand the 100 out of 100. Great porter.
070217. Bottle at Artturi, Tampere. Pours black with a nice head. Aroma burnt malts, chocolate. Smooth bodied. Very well balanced. Not. Bad.

I had the good fortune of visiting Grand Rapids, Mi In 2014. Founders Brewery was the 1st stop on our itinerary as was the brewery store. I do not remember the food at the place, but the flavor, aroma and taste, ALL of their offerings were most impresive. Now that Im back in Kansas I highly recommend the Porter, Dirty Bastard and Oatmeal Stout.

Totalmente negra, espuma marrom de boa formação e média persistência. Aroma mais para cacau/chocolate, nozes, menor intensidade café. No paladar médio amargor torrado e médio dulçor de caramelo. Corpo cremoso e média carbonatação. Final de média persistência, trás mais nozes, leve baunilha e cacau, otimo drinkability.

Bottle. Petroleum black colour, medium-sized tan head. Good lacing. Intense roasted aroma that of malts and coffee. Some brandy. Medium body. Velvety mouth feel. Sweetish flavour brings the notes of coffee, dark chocolate, brandy. Light bitterness gives balance to it all. Good job. That said I am not really fond of beers with big dessert flavours like that.

No soy un entendido pero muy buena porter.
Negra opaca, con olor y sabor característico a malta tostada, con notas de café y chocolate.
Deja el paladar algo seco quizás.

Para repetir.

Pours black with brown silky head. Aroma is smooth mocha with dark and nutty fruit character. Flavor is musty and bittersweet with smoked chocolates dominating most of the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piana beżowa, średnio wysoka, gęsto zdobi szkło. Samo piwo w grubszym szkle jest właściwie czarne, nieprzejrzyste. W aromacie gorzka czekolada, wafelki czekoladowe,lekkie akcenty palone. W smaku bardziej już kawowe, orzechowe klimaty. Średnio pełne. Goryczka zaznaczona, przyjemna, trawiasta. Wysycenie raczej w stronę wysokiego, mogło by być mniejsze.
Przyjemne piwo, może momentami nieco pustawe. Wydaje mi się, że w tym wypadku większa butelka byłaby jak najbardziej na miejscu:P

Oh ja, a lover not a fighter. Schokoverführer mit diversen Stoutverweisen. Oatmealig, sanft, rosty und so gar nicht portertypisch. Schoko über alles!!! Nice und am Ende dann doch noch schlanker und rotbeerig. Good Stuff. Probierschluck vom lovely Barmann im ALTEN MÄDCHEN HH.

The appearance of this beer is like a stout pitch black with no light coming through at all, its actually darker than some of the stouts I have had. The smell is hops and chocolate with a hint of chocolate coming through. The taste is the same as the smell with coffee being the dominant taste with the piney hops taking over towards the end, and the chocolate not as noticeable in the taste as I would have hoped for it to be. This beer feels like a stout to me which might be why this is my favorite porter Ive had.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Bardzo klasyczny, wyśmienity porter.

kindly shared by Daniel @ CBCB tasting, thanks again! Aromas of chocolate, rum-raisins and dark chocolate cake, indeed a lot of milk chocolate in taste, light caramel and some coffee notes. Great texture, thoroughly balanced.

Chucks 85th, Seattle. Very creamy but thin head, very dark brown. Delicious roast body, smooth roast bitterness. Chewy body. Fantastic American porter example. Clean flavors, lovely balanced roast and dark chocolate nib. Very good.

Bottle - Aroma is not strong, and is of burnt cereal. Taste is of the usual suspects, coffee, burnt malts cereal, and coffee. Not a bad brew. Not sweet like their Breakfast Stout, and has a slight bitter taste, and noticeable bitter ending

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours thick and black from the bottle and leaves a large, creamy beige head. An aroma of rich dark chocolate greets the nose, accocmpanied by smokey slightly burnt notes. The taste is sweet chocolate up front, before sliding into a finish marked by both a light sourness and strong roasted bitterness. The body is heavy, smooth, and the brew has overall a rich, creamy feel in the mouth. I still prefer Anchor Porter, but this is excellent stuff.

Une bière noire opaque, avec une fine ligne de carbonatation. Au nez, le chocolat est fort présent, avec également beaucoup de café et une impression dalcool que lon ressent en plus. Au goût, limpression chocolatée est bien présente, avec un gout dalcool qui ne se laisse pas désirer. Après le chocolat et lalcool, on goûte fort bien le café avec le malt torréfié faisant bien son oeuvre. La bière me semble assez forte pour un 6,5% dalcool, ce qui lui enlève un peu de buvabilité. On perçoit une teinte damertume en finale. Au final cest un bon porter mais manque de buvabilité pour être vraiment exceptionnel.
Bottle. Lots of dark chocolate, cocoa, light vanilla, subtle fruity esters, very light roast, cookies. Medium body, lots of chocolate, light coffee in the finish. Excellent.
Pint at the brewery. silly and full body, chocolat and caffe creamy head. easy drink.

Btl pours a opaque black color, huge, billowing tan head that hangs around leaving doilies of lace on glass. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, toasted bread, malted milk balls and vanilla. Tastes of coffee,vanilla,bakers chocolate, roasted grain, spicy hops and alcohol. Full body, perfect carbonation, creamy mouthfeel and a slightly bitter and spicy finish. This is a beautifully designed porter bordering on perfect. Wonderful!

Black with a foamy light tan head. Lovely deep dark chocolate and doughnut like qualities with a bit of roast black malt. Semisweet flavor thats roasty and chocolaty and slightly caramelly, gentle Java tones, velvety and full bodied. Lovely and near perfect beer but perfect for the style.
12oz bottle pours black with tan head smells of root beer, taste was dark chocolate malt very nice.
Bottles bought in Traverse City and taken to Houston to enjoy at Thanksgiving. Malt, chocolate, and coffee. Good bitterness with full body. Drank a lot of it over the holiday and it never got boring.

- tiefschwarze Farbe mit sehr guter, cremiger Schaumbildung
- herrliche Aromen nach Trockenfrüchten, Espresso, Bitterschokolade, Kakao,
 Röstmalzen und eine Idee Rauch
- Carbonisierung wünschte ich mir einen Tick weniger
- die beschriebenen Aromen stellen sich schon im Antrunk in fantastischer Weise klar erkennbar nebeneinander dar
- der Körper ist wunderbar dicht und lässt den bittersüßen Lakritznoten genügend Platz zur Entfaltung 
- die Röstmalze bleiben bis zum Schluß bestimmend im Vordergrund ohne jemals aufdringlich oder übertrieben zu werden
Fazit: Porter mit einer sensationellen Aromenvielfalt
Один из лучших портеро& что я пил! Горький шоколад, немного жженки, реально топ, очень)
Chocolate/ coffee intense flavor, really deep and rich. This is absolutely fantastic, thickest and most creamy beer i have ever had. Sooo nice and cozy. I need more of this.
Very good porter. Otherwise too sweet at all, thick like a stout but clearly a porter, it has a nice coffee backbone. Good stuff.

Schöne dunkle Farbe toller schaum, im geruch sehr angenehm milchig rauchig leichte Vanille röstmalz, cremiges mundgefühl toller Geschmack röstmalz holzig rauchig milchig sahne cacao Kaffee aber irgendwie sehr ausgewogen tolles bier!

12oz Flasche. Dunkelbraun-schwarzes Bier mit cremigem hellbraunem Schaum. Sehr feine Nase. Mocka, Sahne, Haselnuss und etwas Cognac. Cremiges Mundgefühl. Bitter röstig im Antrunk. Leicht milchig. Wirklich ein tolles rundes Porter.

Black body small white head.
chocolate caramel
Creamy slighty better, very nice.

Pours dark brown with light beige head. Aroma is nuts, creamy, roast, butter, raisin, peanuts, bread. Taste is creamy, butter, vanilla, fat, some dark dried fruits, peanuts, some seeds, bread, roast. Very nice and balanced beer!

12oz bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a moderate tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, and vanilla. Taste is dark fruits, coffee, and some chocolate. Bitterness in the finish. Full-medium body. Soft carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel.

Roasted malts with well-hidden dark chocolate ending. Very thin to no foamy head. Dark color with full-body flavours. Medium bitterness and no hint of alcohol despite 6.5 ABV. Absolutely enjoyable porter.
19.11.2016 - Roasted malts with taste of coffee and bitter dark chocolate. Thick near black pour with creamy head. Bit of earthy hops.

Bottled on 09/08/16; Sampled November 2016
I had such an awful bottle of this years ago that I never rated it, now that it is available locally I have been meaning to try it for quite some time. A steady pour produces a three-finger thick, fairly dense consistency, deep brown stained, dark tan colored head. The beer is almost perfectly black, and is quite opaque when held up to the light. Visually this looks nothing like a modern Porter, much more like a rich dark stout. I wonder how the aroma and flavor will go?
The aroma smells of deeply charred grain, dark chocolate, smooth roasted coffee, deeply toasted whole grain brown bread, deeply caramelized malt aromatics, really just lots of brown, whole grain, and toasted malt notes play a huge role here.
The body is light and quite quaffable, given the visual, and the aromas, I was expecting this beer to be quite a bit more hefty; I am glad to be wrong, as I still was hoping for a Porter here. The flavor is deeply charred, but is balanced by a bright, caramelized sweetness. Lingering, bitingly bitter, burnt grain notes substantially dry out the finish; there is also a hop bitterness that supports the charred bitter notes. After a couple of sips, I notice that the body is on the rich side, with a certain viscosity that clings to the palate, but this is washed away by the lingering burnt bitter flavors in the finish. Burnt whole grain brown-bread toast, lots of caramelized maltiness, bitter, though rich, cold coffee, and ample dark chocolate flavors all play a prominent role as well.
This is the most stout like porter that I have had in a while; given the nebulous definition between the two, I can overlook that, but really since this is so tasty. I really dont care in the end, but I would be hard pressed to not say that this was a Stout in a blind tasting. I am so glad to be able to have a non-infected sample of this finally. In fact I may even have to buy this regularly; it can be hard to find really good, reasonably fresh, Stouts, err, I mean Porters, locally sometimes. Definitely an incredible beer.

15/20 not a huge fan of porters but this has a lot going for it. Still has that smoked aftertaste but this has huge espresso coffee and dark chocolate. Keeps its interest to the last sip. Dark, rich and sexy

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours black with a nice, tan head and lacing. The aroma is chocolate, coffee, and hops. The taste is chocolate, vanilla, coffee, and hops. The subtle sweetness blends with the bitterness of the coffee and hops and the roastiness. Its smooth. This is a very good porter.

A pitch black beer with a well lasting light brown head. Hoppy nose with notes of resin, coffee, chokolate and roasted barley. Sweet taste with a sweet chokolate flavor that leads to a roasty bitter finish. Soft creamy carbonation and rich palate. Extremely well balanced, smooth and drinkable beer with soft edges all around.

Opaque black sludge like appearance with a mid sized beige head. Pleasant aroma with notes of caramel, vanilla, mild roast, chocolate, and cream. Delectable flavour. Initial taste is roasty and hoppy, whereas the finish is an absolutely delightful coalescence of dried cherry, vanilla, milk chocolate, and caramel.
Zwart brouwsel, mooie plakkraag. Ruikt goed, koffie, chocolade, romig. De smaak is ook in die richting. Beetje bitter, weinig zoet. Medium body wat dunne afdronk.

Coloração escura com pouca e persiatente espuma bege. Aroma intenso de torrefação e café. Corpo baixo com boa carbonatação. Sabor intenso de café com toque de checolate. Retrogosto de torrefação persistente pedindo novo gole.
Bottle @home. Pours black with a tan head. Nose is coffee, chocolate slight caramel. Taste is coffee, chocolate, slight vanilla, slight licorice. Great wee beer.

From a bottle at Newark airport Vanguard restaurant. Pours a dark inky black and makes a nice tan head. Aroma is of chivalry and coffee. Tastes of cocoa and roasted barley. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Аромат отличны& благоро& но вот америка& хмелей я особо не заметил.

Chocolate and coffee aroma. Deep brown black color. Head dissipates quickly. Full body with creamy texture. Sweet chocolate flavor, like a milkshake, with warm alcohol finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from beer club. Pours black with thin tan head. Roast and chocolate nose. Dark chocolate, coffee, mild sweetness to taste. Very fine porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounces bottle from Craft Beer Cabin shared with brother. Aroma: ashes, smokey, chocolate and caramel aroma. App: moderate dark burgundy, minimal brown head, no lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, light medium sweetness, light medium ashes and bitter finish. Overall: not a big fan of ashes. This one is really focused on it. For the price point this is really a great deal but unfortunately after awesome beers like I just had it just feels OK. I sure wouldnt mind drinking this winter.

L:
-pours the darkest of brown with no light coming through and a medium,foamy,beige head
S:
-nutty,chocolate,oats,cognac,lavender,he coffee
-medium to high bitterniss for the style
F:
-low to medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Very nice Porter.I wished this had more of a coffee note thogh.

Well, no matter how much porters you drink, and how many times you thought that some porter is absolutely incredible, when you try this beer again, its still the best.
Well, when i tried it, I thought its the same feeling like when i tried my first beer in life. Absolute happiness and magic. Probably the best porter ever.
Incredible structure, hints of alcohol, but in a great way. Roasted malts, caramel, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, dried fruit (or something like plum). Its not to sweet, its not to bitter, its perfect balanced. Love it!

So unbelievably good. Rich, smooth, with a deep vein of coffee and chocolate malts followed by a bitter but reconcilable fade. Ive raved about this beer on so many different forums and sites I no longer know how to expound its glory without sounding insane. Worth the funny looks from people unnerved by my exuberance. Beer at its apex. Comfort in a bottle. Proof that inner peace is attainable.

Pours a dark brown with minimal head. Nose of chocolate. Taste is black licorice, with some dark chocolate. Velvety mouthfeel. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bastante buena. Es ligero en general. Tiene un sabor corto muy bueno, y el sabor largo es ligero

the aroma is caramel and chocolate with hints of roasted malt. vanilla, robust, toffee and toast... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of roasted malt. coffee, toast. toffee and brown sugar... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste... its really nice porter...
Вкусный портер, мягкий, сильный приятны& аромат, мощный вкус, много жженки во вкусе, легкая горчинк& приятно& продолж& послевк& Срок годност& до 24.03.17. (Bottle 0,355/ 6,5%)

Appearance: Very dark brown, basically black. Some dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, roasted, prunes?
Taste: Roasted, very dark malt. Some dark chocolate and coffee notes.
Bought: Vinmonopolet (Online), 355 ml, NOK 49.90
Info: 24/9-2016, BB: 3/10-2016

Porters are not usually my thing, but this is simply a delicious example of the style.

Love the chocolate notes and it just slips down so easily. Best black beer Ive had.

Bottle pours coffee-black with a lush tan, persistent head. Bittersweet chocolate and chicory nose, creamy, full-body palate with fresh carbonation from start to finish. Overall, excellent balance, not cloying at all, an outstanding job.

Pours as black as the night with a dark brown, medium sized, bubbly head.

Smells of sweet milk chocolate, toffee and leafy hops. Bakers chocolate and earthy cocoa nibs add to the well pronounced milk chocolate quality, with a flowery hint being able to cut through.

Has a lower carbonation and a pleasantly creamy, medium body, which screams chocolate all the way. Its finish though reveals a pungent dry and earthy crushed coffee bean appearance, which works incredibly well as an antagonist to the the initial chocolate sweetness.

Tastes of creamy milk chocolate from the get go, together with some dusty earth and a metallic hint, resulting from the initially noteable carbonation. Adds a toffee hint, as well as powdery bakers chocolate, remaining pleasantly balanced on the tongue, due to its gentle creaminess. Then there is suddenly absolutely nothing going on, but a totally calm ending which does not even turn watery, just producing a subtle dry hint. This is the part I love most about this beer. Its coffee finish, which picks up on all the prominent chocolate flavors, while adding the most creamy and dry long lasting aftertaste you can imagine. It truly takes it time to become recognizable, but once its there, it completely redefines the beer. In a good way.

Man this is lovely, what an overlooked gem on my end with so many hyped beers getting released on a daily basis nowadays. This features actually everything which made me interested in craft beer years ago. It is way different than your industrial brewed Lager, well balanced and features an enigmatic thumbprint. It remains easy drinkable throughout, while providing such a satisfying depth, with a world class twist between chocolate and coffee.

Bottle from Stone shared. Lots of deep, rich cacao notes on the nose, some dark fruit as it warms. More cacao and fruit on the palate with some light vanilla undertones. Rich and decadent, but very nice.
Bottle, thanks Will. Nice roasty, bit of cream vanilla, aroma is cocoa powder, nice. Light spice.
Great Beer. Rich, decadent, at only 6.5% drinks much bigger. Nice velvety body. Would drink this by the pint on tap - in a UK pint I think...

Appearance : medium beige head Black
 Aroma : cocoa coffee cholcolate
 Taste : same as aroma roasted malt finish dark chocolate
 Palate : Thick bodied
Great First porter

Flaska från Alko, Åbo, Finland. Förutom lite kolabruna inslag så är det en näst intill kolsvart vätska, med högt gräddbrunt skum. Fina portertoner i doften med rostade inslag i förgrunden som drar åt pumpernickel, kaffe, choklad, lakrtis, grädde och lätt nötiga drag. Mellanstor kropp, något lenare. Smakmässigt drar den åt det något kärvare hållet. De rostade och nästan lite brända tonerna ligger i förgrunden här med, än mer än i doften. Pumpernickel, tjära, kaffe, choklad, kola och grädde. Stor, snygg och sammanhållen smakmässigt, från början till slut. Växer till sig i munnen och eftersmaken går över i en ännu kärvare kaffebeska som drar åt bränd brödkant smakmässigt. Känns väldigt stiltypisk, och gör det väldigt bra. Gott rakt igenom.

Strong malty aroma. Thick black appearance with cream colored head. Strong chocolate flavor up front with roasted malt finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Pours black with medium beige head. Aroma has cocoa and coffee. Taste is malty, chocolaty and quite subtle. Some booze. Quite oily. Thick bodied. Pretty long lasting malt in the end. Nicely balanced porter.

De color marrón intenso casi negro con algunos destellos café a contraluz, corona de espuma color beige de buena retención, con burbujas compactas y abierta. En el aroma notas a café, grano tostado, algo ligeramente ahumado, umami, un poco de chocolate. En boca sigue al aroma, predomina el café y el grano tostado, además del gusto ahumado y umami, ligero dulzor y acidez presente pero muy ligera sin llegar a ser astringente, amargor medio bajo.

Very well balanced porter. Leans toward the dryer / non sticky or thick mouth feel. Notes of chocolate and coffee in the taste. A great cool fall day beer. One of my favorite styles. Great beer overall.

Bottle. Opaque black color with tanned head. Aroma has dark chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruits. Taste is malty with quite long bitter aftertaste. Flavors of roasted malt, dark fruits, dark chocolate, coffee and vanilla.

Opaque. 
Full body, velvety, moderate flavor, avg heat and length. 
Bitter, moderately dry, crisp. 
Intense dark roast coffee flavor, simple profile. 
Tastes more like a (Irish?) stout, richer mourhfeel than a porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home (03/21/16). Pours dark with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, malts, light roastedness, coffee, vanilla. Taste is moderate bitter and sweet, creamy chocolate, roasted malts, hops, coffee, bitter chocolate malty aftertaste with a hint of hops. Creamy, but still a bit thin maybe. Very nice nonetheless.

Silky, smooth and sexy indeed! The best porter on the market. Period. Caramel and chocolate malt driven with a smooth roast in the background. Pitch black appearance with a dark brown head. There is nary a note missed here.
355ml bottle. Pours pitch black with small beige head. Burnt, ash, caramel and coffee. Creamy mouthfeel.

From a 355ml bottle on 28/8/2016. Pours a dark, dark brown with a tiny tan head. The nose is very chocolatey and malty. Masses of chocolate present on tasting, with some molasses, and a moderate roasty bitterness finishing things off at the back. Tne texture is creamy and the carbonation average. A very good porter.
Roasty caramel aroma, dark black color and brown head. Taste like coffee, very bitter and a little sour. Quite creamy in the mouth. Long finish. Great porter.
Bottle. Almost black, brown foam. Aroma: burnt barley, caramel, roasted malt.Taste: caramel, burnt, little wine, velvety, light sweetness and hop bitterness. Good.

A strong malty smell, dark aroma of coffee and roasted malt. The head is small, beige and creamy, the body is black. A quite bitter taste, very malty with coffee and chocolate. The body is medium strong, oily and light creamy with a soft carbonation.

Cor negra com espuma marrom escura (de capuccino) de média formação e média persistência com bom lacing.
Aroma intenso de cacau e baunilha; com elevação da temperatura percebe-se notas de chocolate amargo e um pouco de álcool.
Sabor intenso de cacau com final de leve dulçor de chocolate, migrando para um retrogosto de leve torrado de café. Alcool perfeitamente inserido, sendo perceptível apenas com a elevação da temperatura.
Corpo médio e baixa carbonatação.
Bottle - Pours Black, tan head. Dark roasted grains, coffee, chocolate, sweet, earthy, soy sauce.... hops presence. Creamy mouth-feel.

AROMA-Rich malt aroma, dark caramel, maillard product, darkfruit, hint of coffee, faint hint of smoked malt. Hop aroma is light citrus mixed with malt very well. Balance is very well even. Slight oxdation feeling but pleasant.
APPEARANCE-Very dark brown color. Tan head. Lacing.
FLAVOR-Moderate dark caramel sweet, well balanced with darkfruit and prune and citrus hop flavor. Black chocolate flavor, with faint hint of milk. Finish is dry, light alcohol, light oxidation. Hop bitterness is between medium to medium-hight supported the sweet just right. Aftertaste is black malt, sweet and bitterness, very good, but with a light astrigency, had a slight woody feeling.
MOUTHFEEL-Medium body. Carbonation is medium-high, slight astringency and biting.
OVERALL-Excellent porter.

Tap at Founders. Lots of blackberries, dark chocolate, brown sugar, some stale coffee too. Quite sweet with soft roasted bitterness. Over medium bodied with slick feel. Nice beer but a bit weird for a porter.

0.33 draft.   A pitch black color with a small, brown head of average retention. A sweet aroma of dark fruits, malts, roast, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is also sweet, very malty, wood, coffee, and chocolate carry over from the aroma but it also introduces some honey. A full body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is long, sweet, and strong - doesnt really differ from the main flavor. Overall the beer is quite good.

Pours black with a thick brown head. Rich roasted nut, coffee and chocolate aroma. Bitter but smooth flavor. Velvety mouthfeel. This is pretty much the textbook example of a porter, and I love it. Give me more.

Musta olut tummanbeigellä vaahdolla, joka katoaa kohtalaista vauhtia miltei kokonaan. Tuoksussa suklaata, paahteisuutta ja lakritsia. Maku paahteinen, suklainen, hieman kahvinen ja vain hieman katkera. Aavistus vaniljaa myöskin. Pehmeä makeus hallitsee yleisilmeeltään. Keskitäyteläinen suutuntuma. Pehmeää ja liukasta juotavaa, runko voisi olla aavistuksen vahvempikin.
De bomba de ma al Beerlinale. Cervesa amb aromes torrats i regalèssia potent. Color negre, cos mig-baix i carbonatació molt baixa. Final mig-sec amb regust de regalèssia. Bona!
Bottle in Dublin. Pitch black colour,medium brown head with good retention. Nose is roasted coffe and roasted malts. Taste is also roated with low smoke. Nice

0.355 l bottle from P&M Getränke, best before November 2016 (according to the annoying import label). Pitch black with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, light brown head. Sweetish-malty, lightly roasty aroma of milk chocolate, milk coffee, hazelnut and vanilla. Sweet, malty and slightly roasty taste of milk chocolate, milk coffee, toasted nuts, some vanilla and a touch of licorice, followed by a short, moderately roasty-bitter finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice one, but expected more. Tasty, but rather ordinary Porter, especially the mouthfeel does not fully convince.

Shared 12 oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Nose is Roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt and chocolate and coffee notes. Finish had some disconcerting mineral undertones. Nevertheless, its still a good porter.

Aroma: coffee and chocolate with dark roasty notes; Appearance: pitch black with off white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: rich and roasty, smooth and delicious; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: great porter; would definitely buy again if in the mood for the style.
Bottle. Black pour. Aroma of smooth roasted malt, soft caramel, licorice, cream and chocolate. Full taste of caramelised malt, licorice, chocolate and bitters. Long finish. Good porter.
Черное со слабой карбони& Во вкусе шоколад, немного карамел& ярко выражен вкус чёрной корочки

Ein gutes, aber nicht besonders Porter.
Leichte Süße, erdig, leichte Hopfenbittere. 
Insgesamt etwas enttäuscht.

Aroma is heavy on chocolate and sweet malt and dark roast. Pours a dark stout-like black, with khaki head. Taste has some chocolate sweetness, decent bitterness. Full palate, creamy, effervescent, with a slightly bitter and crisp finish. This is what other porters wish they could be. Defines the style.
Mmmmmmm.. täyteläinen, kuiva ja kantava portteri. Taattua Founders laatua. Kivasti salmiakkinen.

Bottle - pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is rich chocolate, some sweetness, soy sauce and roast malt. Taste is roast malt, chocolate up front, then a dry lingering roast malt finish. Creamy full palate.

This one has a great body and slick chocolatey flavor but it does suffer from some metallic, copper overtones that dont give it the robust flavor I look for in a porter. The carbonation is somewhat lacking too.

Poured from a bottle. Substantial off-white head that lasts quite awhile, some decent lacing. Dark chocolate brown. Delicious chocolate aroma, and the taste includes chocolate, cherry, and vanilla. Creamy rich texture. Tastes stronger than a 6.5% ABV, which is a good thing.

Schwarz und nahezu blickdicht mit einem hellbraunen Schaum präsentiert sich das Porter aus dem Hause Founders.
In der Nase zeigen sich tolle kräftige Aromen von Kaffee und dunkler Schokolade. Im Mund überrollen diese Aromen die Geschmacksnerven, ohne zu süß zu sein oder parfümiert zu wirken. Dann tritt das Röstmalz mit seiner Röstbittere in den Vordergrund und klingt nur langsam ab. Das Bier hat einen schweren fast öligen Körper, der Alkohol ist präsent, aber alles andere als störend.

Eine tolles Porter, mit einem dunkler Schokolade kombiniert eine perfekte Dessert-Kombi!

355ml bottle. Pours a thick dark brown with a fine mocha head of larger central bubbles. Smooth chocolate, coffee, and sugary cream on the nose. Possesses a decided initial milkiness, followed by bitter coffee and 90% chocolate richness. Dry mouthfeel. Very enjoyable, with an overall smooth blend of flavours.

355ml bottle from The Perfect Pour. Pours opaque black with a medium brown head. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, hints of coffee. Initial hit of sweetness upon tasting, met quickly by a balancing bitterness, similar notes coming through.

Pint on tap at Kloster, Madrid. Pours blackest pitch black, dark tan thick head. Aroma is mainly espresso coffee (would be nice to match them). Also hints of smoke, soil and pure cocoa. Silky and oily, rich and well-balanced. Long nice finish, with the right bitterness.

Smell of chocolate, licorice. Black colour, high dark brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, tar, ash. Ashy and slightly dry palate. Bitter. Mid-heavy body, could be expected to be heavier. Soft carbon. Very nice and balanced.

12 oz bottle: Dark brown color with a tan head. Dark chocolate powder aroma. Roasted hazelnut, lightly burnt caramel flavor. Pretty light body and a crisp carbonation, a little too crisp and light. Decent.

Drinking 355ml bottle on Kvittfjell in Norway. Dark almost black color with a light brown foam. Seems to be a bit of a metallic smell to it, but I find a lot of chocolate and nutty aromas as well. The roasted notes in the taste are pleasant and you got a very long aftertaste with a smooth bitterness. I also taste some cherry and dried fruits. I could imagine this beer will only improve if stored for a longer period of time.

Bottle, 355ml. Opaque dark reddish with a frothy brown head. Deep aromas of roasted caramel, chocolate. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet with low bitterness and a subtle acidity. Very pleasant.

Bottle, 355ml. A dark beer with a red hue and a small brown head. Aroma is of chocolate, nuts and dried fruits. Taste is moderately bitter with a roasted malt and chocolate character. Medium to robust bodied, smooth and a somewhat smoked aftertaste.
Beautiful dark color. Lovely aroma of chocolate and vanilla and other great things. Wonderful mouthful of flavors.

Ink black with a frothy 2-finger head that dissipated slowly and left modest lace. Roasted coffee is strongest in the aroma, along with dark fruits like plums and raisins. Taste followed the smell, with the fruits coming in stronger than they were on the nose, with a slight hops bitterness that materializes late. Gentle smokiness throughout. Moderate carbonation, medium body and a pleasant warming alcohol presence.
From a bottle. Cant believe I havent tried this before, its everything I expected in a great example of style, loved it.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 355ml bottle. Pours an almost black with a weak brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark fruits resin. Taste is roasted malt, some dark fruits and chocolate notes. Bunt malt, resin aftertaste. Excellent!

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 Pours thick like burnt oil, very little foam. Intense coffee nibs aromas present at first, dark Mexican chocolate second. Alcohol content is not obvious, intense earthy tastes throughout, Italian espresso, burnt sugar. Great beer.

Quarter of a litre at Celle Bierfest. Almost jet black, opaque, extreme tanned head.Lots of lacing, clung to the glass. S: More hops than other porters but not overly pronounced, gave way to a some fruits. T: High on sweetness and molasses, dwarfed the dark chocolate and espresso, finished like a Belgian dubbel. M: Thick texture, really smooth, silk in a glass. O: Good desert beer, really slid down well.

A macchiato with one sugar. Silky smooth & luscious - full of darkness but perfectly balanced. A good all round porter. 

Rated by BrewTom

Pours a pitch black color with medium tan colored head. Roasty aroma, coffee, dark fruits, molasses, with cocoa and also a vinous character. Taste follows the aroma, very roasty, with molasses, toffee, coffee, chocolate, licorice and slightly vanilla, with a hoppy and bitter finish to it.
Fruit notes in the aroma that transfers in the body. Coca malt balances the robust profile.

Pours head-high with minimal lacing after; appears rich and shutter-dark, with plum highlights when held against the sunlight. Smells like alcohol-infused pumpernickel bread with a tinge of citrus. The taste is sweeter than it is bitter due to the preponderance of roasted malt, but the hop presence here is a little stronger than a traditional porters. Mouthfeel is chewy and thick, and the aftertaste of black coffee (or 80% dark chocolate, if you prefer) lingers. Very drinkable even for people who dont like bitterness because the malt defines the direction and the result is more like a chunk of slightly sweetened dark chocolate than a handful of mountain ash berries or a stringent aperitif.

To jest to co Tygryski lubią najbardziej. Pachnie niesamowicie.
W nos uderzają nuty czekolady, kawy z mlekiem, ciesteczek ala Pieguski, kakao.
Okraszone jest to umiarkowaną, nienachalną palonością. Aromat jest głęboki i cholernie przyjemny.
Piwo nalewa się z ogromną, kremową, puszystą pianą. Otacza ona bardzo szeroko ścianki szkła pozostawiając na nich masę pajęczynek. Bardzo długo utrzymuje się na powierzchni.
Kolor nieprzejrzyście czarny.
Na podniebieniu wyczuwalne nuty gorzkiej czekolady, kakao i kawy. Akcenty palone zaczynają wydobywac się z oddal i coraz mocniej zaznaczać swoją obecność.
Piwo początkowo wydaje się dość wytrawne. Po kilku łykach można się przyzwyczaić do tego smaku i wyłapać trochę słodyczy.

Piwo nie jest aż tak gęste jak bym tego oczekiwał, aczkolwiek wodnistym też bym go nie nazwał.
Pijalność dość wysoka, jednak daleka od sesyjności.
Dobre piwo z małym minusem.
At Gourmet Experience, after lunch with Pedro & David. In wine cup. Enjoyable but too much expensive for what it is (4.5?) Watery texture body but with a good hops background that compensates it

355 ml bottle. Jet black, thin tan/mocca head. Aroma is beautiful, dark bitter chocolate, cocoa, roasted malts, tar and pipe tobacco. Mouthfeel is rich, bitter and creamy with a long aftertaste. Flavours reflects the aromas, and reinforce them further. Fantastic beer.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Pitch black, medium beige head. The aroma does not knock one down, yet it is subtle and fine - sweet hot chocolate, light roast and hoppy spice. The taste is lightly sweet, well balanced between sweet chocolate, light roast and a moderate spicy bitter finish. A subtle and well-crafted beer.

Dark brown almost black with a tan head that disappears quickly. Aroma of caramel and toffee with roasted malts. Medium body with lots of bitterness from the black malts. Silky mouth feel with lots of malt. Filling finish. An excellent everyday porter for the working masses.

Negra opaca. Muy abundante espuma beige, compacta y muy duradera. Aspecto excelente. Aroma no muy marcado. Notas tostadas y de café. Textura cremosa, muy suave al paladar. El sabor es magnifico. Muy malteada, notas ahumadas, chocolate. Grande.
Classic roasted malt aroma, coffee, cocoa powder. Dark, opaque brown, creamy beige head. Full bodied for a porter, finish dries out nicely though with cocoa powder, espresso and hop notes.

Dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma is really intense with milk chocolate and sweet, roasted malts. Taste follows, sweet, chocolatey with a bitter finish and coffee flavor. Body is really smooth with soft carbonation. This might be the best porter I ever had. Creamy, tasty but really easy to drink.

Pours a nice brownish black color. Aromas of espresso, chocolate, and a hint of bitter smoke. Flavor has a burnt chocolate/coffee taste to it, just a touch of hops coming in at the end. Damn fine porter.

Look: dark brown. almost black, opaque, clear. Brown unstable head.

Aroma: raw cocoa, bitter black chocolate with dark dried berries, overall it has very intense aroma.
Taste: dry with burned and hoppy bitternes.
Rich flavour: natural cocoa powder, black coffee, vanilla oak notes.

Very good with bitter-dry-chocolate balance.
Just as the commercial deScription reads. . . sweet malt aroma, full body, full flavor, creamy head . . .this Porter gets added to my short list of favorites of any style.

Smells of roasted barley caremal and chocolate. Nice rich deep black color. Tons of chocolate flavor with smooth finish of roasted malts. Med body which is lighter for a porter with clean crisp carbonation and smooth creamy finish. This brew is one smooth operator. Nice work.

Pours a dark black with thick dark brown head. A sweet chocolate and light roasted malt aroma, but not strong. A heavy body beer with a taste of chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malts. A strong sweet and dry roasted malts.

355ml bottle from Beer Cartel, Sydney. Poured a dense an impenetrable brown - or is it black? - colour with a small and creamy, somewhat lasting and lacing dark tan to light brown head. Such a good beer. Dark, dried fruits - raisin, prune - rum, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Its all here. So smooth, so moreish. Rich without being sickly. In a word: balanced. Medium to full in body with a soft and creamy palate texture. Finishes long and subtly bitter but the dried fruits, chocolate and vanilla carry on and on.

Pours a dark mahogany brown. Excellent aroma of toasted dark malts, dark fruits, dark chocolate, and caramel. Taste is dark malts, dark chocolate, vanilla, toffee, caramel, and dark fruit. Great balance. Great flavor. My standard for Porter.

The color is a impenetrable black with a tan head.

Aroma did not strike me honestly, but dark chocolate and roasted coffee are very strong in the nose and mouth too.

Full bodied, thick and low carbonated, well balanced between the sweet and bitter.
It almost gives the impression of something like a milk-based drink.

Elegant like the lady on the label.

Bottle to shaker glass, pours BLACK. Two finger creamy tan head. Some lacing with a decent small cap of retention. Aroma of dark roasted malt and dark chocolate. Taste is wonderfully balanced, moderate sweet, ample bitterness. Full bodied, moderate carbonation, creamy mouth feel. Finishes long. Tasting notes of toffee, dark chocolate, hazelnuts, vanilla, coffee, pumpernickel, raisin and slight smoke. I must say this is the best porter Ive ever tasted, worthy of its 100 rating!

12 ounce bottle purchased at Hy-Vee in Cedar Rapids, Iowa while visiting with my wifes family ($1.99). Founders did just recently arrive in San Diego, but maybe this is better closer to the source?? POURS a very dark brown / near-black with one finger of brown foam. AROMA of toasted dark malts, roasted nuts, deep rich chocolate, creamy coffee, and mild vanilla. FLAVOR of nice dark chocolate, nutty gourmet coffee, roasted and slightly burnt malts, toasted caramel, and perhaps some stewed dark fruit. Lingering roastiness into the finish. Smooth mouthfeel yet nicely full-bodied considering the ABV. Quite nuanced for the style (and without any adjuncts like maple or bacon), a quaffable and winning porter. (2001, 1017)

Noir très, très sombre, avec un col moyen marron. Larôme intense du malt torréfié, café et chocolat. En bouche cest très onctueux, plein du corps et presque lourd, avec un tas du café et chocolat équilibré une bonne finale amer. Très intense, pas du tout facile à boire, mais cest une bière pour savourer.
Had my eye on this one for awhile, why did i wait so long. So much better than the sampler fodder this is going on my favs list. Delivers as advertised. Rich, roasted, perfect for any occasion.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Babo. Dense black, cocoa and coffee aroma. Smooth, milky, nice hop kick that mingles with a burnt chocolate and resin flavour.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2016 Bottle. Average carbonation. Sweet, balanced chocolate, coffee, caramel, and malt flavors; slightly burnt coffee flavor. Lingering malty finish. Hits all the right flavor notes, without being boozy or overwhelming in any one flavor note. Another perfect example of a porter that doesnt have to have a high ABV to be potent and satisfying. Delicious!
Chocolate and smokey notes with nice roasted malt. Very decently well done porter.
Surprisingly dominate smoke in the aroma. Slightly sour coffee light chocolate aroma. Not my style.
Malty and rich, caramel note, heavy on coffee and licorice. Overall a really great beer, although not 100.
Pours pitch black. Aroma: a lot of rasted malt, chocolate and coffee with red fruit. Taste is complex, malty, roasty, with a good long palate. Compley and v in teresting beer.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, ashy, burnt malt, bitter chocolate, red fruits.
Appearance: black color and brown head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, roasted malts, ashy, warming alcohol, smooth texture, coffee, bitter chocolate.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Really complex and roasted porter.
Keg @ Victorian Craft Beer Café, Halifax. Black with a gritty, but crisp and light roasted malt aroma and taste, with it being slightly more pronounced in the former.

6.5%ABV. Porter. 

Nose had some really rich aromas of chocolate, coffee, maple syrup, stewed fruit and just a little over-ripe stone fruit. Maybe even the rich sweet funk of honeyed dates. 

Mouthfeel was syrupy. Palate. Licorice, coffee and the broad vegetal sweetness of root vegetable, I got arrowroot. Prunes. Stone fruit. Herbal. Molasses. Asian tasting notes: cooling tea, lo
han go, licorice root. 

Finish is medium and predictably sweet and dark.

Goes on Favorites List!
Draft at Centifontis. Very dark pour with a quickly dissipating head. Aromas of chocolate and other malts. Flavors were right up there with all amazing porters. Fantastic beer.

Black with rimming brown head; aroma is richly roasty notes of coffee slight hint of vanilla; flava is rich roasty and tangy malt with hoppy spice; feels medium with moderate fizz; finishes roasty dry softly bitter

33cl bottle from our lovely monopoly. Almost black color with rim rounded white head. Nose is clear malty with notes of autumn leaves & liqourice root. Palate is lively and balanced at the same time - brew has high IBU and crisp carbonation which bring the flavours with rich way. Real porter made with pride.
Aroma of roasted, some chocolate and some caramel. Taste is roasted, malt, some coffee and some dark chocolate. Bitter finish, but still well balanced, A very nice porter.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2016 Tap @ Keg & Brew. Jet black with minimal head. Aromas of coffee, cola, campfire, vanilla, chocolate and caramel. Deep, rich flavours of chocolate, coffee, a lick of smoke and burnt toffee. Beautiful rich palate. Magnificent beer.

Best porter/stout I've had yet and this is a category I didn't like at first. This one is super smooth, velvety, and full of chocolate flavor. I still have a hard time detecting the coffee in this category. This I will definitely buy again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355ml bottle at home. Thick black with a good tan head. Sweet toasted malt aroma with some coffee notes. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, a hint of liquorice and a peppery finish. Fantastic

Black color and nice head.
Aroma of toasted malt.
Taste is bitter with a lot of 'coffee' and roasted notes.
Nice porter
Kivääritehtaankadulla 2/2016. Very enjoyable, balanced porter. Lots of roasted malts and wonderful hop character.

Pours blackwith one finger of tan head. Very nice lacing as it goes down. Aromas of black coffee, rich dark chocolate, roast malt and hints of cream, and burnt toffee. Flavor follows the nose begining with rich and deep notes of roast malt, black coffee and bitter cocoa and toffee. Middle continues this flavor, adding bittersweet chocolate and light burnt caramel. Finish is roasty and bitter with notes of coffee with cream, black coffee and roast malt along with a light sweet caramel. Aftertaste is of burnt toast and roast malt. Mouthfeel thick, creamy and velvety smooth with moderate carbonation. This is a fantastic porter, well deserving of all the accolades

Looks and pours like any other porter. Smooth like Fullers London porter, but more flavorful. No harsh leafy tastes like cheaper porters. By far the best porter Ive ever had, save for Funky Buddas Maple Coffee Bacon porter.

Nearly black in color; modest tan head.

Lots of roasted aromas, coffee and a touch of chocolate. A general bitterness from the hops.

Mild to moderate sweetness; medium to slightly heavy bitterness.

Full bodied; slightly thick, oily texture; average carbonation; finish is is long, sweet, bitter chocolate and roasted coffee.

Overall a very good porter; rich and flavorful with reasonable complexity.

Pours a dark, dark brown with a 1/2 inch dark, tan head. Has the smell of dark chocoloate/good coffee. Has a medium body with a wonderful burst of flavors - chocolate, coffee, light hints of hops, and a sweet finish with just a little bit of pleasant bitterness. Tremendous.

Bottle. Hazy dark black pour with tan head. Nose is roasty dark malt, cacao, caramel, hops. Full bodied flavor with a hefty mouthfeel, ample dark malt, and well integrated finishing hops. A masterpiece.

Bottiglia 33cl. Porter elegante, colore marrone scurissimo con schiuma fine beige. Profumo di malto, cioccolato fondente e caffè. Equilibrata, non aggressiva, corpo leggero, bassa carbonazione. Malto e finale caffè.

This lovely lady pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Malty. Smells of coffee, dark chocolate, bit of smoke, prunes and caramel. Medium to full bodied. Smooth and perfectly balanced with rich malty flavours. Nice medium-long coffee-like aftertaste.

Dark brown colour with beige head leaving lots of lacing to the sides of the glass. Aroma has dark chocolate, milk coffee and roasted malts. Taste is sweet, dark chocolate dominates and some roasted and coffee flavours come in the end. Oily texture and lowish carbonation.

Bottle bbe 02/08/16. Black with tan head, low carbonation. Aroma mild, chocolate, caramel. Taste dry, chocolate caramel. finishes dry with piney bitterness and coffee. Solid porter/stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great porter on tap. Nice mouthful dark with a shallow white head. Best porter I have had in a while. Better than some stouts I have had.

35 cl bottle. Pours a very dark ruby with a light espresso head. Smells like smoke, roasted malts and dark chocolate. Bitter-sweet taste, lots of dark chocolate, roasted grains, a bit of lactose. Very well balanced, not too sweet, not too bitter, not too sharp. Smooth mouthfeel and a nice aftertaste.

Bottle. Black. Nose of cane sugar, toffee, cashews. Sweet creamy taste. The hops are present in a fantastic design. Great porter to have in a cold night. I'd rather have a breakfast stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A fine porter though I think I am drinking it at the wrong temperature. I will allow my next bottle to warm a bit. It is a hearty glass of brew with beautiful color and nice lacing.
355ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate with a little vanilla. Full and rich, some metal? Nice.

Pours dark with a thin mahogany head. Smooth while staying true to the porter heaviness expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 Very dark brown, big light brown head. Aroma has rich roast barley, coffe notes, a hint of hops. Nice coffee, chocolate taste, hops are subtle till they emerge on the finish.
Bottle. Body is pitch black with beige head which dissapears quickly. Nose is roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is roasted malts with moderate bitterness. Makes the reference for the Porter style.

Bottle. Black, small beige head. Aroma strong espresso, taste and finish follow. Overall very clean straight coffee experience.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A complex brew, served too cold, is not served well. American refrigerators, and the individuals and bars that employ these devices, have a lesson to be learned at their peril. Certainly, the exquisite Trappistes, the quads, tripels, dubbels, lose quite a bit of their charm with increasing frostiness. So too those robust and flavorful darker brews like this fine porter. Complexity is decreased by coolness, appreciation as well. Regardless, the fine Founders Porter is a dish best served... warmer, perhaps at 50F. So much for that. Wanting to know how good this is? Read the previous 1,961 reviews, which will tell you that this is an excellent dark brew that defines what an American porter is all about these days. A keeper.

Pours black with medium, tight, espresso head that lasts a bit and leave some skim.
Aroma touches the porter notes: coffee, chocolate, burnt toffee, figgy sweetness. Its drier on the palate, coffee leavened by a hint of chocolate and toffee, but fruit less in evidence. Light to medium-bodies and very smooth until a somewhat bitter finish.
This is a very good American version of the style.

Black color with a tan silky head. Malty nose with dark chocolate, nutty and earthy aroma. Full body with a grainy slightly floral flavor. Smooth mouthfeel, very little carbonation. Strong drying and warming finish. An intense porter with a slightly bitter finish.
Black pour, tan silky head. Malty nose with dark chocolate and roasty aromas. Heavy roasted taste with slightly bitter finish. Smooth mouthfeel, very little carbonation. Good porter overall.
Very tasty.....Silky Smooth! Overall..........just........a.........Very....... via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Erzbierschof Zurich. Roasty aroma, but not so strong. Good harmony of chocolate and caramel though. Well-balanced throughout and pretty dry. I would prefer it with a hint of sweetness.

On Tap at Melt Easton. Founders Porter is a deep inky black opaque brew with a fine head of tiny mocha bubbles. Nose is darkly roasted malt, smoke and a little dark chocolate. Taste is very similar. Rich, roasted malt, toasted cereals, coffee and again smoke. The body is medium to full. A very impressive porter.

Dark brown body that holds up a creamy, thick, long lasting tan head.
The aroma has cocoa powder, roast malt and a bit of coffee.
The flavor starts with a touch of bitter roast malt, then the sweet malts provide support with chocolate and the coffee.
Very solid Porter.

Pours pitch black with brown lace. Roasted, mild coffee, chocolate, slightly fruity aroma. Round and very smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours nearly black with a light brown, medium-sized head. The aroma offers roasty dark maltiness and some solid plummy fruitiness with caramel and rye pudding  sweeter and fruitier than many other porters. Taste is light to medium sweet, roasty and robustly malty. Chocolate and coffee combine with dark fruity flavours. Sweetness is excellently kept in check despite low hop levels; the aftertaste is already quite dry, even slightly bitter. Velvety smooth, creamy, medium to full bodied palate, quite silky to drink. Rich flavours perfectly in balance  classic porter.
Well done. Good roasted aroma. Nice dark and viscous appearance with a thin head. Smooth texture. Blended extremely well with roasted malt, earthy coffee and some chocolate.
Bottle. Pour is black with a caramel frothy head, aroma is toffee, malty, sweet. Taste is toffee, malty, burnt coffee bitterness, sweet. Very good

Poured in a dimpled mug - its midnight brown with a thin velvety tan head. A big nose full captures chocolate milk, kona coffee, peat and burnt marshmallow. The mouthfeel is refined and silky while maintaining a roasty flavor and full bodied character. Yum - more chocolate milk, coffee and a long roasty aftertaste.

Founders Porter is about as good a quality porter as you can get. Dark pour with decent head. Aroma of malt and chocolate. Taste is a nice balance between chocolate and coffee malts with a hint of cherry to make it interesting. Founders Port is dead on.
Charred oak, peanuts, charcoal aroma. Cola black, thin tan head. Charred oak, hints of charred beef, but not overly meaty. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, frothy. Nice and roasty.
Dark brown, almost black, with a dark tan head. Sweet, dark chocolate aroma. Roasty, smooth, very nice.

One of the best Porters Ive ever tasted. Rich, smooth, velvety, with a fantastic lenght. Not too sweet, not too bitte; everything is in its place.
Well done!
Bottle. Quite a good beer. The taste is thick but not that strong. Theres some smoke there too.
Bottle from Alko. Black with medium non lasting head. Burned and coffee. Bitterness with dry finish. Medium dry.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Draft, Cato's.
Thick, filmy, lacy, almost nitro looking head. 
Rich, fresh espresso. Background of clean fruity esters but so minimal it serves to only compliment with complexity. Silky smooth up front, turns to a slightly bitter, metallic taste, before finishing with a milk and dark chocolate creaminess. The balance of rich malt and subtle body make for a dangerously enjoyable drinking experience. Finish has of iced coffee and Hersey syrup disappears quickly to a chalky, coco powder lingering feel, making the anticipation heighten for the next sip. Frothy legs on every sip. Benchmark of an AM Porter and what craft beer represents. Amazing experience brings a warming smile with each sip.

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ El Corte Ingles, Sevilla, España.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, chocolate, sweet, vanilla / Malta tostada, chocolate, dulce, vainilla.
Bottle. Pours dark brown, black with a good latte-colored head. Aroma is roasted, some coffee, light chocolate. Taste is roast, plenty of it, some coffee. Fairly one dimensional. Easy drinkability.

Pours brown with no head at all. A nice aroma mix of roasted nuts and coffee and light bitter hops. Taste is perfectly balanced and complex. First some toasted malt followed by herbally hoppiness mixed caramel and chocolate. Really great!
12 oz. bottle. Pours black with lasting tan head. Aroma of sweet malts, nuts and chocolate. Taste was sweet roasted malts.

Bottle courtesy of Geraint and Helen, (big thanks to you two!) Consumed at home Sunday 22nd November 2015   Some dark fruits and a little cocoa on the nose. Pitch black on the pour with a tan head. Middling bitterness but good dash of chocolate and coffee, some sweetness, a little dark sticky fruit. A very drinkable no nonsense porter. A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov15 3.7

Bottle from Alko, Kokkola. Pours clear dark brown almost black with a creamy light brown head. Lightly roasted malt, bit chocolate and coffee, vanilla, good aroma. Medium body but soft velvet feel, long roasted finish, semidry. Balanced and beautiful.
Una buona porter, equilibrata e saporita, con i classici sentori di malto, cacao e caffè. Non è la mia birra, ma è più che emblematica.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 355 ml, bottled. BB 03/07/16. Pours black with a decent beige head. Aroma: Chocolate, malt. Caramel, vanilla. Taste: Medium sweet, spices, licorice, vanilla. Balancing roastiness. Notes of wood. Palate: Medium body, notable carbonation. Creamy. Excellent porter, very pleasant.

Pours black with dense clingy caramel head. Sweet caramel bouquet. Incredibly silky mouth feel, with a cacophany of flavours swirling on the palate. Chocolate, coffee, vanilla, caramel, charcoal all separate then recombine on the finish which morphs into sticky date for the finale.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Dark, dark brown with a thin tan head. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate aromas. Taste is fairly similar, mocha, a little vanilla, slightly bitter at the end, creamy, just want more of it. Bloody good.

Beautiful clear dark brown appears black in glass, creamy light brown head. Looks great. Lightly roasted malt, bit chocolate and coffee, vanilla, good aroma. Medium body but soft velvet feel, long roasted finish, semidry. Looks great and aromas match, balanced and beautiful.
Bottle from Beltramos in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, burnt coffee. Taste is smooth, burnt coffee (somehow). Good, not great.
Great dark porter! No slightly bitter after taste like you find in most porters. Dark, malty brew that is easy to drink. Perfect beer if youre having a meal with beef!

Large, creamy, light brown, mostly diminishing head, good lacing. Normal, dark brown body. Heavy malty aroma, with notes of roasted, nutty, dark chocolate and mild coffee. Moderate hoppy aroma, with notes of grass, spruce and resin. Moderate yeasty aroma, with notes of sweat, leather and earth. Notes of charcoal, soy sauce, toffee, nutmeg, pepper and licorice. Moderate sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic initial flavor. Average, light sweet, heavy bitter, moderate acidic and salty finish. Medium body. Oily texture. Lively carbonation. Light alcoholic, moderate astringent finish.

A black beer, a head is almost medium and dark beige. Aroma has chocolate, roastiness, coffee, liquirice, sometimes hint of vanilla. Taste is smooth mix of chocolate, coffee, liquirice and roastiness. Medium bodied, smooth. Great balanced beer with strong flavours.
Black with creamy brown head. Strong chocolate nose. Taste is very hoppy, roasty, almost burned malts. Long dry roasty finish. Medium carbonation. Excellent porter.

13/11/2015 @home - 33cl bottle from Malt Attacks, Brussels.
Black colour with nice tanned head, leaving just a lacing at the sides of the glass. Roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, some bitter hops in the end. Nice for the ABV & enjoyable.

Bottle at Craft Room, Zagreb (thanks guys!). Poured a full black body with a tiny brown head that went away fast. Oily, raisiny caramel aroma, full sweetish maltiness. Slightly oxidized taste, raisins, smooth maltiness, light chocolate, somewhat creamy, but a bit light, medium to low bitterness, a bit dusty. Oof, a slightly older bottle, but not past BB date, but it feels older than it should be. Like that, enjoyable, but not the best porter in the world like many would say. Will try to rate it again, more fresh.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2015 Una grande Porter americana. Aromi complessi di caffè ed orzo salgono al naso insieme a note di cioccolato e mirtillo il tutto avvolto in un leggero velo di affumicato. Al palato risulta più semplice, ma comunque armoniosa e rotonda come il naso fa supporre. Il color ebano fittissimo porta alla mente immensi saloni dell’America ante secessione dove un ricco colono attende la sua nera, ricca e sexy ragazza di colore. Una esperienza coinvolgente&#033;
One of the best, if not the best porter I have ever had. My only negative is that the label is a little creepy! Otherwise this beer kills it.
Coffee and chocolate aromas. Small tan head, dark brown. Smooth, medium body. Coffee, bread, bitter chocolate notes.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, near black with a small, creamy, tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted coffee, chocolate, caramel and roasted malt. 

Taste of roasted malt, roasted coffee, caramel, citrus, other fruit and chocolate. 

Full/medium body and medium carbonation. 

Wonderful!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Real supermodel body! Sexy and tasteful! Love the strong bitter coffee, chocolate and especially vanilla aroma.

Bottle from a shop in Monterey, CA on Lighthouse Ave. My first impression was that this was a sweet porter. Flavor is definitely sweet. Aroma is sweet caramel and chocolate. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Beer does not have a roasted malt character that I have seen in most porters. All in all a very good beer. I am happy that Founders in finally distributing to California.

Pours black with a dark brown head. Aromas of, chocolate, caramel and coffee. Taste the same with some malty sweetness. Roasty flavors also. Light to medium mouth feel. One of the best porters Ive had.
Almost black in color . Lots of malt. Nice head. Bells has always been my favorite porter but this is really close

Bottle. 
Pours very dark with a tan head, about a finger. Good lacing. The aroma is excellent. Roasted malt, bitter chocolate, coffee. A bit of sweetness in the flavour, honours the nose well. Goes down smoothly, not too heavy, has a lingering malty feel. A very solid porter, one Id love to try again.

Pours black with a tan head. Chocolate, caramel, coffee and roasted malt aroma. Cocoa, coffee, caramel, toffee, earthy hop and roasted malt flavors. Medium body and carbonation. Chocolate and roasted malt finish.
black with a thin tan head. aroma is roast and coffee. flavor is coffee, cocoa, roast, and caramel.
Black pour, tanned big lacing, lacing foam. Strong bitter doffee aroma, smooth drinking. Bitter coffee, vanilla, chocolate, its all there. Velver mouth feeling. Great beer. (Chicago 201510)

Bottle to glass. Nose is heavy chocolate, caramel, molasses and sweet candy. Beautiful jet black with full brown head that lingers. Taste is layers of chocolate and complex malts, with slight caramel. Sweetness persists, and no roast. Moderate bittering. Mouthfeel is fantastic and coasts the tongue.

Draught @ Capital Alehouse Downtown, Richmond, VA. Pours cloudy very dark brown with small light tan head. Clear aroma of roast, with notes of malt and coffee and touches of yeast. Bitter, roasty flavour with notes of coffee and touches of malt, yeast and hops. Bitter, roasty and hopy finish with estery hints. Very good.

Pours a finger of tan head on a black body.
The aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, and burnt wood.
The taste is milk chocolate sweet, coffee bitter, dark chocolate, milk. 
The texture is smooth.
Its an outstanding beer.

All aboard the taste train for this masterpiece! The jet black pour gives an indication of where this party is headed; straight to flavor town. Chocolate and roasted malts come through perfectly in this well-balanced nirvana in a glass. Easily the best year-round offering from anybody, and the best beer for the buck you will ever find. When the weather cools down, this beer is a must!
Botted. Pours pitch black with a small light brown head. Smells and tastes coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and a bit salty with a mild bitter chocolate finish.
Bottle. Black. Chocolate, bit dry powdery, malty, some milkyness. Med full bodied, smooth soft nice texture. Malty chocolate. Really nice, easily drunk. Could do a bunch of these.-- bb
Smells chocolatey with carmel notes. Taste is sweet but not too sweet. Very smooth, no bitterness at all. Definitely will pick this up again.

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Roasted, dry, dark stone fruits, light chocolate.
Appearance: Opaque black color. Minimal, brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, dark fruits, light chocolate.
Palate: Medium-full body. Long dry finish.
Overall: Nice dry porter.

Un soir de pétanque, mon partenaire sort ce chat de son sac. Quelle bonne idée. Cest beau, ça sent bon et ça goûte bon. Cest la noirceur dans toute sa splendeur. Ça sent et ça goûte le cacao, le café, tout ce qui tourne autour des grains grillés avec des pointes de vanille et de caramel. Une texture riche et soyeuse me fait me contre foutre de la partie de boules sur le gravier tellement cest prenant. Tout ça dans un porter. (1548-090715)

Pours a completely black, topped with almost no head to speak of, just a tiny tan cover. Mildly roasty aroma, nice chocolate notes. Mild taste, gently roasty, slightly sweet. A bit of caramel and a hint of bitterness. Nicely drinkable, very gentle. I like it.

Dark dark brown pour with khaki head. Nose is plenty of roast and caramel, dark coffee, a little burnt toast note. Flavor include more burnt toast, caramel and rich bitter coffee. Espresso, mild sweetness in the finish. Perhaps some darker fruits, but Im not positive. Maybe dark currants? Either way, medium body, and super solid. 1642015

Good taste. I'll be having it again. Founders keeps proving its a good company. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle from BeerGeek Bottle shop. Black with a creamy, tan head stay long. Roasted notes in the nose, coffee, cocoa, chocolate. Creamy and smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonated, full-bodied. Rich flavor, chocolate, caramel, toffee, earthy hops that give a little bitterness in the finish.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with brown head. Aroma is big time chocolate and a little caramel. Taste is moderate bitterness and mild to moderate sweetness. Flavors of chocolate, coffee, and caramel. Definitely a top tier Porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a jet black color with minimal head retention and average lacing. It smells like cocoa and toasted malt. Tastes like roasted malt and chocolate. A very good porter and one that I would order again and again.

Tried at same time as Bells porter. The Founders has a much stronger coffee flavor on both the tongue and finish. If that is your preference you might like founders more. I preferred the Bells for not being as strong and having more choxo late than coffee flavor.
Black with an orangeish head. Burnt malt with vanilla and citrus. Burnt malt with smoke and chocolate. Medium body with a crisp palate and lingering charred after taste.

Pours very dark brown with an off-white head.
Nose shows nutty, bready and roasted malt sith some soft coffee notes.
Flavours include soft roasted malt, toasty notes, a little bit of sweet malt and a chestnut character.
355ml bottle. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, cocoa, coffee. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily silky body with soft carbonation.

Bottle at caps beer garden, Newark airport. Rich roasted malt aroma with notes of chocolate and a touch of hops. Pours dark brown almost black with a thin light brown head with good retention and nice lacing. Starts with rich roasted malt flavors with a little bit of bittersweet chocolate. Finishes very smooth with the chocolate becoming prominent with a touch of hops. Excellent, full-bodied porter.
Pours deep brown almost black with a fast receding tan head. Rich, caramel, roasted malts, chocolate... creamy and thick, really easy drinking, really good. Best porter Ive tried to date.
