Piwo porter z czarna glebia. Mnostwo kawy espresso, kofeinowe, rozgrzewajace i czekoladowe ze spora dawka kakao. Piana srednia kremowo bezowa. metne i nieprzeswitujace. Stylowa etykieta i solidna konstrukcja slodowa. Deserowe piwo i tresciwe, doskonale do sera podpuszkowego. Polecam

Bottle from Damian Beer and Ale. Aroma roasted, smoked, light dark chocolate. Very dark colour, quickly disappearing head. Taste is rich in various malty flavours. Roasted and smoked play nicely with chocolate, caramel. Soft creamy mouthfeel, easy drinking despite the relatively higher ABV. Dry roasty and slightly hoppy finish urges you to drink more. Exceptionally balanced, nothing stands out, fun to drink, complex. Very good.

Nera, quasi impenetrabile, riflessi color caramello, schiuma color nocciola abbastanza compatta ma non molto persistente.
Aroma di cacao, zucchero caramellato e note di caffè.
Al palato sempre cacao e note di caffè miste a caramello, leggerissima ciliegia.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata.
Ottima Porter.

Bottle; pours nearly black with a tan head; aroma is chocolate and roasted malt with some dark fruits, caramel, and coffee notes; taste is chocolate, roast malt, and caramel with some hints of coffee; nice light bitter finish; excellent porter
Excellent porter! Ça manquait un peu de mousse mais cest son seul défaut. En bouche, cest onctueux et bien chocolaté sans être trop lourd. Jen veux encore!!
Bottle. Pours pitch black with a medium brown head. Aromas of milk chocolate, some roast, malt, savory notes. Taste is chocolate, some coffee, soy, savory notes, bitter chocolate.

Bottle to pint glass. Almost-black pour with a smallish tan head that sticks around for a bit. Mostly dark chocolate and caramel in the aroma, with some vanilla and bourbon notes in the background. Taste is similar - a little less heavy on the chocolate, and nicely balanced. One of the better examples of the style.
Sweet cocoa & lightly roasted aroma on a super dark pour. Chewy mouth feel with substantial roasted & chocolate flavors. The finish is slightly bitter and lingering.
Bottle from Buffalo shop. Big fat tan head w/overtones of coffee, chocoate, & substantial roast. Its a robust porter that could easily pass as a stout.

Láhev 355 ml. Aroma je sladové s jemným nádechem karamelu a čokolády a lehce uzeného. Pěna je světle hnědá, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je téměř neprůsvitná, temné rubínová. Chuť je svěí, jemně čokoládová, doplněná lehkým závanem ovoce, fini je středně kakaově hořký a drící. V ústech pivo působí plně, má střední říz a je dobře pitelné. Jedná se o velmi vyvedený porter, který hodnotím velmi kladně, nicméně musím říct e i přesto jsem čekal troku víc.

330mL bottle from Beer Cartel BB 04/09/15
Dense black body holds a thick tan head.
Aroma is dark, brooding; blackened nuts & toast, dark chocolate & caramels, some cooked citrus hopiness.
Full body, quite rich, very smooth, velvety.
Palate packed full of dark chocolate, burnt toffee & roast nuts with undertones of earthy, somewhat citrus hop and licorice.
Oh so smooth, oh so good!

Coloração escura,opaca,líquido viscoso,espuma marrom cremosa com boa manutenção;no aroma malte torrado,chocolate amargo e lúpulo;no sabor torrefação se destaca dando um amargor intenso que se mantem até o final e no retrogosto,carbonatação média/baixa,corpo médio,álcool bem inserido. Pela fama esperava algo mais nela,sabor um tanto desequilibrado,pelo amargor esta mais para uma Stout do que uma Porter.
Oh yea this is good. Charred. Lots of chocolate. This is solid. On tap at founders.
Dark brown with brown head. Medium roasty malt aroma. Chocolate malt flavor with cocoa bitterness. Very nice porter (not thin, not heavy malt, not boozy, classic porter flavor and feel). Very nice.
How : bottle Appearance : almost black, small tan head. Aroma : caramel, nuts, chocolate, wood, cocoa and dried fruits. Palate : full body, soft carbonation.

Negro opaco y espuma beis compacta. Aromas de cereal dulce, café, tostados, melaza. Cuerpo medio, con inicio dulce y maltoso, al que sigue un intenso sabor tostado y acafetado que llega hasta el final de amargor equilibrado.
Black appearance with light brown head. Roasted chocolate aroma, rich taste with noticeable bitterness, long finish. Very good Porter style.

Bottle. Pours black with a massive beige head that dissipates to a thin, creamy film. Aromas are coffee, dark chocolate, dark chocolate, vanilla and cream. Finishes with black pepper and nutty tones. Creamy mouthfeel. Delicious!

From 0,355l bottle, BBD: 02/01/2016 Pours hazy dark brown to almost black liquid, medium creamy brown head, Aroma: merveilleux, dark and milk chocolate, ripe prunes, red fruits, light espresso, caramel, indecribably harmonic, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, milk chocolate, caramel, red fruits, harmonic, Palate: medium body, creamy to oily texture, average carbonation, Long bitter roasty finish, Overall: perfect, one of my all time best porters, enjoyed.
Black colour, brown head, aroma of smoked meat, milk and coffee. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Smells of chocolate, roasted malts, dark roasted coffee. Bitter, with a rich, full taste of roasted malts. Medium bodied; a touch chalky; average carbonation; bitter finish.
Svart med lavt skum. Lun aroma av sjokolade, lakris og kaffehint. I smaken finner jeg røstet malt, lakris, kaffe og noe sjokolade. Fin bitterhet. Medium konsistens.

Bottle @ home. Pitch black pour with a frothy light tan head. Nose has loads of milk chocolate, some light roast and light savoury notes. Taste is super smooth, milk chocolate, light coffee, caramel and some salty licorice. Super good!

Aromat rewelacyjny. Masa kakao, masa kawy, masa czarnej czekolady. Piwo czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Niewielka piana, świetny lacing. W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie, dużo kawy, dużo paloności. Paloność szczególnie w posmaku daje o sobie znać. Delikatnie zbyt mocno nasycone, ale nadal gładkie i aksamitne. Rewelacyjne piwo. Jakby z tego zrobić baltic porter albo imperial porter - zagięłoby system.

A little bit crisp and bitter when it hits your tongue, but almost immediately mellows out and lets some chocolatey coffee tastes through. However, I have to give it a 1/5 in both the categories of beer name and attractiveness of woman on the bottle.

Bottle at home. Oily black topped by a beige creamy head. Rich roasted malts with an abundance of soft coffee and chocolate, nicely balanced by some tropical fruity hops. Not too bitter or dry, more rounded and soft. Long finish.  Low carbonation, good body (especially considering the low abv). Great meeting Founders Brewing with this ale.
Bottle from Brian....not the typical porter smell....smell reminds me of a stout...very nice smooth taste...thx man...(#476)

Black in color with very little head. Not much carbonation. Strong taste of grain like chocolate or black patent malt. Roasted caramel, semi sweet flavor. Perfect blend of hops and malt.very little bitterness and sweet finish.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours deep dark brown with small brown head.Aroma of sweet roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, liquorice, burnt bread. Taste is medium bitter at first, roasted malts, licorice, burnt wood (ash), some dark berries. Medium + body. Roasted smooth finish. Good beer.

Bottle, 355 ml at Rocket Burger, Zagreb. Pours black with beige head. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, coffee. Sweet with dry finish. Good but cant say it knocked me off my feet. Would drink it again.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice, burned caramel. Flavour is medium sweet and roasted bitterness. Medium to full bodied, thick texture, soft carbonation. Finish is roasted, rich and smooth.
old notes and some words to describe: huge roasted caramel, great porter, robust finish, medicinal hops

Coffee, chocolate, nuts, wood, toast and some dried fruits. Dark brown to black with a tan head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium ti full body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall a really nice porter with e clear hop profile, really enoyable.
12 oz pour from refrigerated bottle into shaker pint. Black and opaque, basically no head. Nose is dark malt and chocolate. Taste is heavy chocolate and some smoke. A great porter.

Kolsvart kropp å litet halvbrunish huve. Mycket choklad doft & lite rostat upplever jag, lite sött, lite godis å malt. Fyllig robust kropp men riktigt mörk choklad smak. Lätt gräddig ton. Lätt bitter. Trevlig eftersmak av bitter kaffe choklad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a smallish brown head. Aroma is toasty malt, bread, coffee. Creamy mouth feel. Taste is substantial. Burnt toast and black coffee. Long finish with some lingering bitterness and alcohol warmth. High quality porter.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2017 bottle at home from trade with Saeglopur, many thanks Thomas :) BB-date not readable anymore. black color, looks a bit oily. small dark coffee-colored head. strong smell of chocolate, cacao, coffee, vanilla, smells creamy, very very light malty roasty smell. medium body, very soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel, light oily. tastes malty roasty, coffee roast, some chocolate, light sour and some light smoke, some citric notes, astringent. quite dry / roasty bitter finish. aftertaste of coffee and chocolate. wow drinks very nice, just the finish is a tad too dry. apart from that great beer.
rerate, another bottle courtesy of Saeglopur, Bottled 11/10/2016. I am not as impressed as before, a bit milky on the taste, bit too earthy, not totally convinced by the balance. so first rating (4) stays.

Bottle- pours silky blackish brown, fluffy khaki head recedes to a permanent ring. Cocoa, coffee, some pine and oak on the nose. Velvety mouthfeel with rustic oak, roasted chocolate malts, vanilla and subtle caramel malt sweetness finished with a rounded hop bitterness. So smooth and tasty. World class Porter 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from tap a black with off white head and lace. Chocolate aroma and taste with a burnt note. Just the right amount of bitter. Good carbonation makes for a nice creamy head and body. Well done.

Really surprising that I havent rated this one. It strikes me as heavier than a typical porter, and has a great mouthfeel. Roasted and plenty of chocolate. Obvious burnt notes. Popular at the tasting I hosted. Bottle.
Aroma of oak, dark coco, and coffee. Taste is the same, maybe a little cola taste. Oily slick feel on the palate.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - black pour with brown head. Roasted malty aroma and taste, some nice burnt notes, hints of smoke, chocolate, coffee, caramel, gorgeous.

Tap at Imperial Bottle Shop, post CBC

A: Pitch black with a creme ring of head. 

N: Coffee, cocoa, biscuit, some vanilla, and a hearty woodiness. Peppercorn and earth.

T: Sweet, roasty body, with solid bitterness to balance.

M: Light body, creamy carbonation, no alcohol presence.

O: Quintessential porter. This is a proper go-to, along with the Imperial Stout, for Founders, IMO.
Bottle. Blackish beer with a light brown head. Roast and light chocolate aroma. Roast and coffee flavor with light chocolate. Medium bodied. Chocolate and light caramel linger with light coffee.

Bottle from Hannaford Exeter NH. Aroma is earthy, burnt toast, chocolate, coffee, cheese. Appearance is opaque black with thin, light brown creamy head with apparent but minimal lacing. Taste is balance of moderate coffee bitterness with mild sweetness. Palate is full bodied with creamy texture, and perfect amount of carbonation and long bitter finish.

Bottle - 355ml. Totally opaque black body with a thin, lasting, beige foamy head. Fantastic, complex malty/hoppy aroma with chocolate, vanilla, woody, and roasted coffee hints. Its perfectly balanced malty/hoppy taste carries roasty, coffeeish, and cocoa notes. Ends with a robust bittersweet finish. Awesome!
Bottle 0,33l. Clear dark brown colour with small beige head. Soft carbonation. Aroma of coffe, roasted malt and chocolate. TAste follows the aroma. Bitter sweet aftertaste. Overal excellent porter.

Aroma: chocolate, roasty malt
Appearance: black, clear, tan foam, 
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent porter

12 oz bottle into tulip. Appearance is black with decent light tan head which disappears fairly quickly leaving good amount of lacing. Aroma is malty with notes of nuts and toast. Taste is very lightly sweet with an extremely lightly bitter, smooth finish. Notes of coffee, roasted malts and some earthiness. Some caramel. Maybe a slight note of wood. One of the most flavorful robust porters I have had. But yet it seems to maintain the character of a porter without crossing the line of being a stout. Very very good beer. Regularly available.
coffee, bitter dark chocolate aroma smells delicious. jet black color 2 finger of a brown head. medium body coffee stands out

33cl bottle at a restaurant in NY. Pitch black color, short thick brown head. Quiet nose, rich aroma of roasted malts chocolate pudding and toffee yet with a decent hops balance. Loads of hazelnuts and dark malts, cocoa cake. Sweet taste almost like a schwarzbier, charcoal bitterness in the finish. Excellent for dessert or after dinner.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 Pours dark brown opaque with light brown head. Smells of coffee, dark chocolate, some d dark fruit esters. The same is the flavor: a lot of coffee, dark chocolate notes, supported with dark fruit esters. Slightly dry bitter finish. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation is moderate.

DWG; Bottle 355 ml. Pours moderate, black with a creamy, lacing and moderate lasting tan head. Nose is heavy roasted malt and coffe, less dark chocolate, some liqorice, caramel and dark fruit. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, moderate bitter with a lasting liquorice finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat to soft.
Once again founders does not disappoint. Little stronger than the normal porters I drink and that's a good thing. Loved it.
33cl @ bottle. Porter per il birrificio americano. Cioccolato e caramello, birra dolciastra e di ottimo aspetto.

Very smooth and creamy texture. Dark black color with mild head. Chocolate flavor and aroma.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a rich, dark colour with a needle like amber head. Smells of espresso coffee, dark chocolate with just the tiniest trace of hops. Tastes of coffee, dark chocolate with a long lasting oily, sweet aftertaste. Really sessionable as far as porters go. Deserves the hype.

On tap. Pitch black, frothy brownish head, warm coffee aroma with hints of hops. Bitter from roasted malts is quiet strong, develops into coffee taste. Good body, thick but not too much. Hand pumped so cant comment on carbonation
30.9.2014. Aroma of sweet coffee, roasted malts, some liquorice. Medium bodied, roasted malts, dryish, coffee. Quite oily texture for such low abv.

The rep behind this is huge. Should my knees be shaking going in? Ha-ha! I never was much bowled over by celebrity, so I guess Ill just open this sucker up and see how we go.
The open mouth of the bottle releases a sweet, milk chocolate aroma, and Im brought back in time to the dipping of sugared toast into hot chocolate; a favorite treat when my brother and I would discover that school was closed for a SNOWDAY!
The brew is cocoa with a soft, cappuccino head, wet and heavy on the sides of the glass. Toast, chocolate and dark, rich, almost burnt caramel waft through the air as I bring the glass to my lips for a long draw. The huge, full body is rich and full of flavor, the texture chewy; I suddenly feel an almost desperate longing for a thick, sexy cigar, and to be enveloped in tight black leather. So contrary to the figure on the bottle. So like me to be contrary.
The finish is short, dry and ashy, and the experience is going to be a favorite for me. The aftertaste is fantastic; dark, roasty and tasting of deep chocolate. There is nothing I could find wrong with an experience like that.
I hate to give any of this up to do a mix with the Rubaeus, but indeed I will.
An absolute cracker. Doesnt promise much at pouring or in scent, but proves delicious and entirely palatable. A great porter.
Schwarz. Kaffee, Espresso, Malz. Malz, Kakao, brauner Zucker, Kaffee. Cremig, süffig.

355 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Dark brown, looks almost black in the glass, with a nice, creamy, moderately persistent beige head. Intense and mesmerizing nose, very sweet overall but the roasted/toasted presence is there. Milk/white chocolate, tons of licorice and vanilla notes, a hint of toffee and green coffee beans as well. Pretty much perfect, really. Not only for the intensity but also because of the quality. Quite a different story in the mouth. Initially an earthy, peppery and slightly herbal hoppy punch togheter with a solid, bitter and roasted presence. Much more coffee than chocolate compared to the aroma, even though reminds me more of a watered down version instead of a proper espresso. Tiny bit of astringency and sweetness, with a lingering vanilla and burnt caramel aftertaste. Excellent drinkability for the ABV. Soft to average carbonation, medium body, oily texture. Fantastic aroma, more than solid taste, overall extremely pleasent.

bottle 0,33l. Pours deep dark brown with small brown head. Aroma chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Taste coffee chocolate, medium bitterness, light sweetness. medium body, oily feel, easily drinkable. Very good beer

bottle, from the american bottle stall at braukunst live 2015. jet black with a modest brown head; aroma of mudcake, rolling tobacco and vanilla cream; medium bitterness with notes of coffee ice cream and salted caramel; balanced and very drinkable

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2015 12oz bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Import [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 15 - FR. Unmistakeable fresh tealeafy hops and near-charry chocolate malts come and greet the eager sipper and beer fair sludger who needs his dull limbs requickened. Anchor Porter has been here. Drying, remaining just elegant due to cushioning caramels to soften the blowlet of its overbearing coffee roast and arabica bitters. A near robust porter in style, it is at least a bit more of a fighter than a cuddler.

Bottle @ De Tolly, Tartu.
Dark color. Full body. Chocolate, coffe & roasted malt armoas. Long & pleasant finish. Easily drinkable & enjoyable. Good porter.

Look: Pours dark black. Very little light is let through. Brown head. Slight clear.
Smell: chocolate. Roasted malts. Chocolate milk.
Taste: coffee. Heavy roasted malts. Bitter cocoa flavor. 
Feel: thin mouth feel. Medium low carbonation. Sweet. Creamy mouthfeel.
Overall: good beer. Very smooth. Easy drinker. 
First drank: home 3/8/15
Vintage: 2014
not a terrible beer. worth keeping the buzz alive. you might want to start the night with something better.

Almost black in color, with medium, beige head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malt. Same notes in taste with touch of hop. Roasted bitterness in aftertaste. Rich and smooth porter. Another great brew from Founders.
Bottle pour. Chocolate malt aroma. Looks more like a stout than porter. Tasting cocoa, burnt malt, piney hops, licorice, a touch of coffee. Outstanding porter.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
12 oz bottle pours black, thin light brown head faded quickly. Aroma of cocoa and burnt coffee. More bitter than I expected from a porter but I like it. This was a bit thinner than expected but it was very smooth, carbonation was spot on, and mildly bitter ending.

Another terrific beer from Founders. The label caught my eye too.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 Another well crafted beer from Founders. Enjoyable porter with a solid flavor profile offering both sweet and bitter that are both well represented. A bit thin for personal preference while still offering a smooth and silky palate.
Pours jet black with a stingy tan head. Aroma is mostly chocolate. Taste is chocolate, woody, slightly bitter. Well balanced. Quality stuff.

Mmm, deliciously complex porter! Pours black w/ a big mocha head that leaves lacing. The aroma is full of chocolate & roastiness. The taste is quite similar as it hits w/ tasty chocolate sweet notes only to finish w/ a big bitter & coffee like finish. Another great beer from the best!
Chocolate,malt and coffey. Well balanced. Room for improvement in complexity. Very good porter though.
Oil black pour. Nice lacing. Aroma dark roast chocolate coffee. Taste easy drinking velvet smooth. Bitter dark chocolate in the finish. Some smoke this would be anyone elses stout. Interesting brew.
Nejsem pivni znalec. Chci jen zkusit co nejvic. Kazdy at ochutna a zjisti sam. Sto lidi sto chuti.

Thin tan head on top of brown turning black body. Aroma a smidge alcoholic and a bit like wood lacquer. Super smooth palate with chocolate, malt, and coffee notes. Nice finish with sweetness ending at satisfaction.

ポーター   
香ばしい香り& 
美味しいポー&

The beer pours a dark black with a thick tan head that left good lacing around the glass. The aroma is very sweet chocolate, roasted malts, toffee, and caramel. The taste is somewhat bitter dark chocolate, roasted nuttiness, toffee, caramel, some woodiness, and some hops in there as well to round out the beer. The mouthfeel is rather thick and silky. The drinkability is super high with this beer even at 6.5%. This truly is a world class porter that I highly recommend.

Nera, sentori di affu,icatura, tostature, orzo, e un po di caffè. In bocca è lo stesso, legata magisttalmente con un finale amaro bello lungo e caldo, un po terroso. Birra sublime, non cè che dire.

In bottiglia. Porter sicuramente ben fatta, nessun particolare difetto e aromi di caffè soprattutto e cioccolato amaro ben evidenti e piacevoli. Detto ciò ci vorrebbbe qualcosa in più, classica senza emozionare

I like it. No, NO, I must write more: I really like it.

Always a welcome sight in store or on a beer menu. The others may be hit or miss, but, you can always, "well, at least they have Founders Porter."
not for me this one. not my type of beer but wanted to give it a go. strong coffee on the aroma with chocolate and coffee in the taste my father in law loved it though

It pours black with a almost nonexistent tan head. It has the aroma of chocolate along with a roasted aroma and a hint of smoke. It has a surprisingly strong hop bitterness. I also taste chocolate, coffee, resin and a floral flavor. This beer is extremely good. Im glad that I bought it and would buy it again.

Roasted malt aroma. Taste is roasted malt, maybe chocolate and very little smoky, but occasionally I get a slight smoke. Dark and full flavored, with a very bitter dry finish. Almost an ipa bitter dry finish. Smooth. Not nearly as smooth as KBS or big luscious, but smooth so that it almost feels like there is a bit of lactose. Like milk stout smooth. Very good Porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a dark black with a thin tan head that leaves very little lacing. A coffee and malt aroma. Very silky palate. Smokey flavour with a hint of coffee.
Great aroma, dark colour. Good body. Smooth finish. Nice porter, just what I was expecting.

Cor preta (SRM >35), opaca.
Creme bege, fino, pequenas bolhas.
Aroma de torrefação, chocolate amargo principalmente e cafe, com notas de baunilha e caramelo escuro.
Corpo leve a médio, baixa carbonatação, com álcool pouco perceptível.
Paladar segue aroma, mas menos intenso, com final seco e aparecendo lúpulo com discreto amargor no final.
Boa porter, agradável, principalmente pelo toque lupulado no final. Não enjoativa, de boa drinkabilidade.

Poured into a teku glass showing pitch black center with translucent coffee brown rims. Shows little to no head except a little brown foam around the rims. 

The aroma is mostly dark roasted malts with big notes of whiskey and bourbon. There are also hints of smoke. 

The palate is incredibly smooth and evenly carbonated. The flavors seem to be evenly split between notes of whiskey and the dark roasted malts. A lot of coffee flavor but none of the tartness. The finish shows a warm dark espresso bitterness. A good porter, would probably be amazing barrel aged.

Bottle. Black. Strong chocolate aroma in the head which fades w the foam. Silky chocolaty and very smooth. Very nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mind-blowing. Probably one of the best porters out there; seriously, you need to try this one. Aroma is oodles of roasted malt and chocolate (almost smokey?). Taste is off the charts: I seriously get more complexity each time I sip... notes of chocolate, heavily roasted malt, caramel...and maybe some faint dark fruit hiding under that roasted goodness. Finish is a sally of bitter delight that mellows and fades...

Appearance: black stout with thin head
Nose: caramel, chocolate 
Mouth: smooth and full
Taste: balanced and complex. Caramel, chocolate balanced with hops! Leaves good bitter taste behind. Good one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12floz bottle at Vesper Tavern at Newark airport. Very dark. No head. Very caramel taste.

Bottle - Black color with a beautiful creamy brown head, fully lasting and beautiful lacing - Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, soy sauce and licorice - Flavor of roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate - Medium/full body, light/medium bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, good carbonation, long bitter roasted dark chocolate finish - Impressiv porter, well balanced

35.5cl bottle. BBE 16.March15. Pours silky black with a creamy tan head. Beautiful lacing. The nose is sweet with strong chocolate and caramel malt presence - exactly. Gently iron in first mouthful. Medium bodied. Not overly dry, and not powdery as some. Soft and gentle texture. Better when served at cellar temperature. Slightly sticky finish. Roasted all around. Perfect example of a porter. Like it a bit more than Anchor Porter.
Black with a brown head - Roasted malt aroma - Roasted malt body with some coffee flavours and bitterness from the roasted malt - Roasted malt and bitterness goes into the finish - This was real good
Bottle. Pours black with nice tan head. Nose is dark chocolate and some roast. Taste adds some smoke. Some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle shared with JMD and OWK at HNB 24.01.14. Almost black. Brown head and lacing. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, dark chocolate, sweet vanilla and a slight hint of peat. Well balanced with good drinkability.
Bottle. Pitch black with a small, off-white head. Lovely aroma of malts, roasted malts, soy sauce, caramel, coffee and chocolate. Moderately sweet and bitter taste with a lightly bitter finish.

Pours black with a thin tan head. Light lacing present. Theres a chocolate, coffee, caramel, and earthy aroma. Medium body that was slick and creamy on the palate with a slight bitter finish. Flavors of chocolate, roasted coffee, caramel, and malts.
Solid tasting porter. Extremely rich taste of coffee and chocolate. Overall a smooth, good porter.

Very Good!
Aroma-mostly coffee & chocolate,Taste-mostly chocolate(s),nut,& caramel.
I was told by friends to pick this up if I ever saw it on the shelves;this time my friends were right.
On tap at The Common Table. Pours black with a thin tan head dissipated quickly. The aromas are chocolate, coffee. The mouthful is dry and bitter with a heavy and good carbonation. Cheers!

DATE TASTED: January 18, 2015... GLASSWARE: Brew at the Zoo pint... OCCASION: AFV watching with the fam... APPEARANCE: jet black body; thick, creamy brown head that laces attractively; impressive screen of head is left behind... AROMA: some fragrant hops suggest a somewhat sophisticated premium lager; however, doughy malts make clear the beers style... PALATE: whoa--high IBUs make for quite a blunt force impact at the teeth; a medium-balanced beer with a bold finish suggests more than 6.5% ABV...TASTE: the label suggests dark and rich--sweet and sour is perhaps may be a better hashtag; some whiskey or scotch...OVERALL: an intense porter, one that cannot be taken lightly; a mouthful of hop and malts, for sure...

Quintessential porter was my thought on my first whiff and sip of this. Dark brown color with a tan head. Aroma is cocoa, coffee and a little booze. Taste is dark chocolate, well-brewed coffee, some dark malt sweetness and a nice hops bitterness, perfectly balanced. Palate is another bullseye with this porter.
Dark pour. 1 finger of thick tan creamy head. Chocolate and roasty nose. Dark chocolate flavor. Some hidden hop bitterness underneath for a full mouthfeel. Great body.

Bottle.

A- Chocolate cake, coffee.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Bitter chocolate, coffee, robust.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, robust finish.

O- Damn, what a fine smelling beer. Almost like a chocolate cake and a cup of coffee, which is a wonderful thing. Looks are just the same. Minor let down on the taste. A little bit bitter, but Im sure if I let this hang out and age a little bit that would mellow out a lot more. Overall, a solid porter by all means.

This porter has a creamy consistency that is typical of the best porters. It pours out extremely smooth in a stemmed glass. It smells almost similar to bailey's Irish creme but has a far more subtle taste. The aftertaste of this porter am surprisingly has a hint of hops which lends itself to a bitter finish instead of the typical sweet finish of traditional porters. This is simply a delicious beer!

Black body with a little non persistent beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, earthy hop with some olives suggestion. Same in taste with some cofee and smoke, well balanced! Good bitterness in aftertaste with some smoked flavour. Great beer, one of my favorites Porter beers.

Tap at Beer Hunters, Pori. Almost opaque black color, good creamy brownish head. Aroma has roasted maltyness, cocoa and coffee. Medium-bodied, velvety palate. Cocoa, toasted maltyness. Then some hoppy bitterness in the finish. Balanced, world class porter.

Pours inky black with a tan head. Aromas of milk chocolate, sweet fruit, and plums. Tastes of coffee, fruit, chocolate, and plums. Well balanced hops profile offers no bitterness, but counteracts any sweetness from showing through. Noticeable carbonation. Perfectly balanced. Not rich enough for a stout, but pleasantly rich as a porter with a clean finish. Goes down easy. Fantastic!

Bottle at home. Great deep rich chocolate malt notes and wonderful hop flavour with nice caramel sweetness. Thoroughly enjoyable. On a separate note, I sometimes make a beer tower. Ive never managed more than 3 bottles. Has anyone??
UPDATED: JUN 26, 2016 Pours black with no head. Lightly carbonated. Roasted hop flavour. Smooth and full of flavour. Easy to drink. More please!

Opaque black pours with thin tan head. Rich aromas of chocolate and roast are strong and inviting. The palate is malty and strong with slightly sweet chocolate notes. Hopped for balance, but not hoppy per se. This is about as good as porter gets.

Black with a white/beige thin layer of foam on the top. Aroma has some light roast notes, bit furry, toffee, cocoa. Relatively light but fully enjoyable. Taste feels light also, light in the body, some strong milk chocolate, cocoa. Aftertaste has more cocoa, quite dry and with no extra sweetness. Drinks well for a porter, and has a lot in common with its "bigger brothers" in the Founders series.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Rich, roasty nose. Flavor is bready, molasses, coffee, bittersweet chocolate. Favorite porter to date.
Bottle 33 cl. Black with a medium light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits and some spices. Light bitter, light sweet with a nice soft roasted and chocolate end. Nice

Black pour into the glass with a tan head that leaves wispy lacing. The nose is of dark bark chocolates, very nice. Flavors are of bakers and semi-sweet dark chocolate, roasted caramel malt, dark fruity esters, and it finishes with a toasted grain balance, with a nod to cocoa. The silky mouthfeel and smooth quaff make for a super delicious, velvety porter to enjoy anytime, as an aperitif, an complement to an after-dinner dessert, or simply a great nightcap. Very well put-together; extremely flavorful and enjoyable. Prost!

Pure black with a smaller than expected dark brown head. Tons of roasted malt and chocolate on the nose. Delicious dry black chocolate rounded off with an acidic hop finish. Tons of flavour in this one, full bodied. Amazing, right what I need after my flight.

Poured very dark with no real head. Just a thin tan layer. Nice lacing though. Light, active carbonation. Nice, strong caramel aroma. Strong, oakey flavour. Moderate bitterness. On the heavy side for a Porter. Close to a stout. NIce.

Bottle @ home. Birra marrone, velata, con schiuma beige molto fine ed abbastanza persistente. Aroma intenso di frutta secca (nocciola) cioccolato fondente, caffè e tostatura. erbaceo ed etereo da alcool sono a loro volta presenti. Gusto abboccato, quasi amabile nei primi secondi, con frutta secca ( quasi arachide) e cioccolato, poi un leggero amaro si presenta (sia da tostatura che da luppolatura). Gusto molto persistente. Corposa, di consistenza quasi appiccicosa, piena e rotonda. Abbastanza calda, è di grande equilibrio ed armonica.

Just nothing very special about it. For the price point, I was expecting to be swept off my feet. There are plenty of less expensive porters that are every bit as good. Also not as much head as I'd prefer.

Keg@ London Craft Beer Festival 2014, The Oval, London. 17-08-2014.
Pours black sith some tan head. Roasty and coffee aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is dry, coffee, roasty. Enjoyable.

0.355l bottle. Dark brown color with brown color. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, licorice, vanilla and roasted malt. Taste is sweet with distinctive roasted malt character. Full body and soft carbonation. Overall its great and tasty porter.

Totally dark with a small, olive brown head and decent lacing. Rich aroma brings together roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, caramel and dark fruit. Woodsy flavor with hints of caramel, coffee, tobacco and black licorice. Semi-sweet chocolate shines in the aftertaste. Full bodied, moderately carbonated mouthfeel with a long lasting finish.
Dark dark. No transparency at all. Full and rich aroma. Grand Rapids masters composed this porter anthem. Divine!
A little stronger than Id expected. I dont know why Id felt this way. I think Ill try it again sometime
Flaska @ Hamnmästaren. Rostade, chocklad toner i aromen, lite chocklad i smaken. Balanserad smak. Lätt drucken.

Flaska på hamnmästaren - mörk ser kraftfull ut. Malt och brända toner i doften. Silkeslen i munnen brända toner i smaken och chokladpudding. Stor kropp.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The old-timey photo designs on Founders bottles have always frightened me, but the stately lady in black is a perfect match for this brew. This porter pours like ink and is nearly opaque when held up to light. Head is chocolate brown. Roasted malt, cocoa, and soy sauce in the aroma. Taste is roasted and bittersweet. There are subtle notes of umami and dark chocolate. An American style hop finish cuts through the richness and adds a little spice to the otherwise exceptionally smooth body. In short, this is an extremely classy porter.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2015 Tap. Brown very long-lasting head. Thock lace. Black and deep dark. Smooth, oily and full palate. Aroma has dark chocolate and toffee. Wide taste with good balance of sweetness, bitterness and strongness. Herbs, some liqourice, dark malts and dark toffee. Lovely.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Deep brown to black color, light brown head. Roasted malt nose, coffee, dark chocolate, fruity notes, hint of soy sauce. Sweet fruity taste, roasted malt, licorice, coffee, dry finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle. Black beer with a strong light brown coloured head. The aroma is lightly roasted, and the flavour is well roasted and bitter with a degree of maltiness. Overall a nice porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0.355l at Samo Pivo Belgrade Serbia.Pour it dark color with small white head.Taste and aroma of chocolate, caramel, coffee,leather, maybe some tobacco. Great Porter.

On tap @Mad for Beer (Rome). Nera, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma color cappuccino, abbondante e persistente. Al naso note di caffé e cioccolato, leggera liquirizia e anice, molto intensa. In bocca è ottima, ha un attacco cioccolatoso e un finale più caffettoso, amarognolo, che bilancia il tutto. Gran bel corpo, cremosa e vellutata al palato. Eccellente!
UPDATED: JUN 28, 2015 Dark brown color with small brown head. Aroma is coffee, bitter chocolate, and malts. Taste is very dry, roasted malts. All the way. Super Porter!
Like an IPA of the porter distinction. Nice subtle nose, quickly dissipating head. But Joseph: "you get the milkiness of it, then BAM hit you in the mouth." referring to hoppyness.
belle couleur noire; petite mousse beige foncé; arômes et goût de café, chocolat et malt grillé; finale douce avec une pointe damertume
Keg tapped Leeds. Black ok tan head lace. Aroma is coffee dsrk choc taste same done dark fruits great roasted dark malts long bitter finish. Nice chewy body slight carbonation. Very good.

This is the first beer I have tried from Founders and I decided to go with the porter because I had heard such good things about it. Smells of coffee and chocolate. Creamy mouth feel. Not as big a head as I expected. Overall a very good and drinkable beer

Bottle, 0.355l. Cloudy almost black color with medium creamy brown head and fair lacing. Aroma of chocolate, strong roasted malt, coffee and dark fruits. Taste starts with smooth caramel with decent fruity touch, follows by sweet and rich chocolate and coffee, mouthfeel is warming, while finish is medium bitter. Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation in palate. Very nice porter, but still expected a bit more...

Seems like a pitch black beer with a small to none head. Aroma is dark malts, coffee, fresh hops, sweet malts, ripe fruits. Taste is fresh hops, dark malts, fruits, caramel. Finishes medium bitter. Nice porter, balanced and good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at room temperature.

A: Pours out of the bottle an inky brown, that becomes black in the glass - so much so that it absorbs all nearby light. Forms a thin brown head, which quickly fades to a ring. No lacing to speak of.

S: Roasted malt meets light coffee and semi-sweet chocolate, all wreathed together in a nice balance.

T: And it all falls apart. I did not expect to get such a piney hop bite from the nose, yet that is virtually all I can taste in this beer. Its difficult to notice any other aspect of the flavor profile - so much so that I cannot. This is effectively a black IPA for those who enjoy pine.

M: Watery, thin, and with a sharpness that may just be the excessive hopping.

O: Edmund Fitzgerald this is emphatically not. I shall not repeat.

April 20th, 2013 - This is a momentous occasion. It marks the first Founders beer Ive ever tasted, after a long wait and enduring lots of talk about its extraordinary chemistry. And its the porter, no less. Ive been introduced to breweries with their IPA line extended out forward, and while it tells me that theyre excellent pale ale brewers, its not the style or the shade of beer that I hope to see at the vanguard of a brewerys offerings. So, here I meet Founders at the right level, with a darker, moodier beer in hand. The pour, gently executed, kicks up a heavy lumber colored foam, which neatly splits the glass into the heady top and an inky black bottom. From the smell I detect deep chocolate and dark roasted coffee, spiced with soy sauce and heavy, heavy cream, giving it a high-end richness and luxurious edge. The carbonation is nice, introducing beer to tongue with a smooth transition from bubbly to oily, and delivering a charcoal and hickory smokiness, and ending with a clear roasted malt note that rings deep and true. The alcohol is perfectly measured to match, leaving a subtle charred barrel aftertaste alongside the malt roast. The balance here is impeccable, and while its not one of the "bucking broncos" of the style - violent, kicking, frenzied and fried - its quiet subtlety demands my respect.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Dark brown with a tiny, light brown head. Coffee, wood, alcohol, chestnut, some hop and some bread flavour. Surprisingly bitter, with some sweet presence. A bit warming. Thin to medium body. Quite low carbonation. Smooth body. A good porter.

330ml bottle. Pitch black color. Small size, brown head, stays. Deep roast, sweet, woody, slightly ashy in aroma. Roast, woody, sweetish dark chocolate in taste. Creamy smoothness in mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Mild bitterness. Very well balanced and easy to drink.

Bottle @De Tolly joogipood, Tartu, Estonia.
Pours with small dark brown head. Aroma of cherry, chocolate, dark fruit, roasty. Taste of coffee, milk chocolate, slight alcohol, slight bitterness, slight sweetness.
Overall very interesting taste palate, very good porter.

A very straight forward porter. Roasted malt smell, sweet. Slight taste of toasted malt, coffee, bit of bitter chocolate. Very good beer. When Im in the mood for a nice tasting American style porter this is it.

Dark brown-black with a medium, creme brulee colored head with a milk chocolate, cola nose. Easy with a moderately-carbonated mouthfeel followed by a coffee and chicory, dark chocolate, roasty dry finish.

Cant believe I havent rated this. Superspak says, " 12 ounce bottle into signature pint glass, bottled on 5/8/2013. Pours pitch black color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, roasted malt, coffee, toast, floral, light pine, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roasted malt notes with light hop presence; and good strength. Taste of chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, toast, floral, light pine, and roasted earthiness. Moderate coffee/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, toast, caramel, light pine, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic balance and complexity of roasted malt flavors with a light-moderate hop presence; with great robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very creamy and lightly slick mouthfeel that is very nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent porter! Great balance and robustness of flavors; and very smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering as expected." So theres that.

Aroma: Medium, dried fruit, roasty. Medium-light, coffee, light licorice, chocolate
Appearance: Body: Opaque, black. Head: Small, light-brown, low retention.
Flavour: Rich malty, chocolate, roasty, dark fruits, prunes. Medium bitterness, medium sweetness. Dry finish, lingering bitterness and roasty.
Mouthfeel: Medium-full body, Medium-low carbonation, creamy.
Overall: Very well balanced, great tasting. 

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
12B. Robust Porter

Borown to black beer, small tan head with wispy retention. Nose is roast, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, coffee. Flavor is roasty malt, chocolate, roasty bitterness with hoppy notes in the dry finish. Lingering dryness, hops and chocolate. Easy to drink fantastic balance.

Dark-chocolate colored with a centimeter of medium-brown head, which is surprising given it should not be as dark as a stout, which is questionable. It is certainly not translucent; however, there are glints of mahogany at the edges which arent typically observed in stouts. Aroma is chocolate, biscuit, herbs, flour, brown sugar. Flavor is a light caramel with a slightly roasty or even smoked backbone. Burnt grain, earthy... Body is medium, on the watery, slightly oily side, with a moderate, pillowy carbonation, minimal burn. Lingering herbs on the flavor, pleasant bitterness. A truly great, not-sweet porter. Pushing stout though...
Aroma of heavily roasted malt with just a touch of smoke. Very carry bitterness with more smoke and chocolate. Very long finish. This is an outstanding beer.

Cant say that Ive rated a beer as high as this one but here it is. Pours a nice mahogany/black color, from the roasted malts. Smell has a molasses type aroma. Taste is off the charts. Cant tell the difference between porter or stouts, but this takes the prize. So far with their breakfast stout, and now this porter, words cant describe how much I love this brewery.

Bottle from Pothole in Tallinn ( 4,60). Pours deep dark brown with brief fizzy tan head. Nose... oh man! Wonderful! Roasted malts and bitter chocolate, burnt caramel, very faint dry ashiness, but also nonspecific hops somewhere way back there. Taste equally mesmerising, beginning with beautiful chocolate notes, then adding a layer of roastiness, then moderate hop bitterness. As it warms, both nose and taste acquire notes of port-like vinous thickness and dried + smoked fruits. Soft smooth mouthfeel, carbonation moderate, body quite thick. Palate and finish ashy or nutty dry, making one beg for another sip. A thick, sweet Porter. Terrific!

Bottle into a pint glass. Pours a deep mahogany brown, with a moderate mocha head that slowly fades, leaving good lacing. Nose is cocoa, leather, and coffee. Taste is sublime, and follows the nose. The go-to porter for me. Hill Farmsteads Everett is the only porter Id rank above (barely) this.
This is a must have, go to Porter for me. Smooth, creamy, chocolate to coffee flavor that is pure pleasure to sip. Nice and rich.

Black color, small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruits, vanilla, hints of coffee, smoke and hops. Taste has roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice, coffee, hops - dry sweet with mild bitter finish and dry roasty aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Excellent porter.
Bottle pours black with a small tan head and thin oily lacing. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, and vanilla. Flavor is rich and delicious.
Almost perfect Porter style. Pours dark black with a nice head. Creamy dark chocolate dominates. Almost no acidity. Very tasty, one of the best Porters I have had.Bottle

Bottle. Dark body, tall tan head. Aroma has a nice sweet chocolate roast. Smooth and velvety mouthfeel. Very rich yet balanced taste with all the good things youd expect to find in a solid porter. Sweet roasty finish with dark chocolate. No excessive bitterness so its easy to have more than one. Top porter indeed!

Aroma is full and rich, with notes of roasted caramels and malt and a light note of wood. Taste is quite sweet with a solid heavy roasted base. Small notes of vanilla and chocolate as well. The end of this one is nice and bitter. This is a delicious porter
Rich and creamy porter with tons of roasted malts, caramel, chocolate and a little coffee. The roasted bitterness goes just a wee tad overboard, but all in all this is a fantastic brew.

0,355L bottle, best by 16.03.2015. Pours black with brown head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, roast, coffee, alcohol, some salty notes. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, coffee, woody and smoky notes. Finish is long roast bitter. Overall: very nice brew.
On tap @ BA Järntorget. Dark brown with a small brown heaad. malty and fruity tones. malt, fruit, chocolate and hops. Medium body with a nice balanced finish. Very nice porter !

Bottle to snifter. Pours nearly black with a small brown head, mostly medium sized bubbles. Aroma is dark chocolate. Some residual sweetness. A light coffee as it warms. Taste is all coffee with just a bit of sharpness to it but not overpowering. Could use a little more body but otherwise decent.

This is one of my favorite porters. Dark and inviting with rich aroma of chocolate and roasted malts. Subtle hint of smoke. The taste is lightly floral hops up front and all kinds of bitter-sweet chocolate and roasted malt. Medium full body. Velvety smooth. So good 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Founders Porter pours black with thick creamy tan brown head that lasts a long while. The aroma is chocolate, caramel and milk. The flavor is a touch of floral hops up front with rich chocolate, caramel and milk. Overall this is a very nice brew.

In virtually no sense of the word is this ale a "porter", but to my mind clearly a "stout". The smoky bitter flavors of roasted barley dominate this beer and it lacks the malt-sweetness that would characterize a porter. I would have rated this slightly higher as a stout, but the unbalanced roasted bitterness in the flavor is what holds this back for me.

---Rated whilst imbibing

Such a good beer. Where to begin.......pours a beautiful bold black with a tan head that quickly dissipates into the darkness..... Aroma notes of coffee and chocolate with a very subtle earthy roast to it. The taste is big on the toasted malt with a nice bittersweet twist to it. The taste on this one is very complex and subtle- best to be enjoyed whilst sipping slowly. In the mouth it feels creamy with a low-med co2 level. This is a great accompaniment to rich deserts or as a stand alone after dinner drink. A classic Porter in my opinion. So good.
MmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmMmmmmmm via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at the Merchants Inn Rugby 03/10/14. Recommended by Theydon Bois and didnt fail to live up to the rating!
Tiny beige head, black porter, chocolate notes, very very nice!

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle served in snifter glass.
A: Pours a deep brown color forming a small beige to brown head. Low retention and only few small spotty lacings left in the glass. A thin layer remains for long time on the top
S: Chocolate, roasted malts and oak. Quite biscuity, it reminds Oreo biscuits. Some earthy yeasts and some notes of flowery hops
T: Slight sweet upfront. Strong notes of dark chocolate, chocolate malts, brown sugar and wood. Reminds Oreo biscuits in taste too :). Nice roast bitterness in the end. Nice bittersweet balance
M: Medium, creamy and very smooth body. Medium carbonation. Biscuity and roasted aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Perfect Porter. My 8th Founders. Always excellent quality beer
[ BA Review @ 1/2/2014 ]

Aroma: toasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Appearance: black, massive, beige head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: toasted malts, chocolate coming up, dry. Overall: very nice Porter, excellently balanced. Bottle at Top Hops, Manhattan.
355 ml bottle. Black, with a thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, sweet chocolate and coffee. The flavour is roasted malty, with cocoa and coffee, notes of liquorice. Very tasty.
Cor escura com pouca espuma marrom clara e pouca persistência. Aroma de chocolate, café torrado. Boa acidez e carbonatação. Amargor correto. Corpo médio mais.

watery and weak, light beer feel, feels like a diet stout instead of a porter. Very empty and tasteless. I very much like the majority of products that founders puts out however this one just does not hit the mark with me.
user_location: San Antonio Pero Aqui, Texas, USA

text: Poured a black colour with a brown caramel head. Sweet aroma of roasted chocolate and coffee malts with caramel. Flavor tended to be more chocolate than coffee, but not too sweet. Almost as smooth and geavy as a milk stout. Pretty drinkable, but not the best porter.

Draft at Eulogy. Opaque brown/black pour with some light brown foam. Delicious roasted malts. Dark chocolate. Some coffee. Notes of smoke, liquorice and leather. Charcoal grill. Cigarettes. Very well balanced. Silky finish. Much fuller palate than one would expect for a Porter. Great stuff!
Sample at SBWF 2014. Sweet malty smell. Similar taste, some chocolate and dark malts. Well balanced.
Jet black pour with a tan head. Aromas of cocoa and roasted malts. Very silky mouthfeel with rich and robust flavors of chocolate and caramel with notes of coffee. Delicious.

This is not just a great porter, but one of my favorite beers. Pours a dark, dark brown with a delightful malty, chocolate aroma. Excellent mouthfeel, not too heavy in keeping with the style. Taste is deep, rich and complex, with chocolate, caramel and malt vying for attention. There are just enough hops to keep it from becoming too sweet and cloying. If you like dark beers, you can't go wrong with this one.

On tap. Pitch black with a tan head. Aroma is lots of dark chocolate and coffee. Big roasted malt character. Flavor is the same. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Slightly bitter finish which is a nice element. Mouthfeel is really nice. Creamy, silk-like, similar to a milk stout or oatmeal stout almost in that its got a prominent silkiness to it. Still not as full-bodied as as a stout but as far as porters go, there arent many better than this. No surprise its so highly rated.

"robust enough to blur the line between porter and stout. very nice balanced mix of chocolate, roasted malts, and hops on the nose and flavor. the aroma & flavor especially dont get much better in style. very well done."

I dont want to open any can of worms on the difference between porter and stout, or lack thereof, but this is the heaviest biggest porter Ive ever had! It tastes a lot heavier than 6.5%abv, though the alcohol isnt strong, its just the big residual gravity and full body. Nose is very big on bitter chocolate, so is flavor. Nose has a hint of a box or raisins but they arent there in the flavor. Flavor tends more toward dark choc, espresso. Despite the full body the beer manages to have a balanced, almost semi-dry finish, so thats good, not overly sweet. There is a remarkable amount of body and flavor crammed into this moderate strength beer, which is a feat unto itself - and its not cloying. Still it is surprising to find a beer in this strength that forces itself to be a sipper. In that sense, hard for quaffing, and I would prefer a porter than you can quaff. Opaque black, modest dark head.

Opaque black pour, thin toffee head. Nose is coco & black malt. Bittersweet. middle caresses the tongue with bits of chocolate, coffee, and burnt sugar. Finish is nicely bitter and lasting. A powerful beer that is not overpowering.

Bottle @ Whole Foods. Smelled really rich and full-bodied, with a mocha coffee aroma. Too much coffee flavor for me. Its highly rated but most people enjoy the smell & taste of coffee...though i am not one of them.

Mine was 1 year old, so not much nose, slightly chocolate scented. The color is rich dark black, with caramel head. Head recedes within minutes but leaves a small ring around the edge of your glass. The taste is incredile rich chocolate and coffee, roasty goodness. The palate enjoys the beer as it is smooth and silky like melted butter, very enjoyable and drinkable.

Me likes.

On tap poured into a shaker. It has aromas of coffee, chocolate, and a light toast quality. The beer is a dark, opaque, black-brown color with a dark tan, fluffy, soapy head which retains really really well. It leaves lots of sheet and speckled lace. The taste is a medium sweet and a medium / medium-light bitter. It has a light, foamy carbonation with a light texture, and a medium malty body. Its smooth and buttery with flavors of chocolate syrup, spice, and grass. It finishes with a sticky syrupy chocolate that lingers in the aftertaste too.

Black with yellow head. Aroma is round. Vanilla, roasted, leather and nuts. Creamy palate. Aftertaste is slick, roasted, leather, dark fruit and lingering darl chocolate. Overall: excellent. Very balanced.

Bottle. Nice roasty nose. Black, opaque color, with dark tan head that slowly dissipates, and leaves a little lacing. Taste is roast, malt, and a very nicely balanced bitterness. Full bodied. Absolutely delicious beer!
12oz bottle pours a thick black color without much head. Smooth and chocolatey at the start with some hoppiness coming through at the end.

Keg at the cock tavern. Opaque black caramel brown coloured pour with a lasting light tan head. Aroma is nutty, praline, caramel, chalky water profile. Palate is medium sweet. Lingering wood and twigs. Some caramel. Palate is full body and highish carbonation. Ummmm.
Chocolate and toast aromas. Small brown head dissapates quickly on top of a thick black pour. Delicious. Bottle pour into shaker, started too cold, got better as it warmed.
What a great porter. Really wonderful aroma of biscuit and caramel and slight burnt roast. Taste develops from a rich roast to a smooth finish. Love it!!!

Bottiglia 35cl, ordinata su birraland e bevuta a casa.
Scura con schiuma abbastanza persistente.
Ricca, corposa e sexy, come da etichetta.
Bella tostatura ed amaro adeguato.
Si beve bene
Very smooth beer. Has a chocolate hint. Small head. It gets better as it warms up. I?ve been on a Ipa kick but this is a pretty great beer.

Pours a thick black with a creamy tan head. Rich chocolate and espresso aromas, however the flavour is not as harshly bitter like cocoa as many porters. The mouthfeel is amazing. Silky smooth down the throat. Its not to sweet, as theres enough of a hop presence to balance it. Its really more of an American stout to a porter, but it is truly amazing

27/VII/14 - 12Fl. Oz. from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ pre-Gentse-Feesten-Ponton-Tasting - BB: 27/VII/14 (oh noes, one day late!) (2014-848) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Dark brown to black beer, big beige creamy head, little stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: roasted malts, some chlorine, bready, yeast. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. taste: very roasted, black chocolate, coffee, caramel, little sweet, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: soft roasted malts, caramel, dark chocolate.

Bottle. Thick and very dark liquid. Unsteady tan creamy foam. Full body, light carbonation. Medium sweetness at start. Creamy and rich. Strong coffee aroma and taste. Taste like strong instant granulated coffee. Great one.
Bottle at home. Pours black, a sweet chocolatey porter, slight dry bitter finish.

Bottle pour. Dark brown to black with a tan head. Plenty of chocolate, coffee and roasted notes. The cocoa wafts in on the nose and dominates. Smooth and drinkable with enough of a hop factor to even out the sweeter, dessert inflected elements. A classic, whether enjoyed on tap or from the bottle this is a top class porter.

Bottle from GBBF 2014 and drunk at home. I know Ive had this before, Ive just never rated it. Bizarre, seen it on shelves for years in the UK but only just now got around to rating it. Black beer lasting tan head. Big chocolate on the aroma. But smooth chocolate. Wow. Its just like drinking pure chocolate. Sheet, that is really nice. Cozy like velvet? Check. A little bit of milkiness perhaps. But its just so damn good. so drinkable. Lovely. Poised delicate all enveloping, lots of chocolate but never papery or thin. Just the right balance of everything. Just a bit of milk perhaps. Lovely though.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Coudy very dark brown color, average sized brownish head. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Very strong chocolate aroma, some coffee and nuts. Medium sweet taste, with some mild bitterness. Texture is creamy and oily. One of the best porters out there, no doubt.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2016 Dark as hell, big tan head. The greatest tasting foam ever. I usually don?t even try to taste only foam without a liquid, but this one looked delicious. The taste was delicious as well. Like some mousse chocolate pudding or something like that. The beer itself has a huge chocolate and coffee aroma, with some caramel, cocoa, nuts and traces of vanilla. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Finish is pleasant bittersweet coffee and chocolate. The bestest!
(Za Popen?t 0,33l bottle)

Aroma: Toasted and roasted malts with hints of nuttiness. Appearance: Mahogany with rocky tan head. Taste: Light sweetness throughout with hints of bitterness at the edges. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, sweet finish. Overall: A rich, deep beer with lots of flavor. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The hops in this porter are a great compliment otherwise I wouldn't score it as high. Chocolate on the nose and a rich, dark chocolate, velvety taste. Overall a pretty damn good porter. One of my go to's.

Not much head. Pleasant chocolate and maybe yeasty aroma. Good malty flavor well balanced with just enough hops.

Draft to pint glass
Milk chocolate, a little coffee, tar, toasted malt, caramel, and toffee. Silky black with a thin creamy tan head. Dark chocolate, coffee, malt, oak, and caramel.
Draft at Founders. Pours black. Aroma and taste are chocolate, coffee, and malts.

My first dark beer so I need to revisit it. Strong coffee and chocolate taste and smell.

The aroma is burnt malt, coffee, chocolate, and hops. The appearance is dark dark dark brown with a small head. The taste is like the aroma and quite bitter without much sweetness. The palate is smooth. Overall a good example of the style, its definitely quality, but its not sweet enough and personally I think its overrated.

Bottle poured TJ's....pours dark as night, brownish black. Not much head. Aroma is chocolate, and lesser coffee. Some kind of dark fruit. First sip tasty, bubbly but not too much. Aftertaste of dark chocolate, clean palate. Hoppiness makes this a great porter.

Silk black, with nice cream head. Full of malt and hops. Really nice beer to finish off a session.

beige head , foamhead, leaves structured lacing. coffee colour. aroma of oat and chocolate. taste like aroma, milksugar, sweet, liquorice aftertaste rather bitter. medium body and carbonation. is this a milkporter? :) bottle 35.5cl</>
Flaska á Microbar. Hann er ágengari en ég hefði ætlað. Passlegur einmitt núna þegar sumar drúpir höfði og styðst við haust.

Pours v dark caramel with a tan head that's short lived. Tastes coffee and sweet with slight bitter aftertaste. V similar to a stout homebrew I did (though I say it myself.. - not as sweet though) complex and tasty.

Small dark tan head, carbonation is present. Aroma consists of chocolate and coffee. Tastes dark, chocolate bitterness with some coffee, body is lighter than expected.

Excellent, nothing bad to say, dark brown with sturdy dark tan head, creamy and rich, with chocolate, coffee and toffee, but still light and enough to stay in the porter ballpark, just enough hopping to keep it well-rounded.

Very dark, small tan head. Roasty smells. Medium body, good carbonation. Slightly sweet, roast bitterness, hop bitterness but not aroma, coffee aroma lingers. A great porter to drink near room temperature on a cold night, savour in a snifter. Personally I find these types very rich - 1/3 to 1/2 a bottle is plenty for me!

Chocolatey coffee flavor. Bitter and crushable. Smells chocolates. Had out if a bottle at home. Poorest black with a tan head
