Pours dark brown with big brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, caramel, coffee. Chocolate taste followed by some coffee bitterness. Creamy. Lovely. Great porter.

Bottle 0,35L. Murky black colour with big, creamy, light brown head, that sits down in 2 minutes. Aroma of dark chocolate and caramel. Taste starts medium bitter, followed by black coffee and dark chocolate, become slightly sweet and turns back to medium bitter finish. Medium body, watery texture and soft carbonation, but somehow still smooth with velvetly mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours black with a medium, dark tan head. Wonderful aroma of chocolate, coffee, and toasted malt. Medium-thick, creamy body with moderate carbonation. Flavor is sweet with chocolate and coffee notes, with just enough hoppy bitterness to round out the taste. What a great porter!
Bottle from a Archive Beer Boutique August 2013. Charcoal black colour with a swirling tan head. Thin body but packed full of flavour that fills the mouth.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2015 Vähän tunkkainen kiireessä juotu Porter. Ihan hyvä, väärä ympäristö. Eliittivalmistelut. Oikein hyvä.
Aroma of chocolate, molasses, and coffee. Nice ebony color. Nice bitter chocolate sweetness up front. Dry finish with a smokey bitterness that balances out sweetness nicely.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 An impressive porter, very dark and opaque with faint red highlights, thick enough to resist a LED light, yet pours with not much of a tan head.  Smells distinctive with an espresso coffee aroma and some dark fruit. Taste is enjoyable, heavily roasted malt with dark chocolate and coffee bitter accents. Very flavorful and also very smooth, not thin at all but still manages to be slightly watery. Some hoppiness but the bitterness primarily comes from the burnt chocolate malt.  I found this at $8-9 a six-pack, a great classic porter for that price. Recommended overall.
16 oz draft. Opaque brown. Minimal head. Faint chocolately nose. Taste is chocolate/toffee. Lingering aftertaste. Decent beer.
Awesome porter. Smooth, chocolatety, tan head, nice balanced hippy flavor. I thoroughly enjoy these in the fall and winter. Nothing better.

pours quite dark verging on black without a very large head, even with a vigorous pour.
Smells richly of roasted and toasted malts with a bit of coffee and espresso.
Tastes smokey with roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Some hops are present to give some bittering.
Thick full bodied beer. Smooth but with a little bit of grittiness.Tastes a bit watery too. 
A good beer.

Appearance: Black color with a small beige head that ends up in a thin layer. Probably the only thing that is not perfect with this beer.Aroma: Balanced and nice! Coffee, roasted and chocolate.Palate: Medium + body. Balanced mild sweetness and an ok bitterness. Average to soft carbonation.Taste: Rich balanced chocolate, some coffee and a bit roasted.Overall impression: Just perfect! Probably the best porter I have had.Personal stats: Bottle at Førtito Bar & Bowling in Sarpsborg, Norway.Porter #100!
Chocolately aroma and taste. Minimal head. Dark. Smooth mouthfeel. Beautiful porter.

Pours a dark brown with a very tan head that leaves lacing. The nose is mostly chocolate with some burnt caramel notes.Taste is syrupy and chocolatey and then the palate has a long lasting aftertaste of bitter chocolate and slightly cherry flavors. I like but its not really my type.
On tap scura buona schiuma persistente buone tostature al naso piu morbida in bocca secchezza media amaro medio leggeto liquoroso noce

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Tremendous porter on draft. Nice deep/dark flavors of chocolate, coffee, and caramel. Really smooth and easy drinking. One of the better porters that Ive had. Great by the bottle but even better on draft.

Pours jet black like motor oil with tan head. Cocoa and mocha aromas. Poured into turonis pint glass. Chocolate y taste. Not much carbonation. Velvety finish. A gem of a porter. Founders delivers again

Poors jet black oily and slightly thick, thin tan head that seems to disappear and cling to the edges of the glass. Syrupy, chocolate and smooth. Very low carbonation was a suprise with this one. Was like a black chocolate milk shake with hints of beer. Great wee desert beer.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Bottle from Beautiful Beers (online). Dark, dark brown with a slight purplish hue. Small tan head. Scent of dark chocolate, coffee, Marmite. The taste is ambrosial: a bittersweet chocolate overload with the slightest sour tinge. A surprising bitter hop bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. The mouthfeel is thick and syrupy, with the perfect amount of carbonation on the lips and gums. Warming, and tastes a lot stronger than it is. Incredible.
Mørk/svart farve med beskjedent skum. Lukt av røstet malt, sjokolade, karamell, lakris og vanilje. Smak av røstet malt, sjokolade, kaffe og karamell. Melkebaren 20140702.

Bottle Smooth velvety black pour with a small finger of chocolate coloured head, looks like a thick imperial stout. Aroma is, lots of roast, chocolate, coffee, some nuttiness, and a bit of anise. Taste is, smooth roast up front, followed by some chocolate, coffee, velvety mouth feel, with a mild bitter finish, and a coffee roast aftertaste

Excellent beer. Probably the best you can buy at ATVR. Pure pleasure and then some 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Duft av bek, kaffe og lakris. Dyp mørk farge, nesten svart. Lite skum, ring langs kant. God smak av kaffe, noe sjokolade og vanilje.

Draft and bottle. For a porter strong from a style point of view. Pours and looks great in the glass. Smells of chocolate, malt and biscuit. Not bitter at all and has a sweetness. I love this summer or winter.

Poured from bottle into can-shaoed Pabst glass because I like being silly. Pours dark brown with thin tan/ brown head. Scent is not that strong to me, maybe Im doing something wrong. Taste is heavy on the chocolate in the front then residually bitter and still roasty in the back. Excellent, delicious beer for a "regular" bottle.

Bottle. Pours black with rich tan head. Aroma is very rich and chocolatey, vanilla, desserty. Taste is very rich, chocolate, bitter, long bitter, roasty finish. This is amazing. Maybe the best plain porter that I have had.

Sicuramente una delle migliori poter in assoluto. In bocca è un tripudio di sapori, tra i quali emerge (come di stile) il maltato, il tostato (caffè) e il cioccolato. Ottimo il bilanciamento tra dolce e amaro. Per gli amanti dello stile, è un vero peccato non provarla

What a crazy greay brew I had on tap at Salt House in Galway. The pour is a slick and viscous black gloop that has nearly no head but a thin layer of tan bubbles. The nose is well roasted and heavily fortified with espresso and vanilla notes amidst huge roasted dark chocolate malt. A bit sweet in the middle with a big backdrop of robust roasty bitterness and mild hop astringency. Overall a great brew for dark beer fans.

Because this beer deserves at least a 4.00 and not a 3.99. Smooth, silky, and definitely sexy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Nearly black pour with a smallish mocha head. Mainly chocolate aroma with a bit of caramel and light savoury notes, like red meat or soy sauce. Flavour is chocolate with a bit of coffee, caramel and smoke, and lots more subtle notes. Gets sweeter as it warms. Complex and enticing, pretty full-bodied for a porter, and very nicely balanced with bitterness. A delicious porter.
I am not sure why it took me so long to have one of these, but it is a staple in my fridge and cellar now!
Great aroma to start, followed up a wonderful mouthfeel and taste! Big chocolate and mocha overtones.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2014 Bottle from Craftissimo. Inky cola-black, dark tan watery fizzy head, small spotty legs. Strong aroma of roasted malt, coffee, lots of chocolate, some herbal hop to balance. Slight bit of dried fruit, but not at all raisiny/sour. Tastes of bitter hop, toasted/cereal malt (not burnt but a little acidic), slightly nutty, lemony acidity, chocolate. The roastiness and bitterness balance each other well. Body is on the thin side, good bit of carbonation, lemony/slightly chalky finish. Reminds me of a less creamy, less fine version of the Alesmith Speedway Stout. Really nice big bitter porter.

Bottle from Craftissimo at TST waterfront. Chocolatey roasted aroma. 
Hoppy bitterness. Velvety chocolate. Surprisingly clean finish. Body isn't too thick but doesn't lack either. Great porter.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2014 Pours black with a small brown fizz. Smells of roast, chocolate, hints of coffee. Taste is chocolate, bitter, roasty, subtle hints of caramel. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Founders Porter finishes just as they say, "dark, rich, and sexy."

Big thick boozy chocculut aroma with hint of grains. Smells like a delicious bittersweet meal, wholesome. Head is fine and thick, lovely tan caramel colour and the liquid is opaque dark brown to black. Wowzer, one of the thickest beers Ive ever tasted, really creamy texture with some burnt flavours, coffee slightly and burnt chocolate with a cereal hint. Solid of its style, nothing outlandish but it says what it does with perfection. Feels like cool liquid chocolate in the back of my throat. I would prefer it if it were slightly less grainy and sort of crisper and rich in flavour whilst still having this wonderful thick texture but thats just a personal preference. Amazing beer

Pours very dark with minimal tan head, coffee, liquorice and dark chocolate on the nose with noticable smoky and roasted malt. Taste is absoltely lovely, mildly sweet yet bitter with lots going on. Fantastic porter and one i will definitely buy more of!
Pours a deep, dark ebony with a thin chocolate head. Little-to-no lacing. Roasty, charred flavor with a full bitter finish.

Bottle, 355 ml. Pours jet black with a small amount of creamy tan Head. Lots of lacing. Aroma dominated by roasted bready malts and dark chocolate. Slight hay note to it too. Taste of very bitter, burned malts and again a dark chocolate presence. Slight floral aftertaste.. Carbonation is a bit too high yet the body is thick and velvety enough.

Pourer from bottle into tulip: pours black with a thin tan head and little to no lacing. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, coffee, and a bit of sweetness. Taste is more of the same but predominantly chocolate and caramel. A little hop note on the back end balances this beer out nicely. Silky smooth mouthfeel, perfect carbonation, heavy body. Awesome porter.
Caramel, chocolate, coffee, toasty. Mocha head. Good mouth feel. Slightly carbonated. Good dessert beer.

Pours a deep brown with barely a trace of a tan head. Smells of chocolate, floral hops, hint of nuttiness. Taste is sweet and moderately bitter - chocolate on top with hint of dark fruit, flowery hops.

Dégustée (bouteille) le 8 juin 2012 au Mondial de la Bière 2012 à Montréal (D9C3KPPO). Bière noire opaque. Col beige foncé, mince crémeux et très persistant. Odeur de café marquée. Douce, assez sucrée, très amère. Goût de café au lait bien présent. Excellente, pas sirupeuse, se boit bien.
Nice dark Brown pour, motes of roast, vanilla and honey. Bitter sweet choclate finish...a very good pprter

Appearance- very dark, just about pitch black, completely opaque. Half a fingers light brown/mocha head, which leaves some lacing. Aroma- coffee, milk chocolate, malts, a bit of espresso, caramel, some dark fruits and a bit of liquorice also come through. Taste- lovely. Milk chocolate is the first thing that hits, followed by lots of coffee bitterness, cocoa powder, and bitter dark chocolate. Hints of burnt sugar and treacle toffee are detectable. Smooth and silky in the mouth, and the feel is pretty full. The finish is long and very bitter. This is really excellent.

Poured a deep black with a medium tan head; very little lacing. Aroma is a soft roasted malt with a hint of chocolate. Light sweet and medium bitter taste with a light, dry hop finish that pleasantly lingers. Light to medium bodied with creamy fizziness. Overall, a friendly porter that is just right.

Pours jet black in color with a nice tan head. Aroma is sour wood, light coffee, and dark chocolate. The taste is rich and full. Theres a very slight sour note, followed by a bitterness from the chocolate malts used. Velvety mouthfeel. A little bit of bitter cocoa flavor as well. Really good porter.
Bottle from Strait and Narrow, Lincoln. Jet black with thin brown head. Aroma and taste of roast malts, dark chocolate and molasses.

Bottle. Black with thin brown head with orange highlights. Aroma of dark chocolate and soy sauce. Medium/heavy body with dark chocolate, vanilla, a hint of soy sauce, and coffee with a dry bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours black with thin head that dissipates. Mild chocolate aroma. A nice porter with very little bitterness and a sweet chocolate finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malts, honey, brown sugar, vanilla. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, honey, brown sugar, hazelnuts. Mouthfeel is quite light-bodied with low carbonation. Aftertaste is chocolate, roasted nuts, vanilla

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Hotel glass
From: Whole Foods in Tempe, Ariz.
Price: $2.59
Purchased: May 15, 2014
Consumed: May 16, 2014
Misc.: Bottled April 25, 2014

Poured an almost pitch black color with 1-to-2 fingers of bubbly, tan head. Good layered, foamy, spiderweb lacing along the sides of the glass. Average retention.

Smelled dark chocolate fudge, smoky woodfire, dark roasted nuts, crayon, caramel, toffee, chocolate and some dark bitter coffee malts.

Tasted better than the smell, but still pretty similar. Got dark chocolate, fudge, smoky fire, crayon, toffee, rich, smoky roasted nuts, caramel and smooth coffee notes.

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish. Was great all the way down.

A very good porter. This one grew on me as it went down. I might of underrated this a bit.
Malty smokey aroma. pours thin, dark and thin head. Nice balance of malt, mocha, raisin, roasted porter. Moderately light on palate, with pleasant lingering aftertaste.

Transfer from BA review on 2-9-12 -

Poured into pint glass

Appearance  Pours a dark brown almost black color with a billowy dark tan head. The head is rather persistent and lasts quite awhile. Eventually when it fades, and when the glass is swirled, it leaves some nice lacing.

Smell  The nose is relatively mild, but contains some notes of chocolate and a bit of caramel and vanilla sweetness.

Taste  A nice sweet bready maltiness is the first to be tasted. Roasted barley and some chocolate work their way into the flavor toward the middle of the taste. At the very end ,it sweetens again this time with some chocolate and vanilla which round out the taste profile quite nicely.

Mouthfeel  A nice smooth yet relatively thick body. It coats the tongue but yet is still very east to drink. The carbonation is spot on enhancing the drinkability of the brew.

Overall  A nice porter with lots of deep roasty and chocolate flavors. One of the better and more affordable porters.

Bottle from Vino Wines. Black body with a thick beige head. Great lacing. Aroma of cherry, metal, dirt and chocolate. Flavour of copper and black pepper. Medium body with a smooth oily texture. Faint fizz. Not as impressive as their Imperial Stout or Breakfast Stout.

Almost black pour with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate coffee and cocoa. Taste of burnt malts, chocolate , coffee, faint hops, and cocoa on the slightly dry finish. Medium bodied, nicely carbonated, perfectly balanced, excellent porter!
Had this one playing poker at a friends house. Really good flavor, goes down smooth, chocolate aftertaste. I really like ths one.

Black in colour with a thin tan head, good lacing. The aroma is roasty, some espresso, creamy, light sweetness, some chocolate. The flavour is roasty with lots of coffee and espresso, cream, burnt malts. Roasty mouthfeel, medium body, mild carbonation. Finishes long and roasty. Excellent stuff here.
Bottle opened on November 8, 2010.

355ml bottle. Pours out a very dark brown shade. Aroma and taste form an earthy, coffee bean, chocolate like flavour. I pick up some hops in there too. Fairly thick, oily and silky smooth mouthfeel. This is a fine porter, but considering how highly rated it is I expected so much more.

Beautiful black beer with a fine, creamy,thick beige head. Smells of caramel, roasted malts, coffee, dark fruits. Similar taste with also some chocolate and a very good final light sourness. Excellent.

12oz bottle. Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, coffee and chocolate malt. Intense roasty flavor, powerful coffee and chocolate notes. Full bodied with a smooth creamy mouthfeel, roasty and sweet finish. I love porters- and this is one of the best I have had.

Black pour with a tiny bit of brown around the edges with a small brown head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel and roasted malts. Creamy body, medium carbonation. Flavor is mostly milk chocolate with nice hints of roasted coffee beans and even some dark, dried fruit. Roastiness lingers into the finish. Perfect representation of a porter.

From 355 ml bottle. Pours a solid opaque black with not even a highlight at the edge. Sudsy tan head that collapses to a collar. Aromas of dark fruit (prunes, raisins, currants), rich coffee, cocoa powder, cinnamon, dark chocolate and a touch of leather. Taste is rich fruit and caramel initially but that quickly gives way to roast coffee bitterness with a little hint of smoke in the background. Chocolate notes at the back end with more though lighter fruit at the back end. Smoke and spice in the aftertaste. Excellent.

Bottle from Beergium.com. Dark brown body, with a small, creamy, tan head. Wonderful aroma of melting chocolate, coffee, smoke, toffee, dark fruits. Tastes of coffee, smoky wood, dark chocolate, dark fruits, liquorice. Mouthfeel is medium, creamy, with a lively carbonation and it finishes bitter, roasty, with coffee and dark chocolate. Delicious! Full, dark, complex, everything you want from a Porter!
One of the best porters I have had. Rich in flavour and a heavy body. Chocolate dominates.
Nice, rich porter! Burnt malt, chocolate, hops, and milk in the aroma and taste. Creamy mouthfeel, with a pleasant bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 A dark black body sits beneath a late blooming 1" medium-dark smooth khaki head leaving a couple short, thin peninsulas of lace

Caramel chocolates caresses dried dark fruits with a sweet flowing molasses base on a silky body which sports a sharp drying texture with a solid roast and herb bitterness finishing out followed by a lasting roasty sweet residual

12oz bottle served at 50º into 14.7oz Zwiesel Tritan Cognac

Un autre classique parmi les classiques. Une belle mousse sur un liquide presque noire. Un nez de chocolat et de café. La bouche a un surplus de gaz carbonique avec des notes de chocolat simple. Piquante à cause du gaz, décevante à cause du gaz et du «hype».
Chocolate brown in colour with light brown head. Aromas of chocolate. Tastes sweet with very faint bitter notes.

37th birthday beer no 16. Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Black beer with residual mocha head around the rim. Aroma of chocolate cocoa powder, coffee and roast malts. Taste is bitter coffee, chocolate, licorice and some prunes. Medium to light bodied with light carbonation. Very good beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 12oz bottle with a very dark pour and thin Beige head. The nose is a well balanced and complex mix of coffee, roasted malts, bitter chocolates, with peat in the background. The rich flavors of roasted coffees, bitter chocolates and smoke mirror the aromas. The hops support this very well, too. Rich body with a slight dry finish. One of the best Porters I have had!

Bottle from Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Just about black. Thin, lasting, tan coloured head. Liquorice. Cocoa. Milky coffee. Taste is dried, dark fruit. Palate is thick, sweet chewiness. Dry roastiness at the end. Lovely.
Aromas of chocolate, coffee, sweet malt. Taste follows nose. Not overly complex but a solid great tasting beer. Imwould call this an Impy stout light. Will definetly drink again.
Pours dark dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and smoke. Taste follows nose. Everything you could want in a porter.

12oz. bottle. Pours a thin, poorly retained, beige head, over a dark brown (SRM 30) body.....nose is light cocoa, chocolate, coffee, no esters, light hop.....taste is moderate cocoa, chocolate, coffee throughout, no esters, ending with a moderate hop bitterness......mouth feel medium body, light acid, carbonation high. This is a quite typical Robust Porter. The roasted malts are ascendent, but do not dominate over much. It is as such nicely balanced. BJCP 9/3/17/4/8
Ottima porter che appaga sotto tutti i punti di vista, dominata dal caffè, seguono note di cioccolato, malti tostati e un tocco amaro nel finale. Golosa!
0,33l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours very dark brown with a low off-white head. Aroma is full, roasted malts. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee and hops. Quite nice.
Bottle. Dark brown color with a minimal beige head. Aroma of coffee, licorice, smoke and roasted malt. Burned taste, some sweetness. Bitter finish. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Appearance: This beer pours with a smaller tan head that dissipates in a couple minutes, the beer itself is black with some very small brown edges in the light

Aroma: coffee, dark grain, perhaps some bread, not particularly complex or intensely aromatic but not bad or dull either, I guess average

Taste: chocolate, coffee, some bitterness on the finish, not too sweet, 

Palate: soft carbonation, very thick and heavy mouthfeel, average bitter aftertaste

Overall: I dont think this beer is bad but I dont think it lives up to its rating either, a little too simple, average
Drat - Roast malts and dark chocolate. Jet dark brown with a thin brown head. Roast malts with some molasses. Decent, but nothing special.

Founders Porter has a medium-to-thick, beige head, an extremely dark brown appearance, and a touch, here and there, of lacing left behind. The aroma is rich, sweet, dark-roasted malt, coffee, cream, and chocolate. Taste is of the same, with significant acidity and bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy and slick, and Founders Porter finishes semi-dry, delicious, and super-drinkable. Just a great, great beer. RJT

Really nice stout! Aromas of coffee and chocolate! Very smooth and easy to drink beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 Nose is slightly fudgy, black heavy roast coffee, extremely rich. Flavor is same. Practically an imperial stout from the aroma and flavor profile, truly a remarkable beer loaded with flavor for this ABV and style.

Has a kind of sticky, smoky/mesquite character.

Bottle shared with S&G.
APPEARANCE: black beer, small stable beige head.
NOSE: coffee, mocha, vanilla.
TASTE: mocha, coffee, bitter. Good for its ABV!

Bottle.
Pours almost black with a small dense beige head.
Dark chocolate, roasted malt, fresh coffee and raisins in aroma.
Dark chocolate, cocoa powder, coffee, well balanced bitterness.
Dry mouth feel, medium body, medium carbonation.
Dry bitter coffee after taste.
Solid porter! This is how I like them. Like Black Butte but a bit thicker.
Getting some chocolate and bitterness. Nice rich dark colour. Great beer to sit on through a movie. Probably wouldnt have more than one.

I awoke to the sound of thunder. Total darkness. Blackness surrounded me. Against my better judgment I was drawn to the outside. Oak trees towered over the smokey campfire, now damp from the rain. As the water washed over me I thought of my father, when he smoked a pipe when I was young. Pitch black. Morning may never come...
Tasted on tap. Very strong 2-note flavors; decent chocolate and some savory umami.

Une robe qui fait le style. Une tête petite et un début de dentelle. Un nez de café, de noisettes grillées et de caramel foncé. Efficace représentation olfactive. Sur les papilles, des malts chocolatés et légèrement brûlés. De la vanille grillée et du caramel croquant. En bouche, un corps bien crémeux. Des bulles parfaites. En finale, une sécheresse provoquée par une juste torréfaction. Ce porter est très efficace. Magnifique sur la langue. Créateur dendorphines. Jaime.

Brown, black, cloudy, frothy, brown foam, chocolate, coffee, earthy, smoke, woody, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, and all around a great porter.
Deep toasty aroma of malts and chocolate. Lighter body, super creamy. Chocolate, coffee, syrup, mocha, malts.

Dark black/brown pour, laces the bottle well. A lot of bitter coffee in the smell. A bit too bitter. Flavor is dark chocolate and roasted coffee but a bit sweet as well. A bit of carbonation but not too much. The bitterness overpowers. I guess I am not a big fan of bitter porters.

Roasty aromas, dark coffee, bitter chocolate, some molasses, some minerality. Very dark, basically black, with a lasting ring of off-white head foam. Dry, roasty malts well accompanied by hop bitterness. Medium bodied, very smooth.

29.03.2014. 0,355l Bottle. Stuelands Apothek, Haugesund. Black colour with tan head. Very rich and good beer. Dark malts, Coffe and dry bitter Chocolate. Aftertaste is more of the same. Good coffe notes and strong dark malts. Very rich with good balance between alcohol, body and bitterness. Really Good!!
Simple and to me a "standard" porter taste. Clean, mild carbonation, balanced with a medium body and lingering coffee/cocoa notes. My go to porter.

Bottle - Pours dark rich and creamy with a tan head. Has a deep roasted aroma and a taste to match. Dark coffee and mocha on the taste. Silky smooth mouthfeel with a malty backbone. Rich finish. Excellent!

Got a single from their 6-pack at the LCBO. Pours a real black colour with a good creamy beige head, long retention and some creamy lace. Coffee nose at first, but the dark fruits come out eventually with the mild yeast. The taste is smooth with the coffee/dark fruit combo. Nice roasted malts linger into the aftertaste. Hint of chocolate are faint with a nice bitterness blending with everything. A nice soft porter with lots of character that are well-blended.
bottled - An excellent porter - nice chocolate and coffee flavors. Good color and aroma. Very nice.

Poured into pint glass. Black with a finger of tan head. Smells like dark chocolate and coffee. Tastes like dark chocolate with a slight smokiness and bitter hops, coffee as well. It's oily but filing. It's a pretty balanced Porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of my go to porters - great frothy head and body to the beer - smooth start and finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle from Hy-Vee Muscatine. Black appearance with an average light brown head, light lacing. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, roasted malts, earthy hops, molasses and espresso. Similar flavor, roasty, dark and bittersweet. Medium plus body with soft carbonation and a somewhat dry, lingering light bitter finish. Smooth

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Pours great. Rich dark color. Nice thick head. Looks can be deceiving. Doesn?t taste as good as it looks. Rather bland. Have 5 more so may be an acquired taste. Will see how the next one tastes. Next one tasted better. Coffee flavor more prevalent.

Bottle to tulip glass. 
App.: Deep black, nice foamy light coffe head . 
Aroma: Nice smoke and coffee aroma. Chocolate bitterness in the mix. 
Taste: Light coffee and smoked malt, with a medium bitterness .
Palate: Medium body with lively carbonation . 
Creamy cake.
Great, simple porter. Silky, heavy on the chocolate. Well-bodied and balanced.

Bottle into an ale glass. Pour is a very dark brown almost black with a dark brown head. Aroma is sweet yet bitter chocolate and malt. Taste is over the top with hints of chocolate and caramel with a slight bitterness. Finish is very smooth and bitter sweet. This is a great porter.

330 ml bottle picked up in Fort Lauderdale, FL. Pours a huge tan head, thick, oily beer with lovely lacing. Aroma of chocolate, mostly. Some sweet vanilla and a touch of malt too. Very smooth taste, with clean and balanced malts and chocolate. Palate has a creamy mouthfeel and not overt carbonated and end nice and dry. Good even for my soft Bavarian Palate.
Svart öl med kaffe färgat skum. Doft: Choklad, kaffe, nougat, romerska bågar,körsbär, godis. Smak: Samma som doft. Fin söt hasselnötts kaffe eftersmak.

Bière brune au corps très dense présentant un col épais et crémeux avec un nez très fleuri, malté, torréfié, avec de la levure et des saveurs de café et une amertume à la fois florale herbacée et un peu granuleuse. En bouche, la gorgée est fort douce sur des notes crémeuses et malgré le faible ABV elle offre un léger sirupeux très moelleux sur des notes huileuses légères avec des saveurs de café fort mais pas trop dominant. La finale est acre moyennement longue accompagnée de cette levure poudreuse épicée. Pour moi plus un stout avec ce torréfié assez présent, quun Porter. Je note cependant avec bonheur que toutes les saveurs séquilibrent avec la même intensité rendant la dégustation très agréable et douce. Belle réussite

Reviewed from notes. The appearance has a black colored body that leaves a two finger tan/off white head that dies to a film within a minute. 
The smell has coffee up front with strong side notes of chocolate and even as the beer warms up more some light vanilla comes out. 
The taste has all of these previously mentioned flavors and becomes bitter and sweet in different ways.
The palate, its light and smooth, and is really creamy. Since the ABV is moderate -Id say this is sesessionable.
Overall, Im mostly impressed in this for its style and for me. Id come back to this if given the opportunity.

Bottle. Pours deep walnut with a thin mocha head; lots of lacing. Aroma is roast, chocolate and light coffee. Taste begins sweet with the malt and chocolate and cherry notes, but shifts to a nice long bitter finish and a touch of smoke. Nice fully creamy body, with good amount of fizzy. Excellent porter, but very stout-like.

Black with a small head. There are subtle notes of hops, chocolate and roasted bread in the nose. Mouthfeel is incredibly full bodied considering the abv. There is a creamy texture which goes down well with the roast and hops. Candy like finish. Awesome stuff.

Bottle. Pours an amazingly oily and rich black with a high cinnamon head. Nose is Mexican hot chocolate, espresso, and bacon. Crisp but very dark and smoky; bitterness is cleansing with a long, lemon-coffee finish. Not as heavy as it looks. Quite nice.

From tap. Pours dark, almost black. Thin, taupe head. Aroma is peat and wet stone. Very clean and even tasting. Chalky, with faint sweetness. Mineral, with a shade of smoke at the end. Very well done.

Draft at Founders Beer dinner. Pours midnight black with reddish/brown bordering. Not much head. Aroma is light coffee and chocolate. Taste is the same but rounded out with deep caramel malt. Heavy on the palate for a medium-bodied beer. Well made but it made me want the Breakfast stout since the latter is an overload of the ingredients in the former.

Huge chocolate, coffee, and earthy hop aroma. Taste strong coffee and dark chocolate with a bitter dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This was an amazing beer experience. Cola looking brew with a slightly off-white head. Potent aromas of fresh cocoa and some coffee. Tastes of cocoa nibs, bittersweet chocolate(lots of it), subtle dark coffee, toasted malts, and hints of earthiness. Semi-sweet, lactic finish. Extremely easy to drink, silky smooth, and delicious. This was fantastic.

12 ounce bottle. Opaque black color with a small bubbly tan head. Rich roasted malt aroma has notes of charcoal and French roast coffee. First sip yields a bittersweet, smoky roasted malt flavor that touches on dark coffee, chocolate and oak. Very close to being stout-like, but the nuances are more subtle, as you would expect in a porter. Slightly sweet, complex and spicy in mid taste. Finish is nutty, woody and rich with resiny hops. This is a truly great American Porter in a league with Great Lakes and Anchor, among others. A must have.
What a delicious treat of a beer! Absolutely wonderful from start to finish, chocolate expresso kind of flavor with great hops too!

Bottle. Pours a Black Tarry Colour.

Aroma. Smells of roasted malts, bitter chocolate and coffee.

Taste. Extremely rich and decadent, taste is similar to aroma, with a bitter espresso flavour especially pronounced throughout, with slight notes of toffee and some vanilla in the background.

Overall. A very decent beer certainly not for the faint hearted, very smooth and powerful throughout.

Poured from growler into tulip glass. Dark thick pour with one finger of dense tan head. Small rising bubbles reminds me of Guinness. Aroma is roasty malt, dark chocolate, coffee, nuts, raisin, a hint of smoke. Taste is very much the same. Full mouthfeel, thick, creamy, somewhat sticky. A nice bit of carbonation here. Nice long bitter finish. I think of porters as a bit sweeter than this. If I didnt know what it was, I would guess it to be a stout. Extremely good overall though!

Look: Pours with large, mocha head, fine small bubbles with some bigger ones in the middle. Good, steady, slow, creamy retention with sticky lacing. Nice, fat layer stays on top. Surprisingly some carbonation visible. Dark, dark with brown hue. Very nice, especially the retention. 


Smell: Dark, milk chocolate mix, roast and light coffee. Hint of caramel and some noble freshness. Fat, rich on the nose receptors. There is one note i cant really put my finger on, like a bit too oily (olive) burned bread crust you put on salad, in soups and shit like that. 


Taste: Smell roughly translates. Roasted, very solid middle malt medium sweetness. Dark and milk chocolate and very light caramel. Good roast bitterness goes into coffee with a hint of hops and sweetness - a nice touch at the end. 


Mouthfeel: Smooth, creamy, full body. Very nice. Carbonation noticeable but just the right amount. One of the biggest traits of this beer.


Overall: Sexy. Yea, why not. Mouthfeel is exceptional, the dark malt character is well developed and rich enough and that hint of fresh sweetness makes it a superb brew.

Deep brown in color, velvety pour... Aroma of chocolate, oak, hazelnut... Hints of smoke... Flavor is chocolate, hazelnut, oak, sweet nutty malts... Really nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great porter. Chocolate and rosted malty flavor. Pours pitch black with a nice brown head.
Fra flaske på Olympen 13 Apr 13. Svart. Mokkafarget skum som varer en stund. Søt kaffearoma. Smaken er melkesjokolade. Litt for søt - men god.

355 ml bottle bought at Craftissmo in Tsim Sha Tsui East.
Clear, deep Cola blackish brown colour with traces of yeast sediments; One quarter finger head and dark beige foam which fades in 30 seconds; Small sticky lacing and zero carbonation; Fragrant sweet aroma of roasted dark malt, with vanilla, milk chocolate, coffee, caramel, waffles, sugar and faint grass; Nice, light sweet taste of roast malt, with strong nuts, initial smoked salmon, black coffee, burnt toast, burnt toffee, dark chocolate, liquorices, light dry biscuits, lime and bitter hops; Mid to light body, slightly thick palate; Mouth feel is nutty and initially smoky, with unexpected but pretty nice smoked salmon which only lasts for a couple sips. Light sweetness is fully controlled by decent and limey bitter hops. Body is close to watery despite thickish tongue. Strong but subdued black coffee, expressive burnt toast, very well hidden booze. This is nice Hoppiness is faint grassy nose, strong lime and sharp grassy taste. Bitterness is authoritative and tasty for a lasting strong bitter sweet finish; Quite dry after taste, bitter and quite savoury to mouth.

Comments: This is a nice Porter no doubt. I prefer Porter and Stout to be a bit more creamy and have strong body, which this one kinda fell short in both areas, plus its head is unimpressive, and lesser variety in aroma and taste. However, it has some nice fleshes of smoke and nuts, firmly toasty and hoppy. Stubborn and nice in its own way, glad Ive tried it but its overhyped.

Bottle: Deep, dark brown color that appears pitch black in dimly lit rooms; topped with a nice, tan-ish colored head made of fine bubbles with very nice staying power. Aroma has big notes of milky chocolate, roasted malt, nuts, wood chips, & a faint campfire smokiness. Very timid char with a solid, slightly sweet counterbalance. Flavor is super nutty & very toasty up front with a hint of oily coffee bean, creamy chocolate, cocoa powder, & a small, leafy hop presence. It finishes with a boderline charred woody note, more nuts, & a bittersweet cocoa mouth coating. Great body on this - silky smooth & appearing much larger than the ABV would suggest. One of my favorite porters to date, & thats not even considering price point & availability. Doesnt have to be rare to be good, & this is proof of that. Founders knows how to handle darker malts.

Starts off with smokey burnt malt, that fades into some dark caramel with chocolate on the nose. No detectable hops in the aroma.

Appearance is jet black with some light ruby highlights around the edges, the beer is almost opaque.

Full bodied chewy mouthfeel, low to moderate carbonation, thin tan head.

Flavor starts off strong with roasted malt, almost a smokey flavor that gives way to dark caramel, liquorice,dates and some chocolate.

Overall very strong rich beer with a ton of complex malt flavor, maybe a touch heavy on the burnt notes for my taste but really great beer.

This is one delicious brew! Pours black with a light brown head. Smells chocolaty caramel and a bit of coffee. Taste is chocolate, coffee, hints of Carmel, and nuts and a subtle smokey-woody taste and a good medium-full body. My favorite porter, definitely. I love this beer and brewery!

Ap:Black (no red edges), creamy beige head.
Ar: Roasted, coffee, chocolate, nuts, some smoke. Nice!
T: Cacao (bakers chocolate) like bitterness, hints of coffee. Nice! 
P: Medium to full body, really nice!

Mousse brun-gris assez mince qui ne dure pas longtemps. Couleur très foncé. Au nez on sent lherbe, du sirop de chocolat au lait, fruits, chêne et une pointe dépices. Une finale noisette, amer et sec.
12 oz bottle. Coffee aroma, more Sumatran than Guatemalan. Flavors of chocolate and roasted nuts. Beautiful.
Sort, med tæt lysebrunt skum. Aroma: chokolade og kaffe. Det samme i smagen, plus en frisk bitterhed. God fylde, meget harmonisk.
UPDATED: APR 1, 2015 12oz bottle and on draft. Black beer with brown head. A nice coffee taste. Thick palate. Really enjoyed this beer. A nice beer to sip on.
Solid porter, nothing fancy, just a good balanced ale. Well worthy of the generally high ratings.
Sort i fargen med et lys brunt skum. Lukter kakaopulver og mørk sjokolade. Bitter mørk sjokolade og salt lakrissmak. Lite kullsyre, salt bitter ettersmak

Bottle. Thin brown-grey head that doesnt last long. Dark mahogany body. Nose is alcohol, grass, herbs, milk chocolate syrup, vinous fruits, meat, oak and spice. Bittersweet leads to a bitter and dry finish. Moderate carbonation. Good. I think this would go well with seafood.
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 Sample at a tasting. Black with a low head. I found this porter quite straight forward, with mostly roasted malt and coffee aromas.
A very good porter, I typically like my imperial stouts but this is very flavorful for a porter. Also pretty thick for the style which is good.

http://imgur.com/IkzfXZM - Bottle. Pours opaque black with thin tan head that laces. Smells of chocolate and roasted malt. Drinks smoothly with little lingering hop bitterness. Medium bodied. Tastes of bread, chocolate, earthy hops, and maple. Could easily drink a few of these and be happy. Good brew.

January 11, 2014. 355mL bottle from LCBO at Queens Quay and Yonge. Lovely porter. Weak aroma compared to the Breakfast Stout from Founders. Very dark and very smooth with hardly any aftertaste. Lovely porter.

Founders Porter is

Wonderful!
Can't wait to be thirsty again.

Porter in cui ben si equilibrano il gusto di cioccolato fondente e il gusto affumicato che rende questo prodotto molto accattivante. La parte maltata affumicata in bocca regala gusti che si sposano perfettamente con il retrogusto di cioccolato. Perfetta con un dessert al cioccolato o come aperitivo. Unico piccolo consiglio per migliorarla: renderla un pò meno pesante. Al terzo sorso già soddisfa per corpo e pienezza. Poi però un sorso tira l altro portato dalla curiosità !!

Kaffe, mørk chokolade , mørk malt, brød, bitter, mørk brun, brunt skum, cremet, blødt, kraftig.

Bottle (Little Dublin, Norrtälje) - Black in colour. Chocolate, roasted malt and a hint of smoke in the aroma. Smooth and chocolatey taste with notes of milk chocolate, roasted malt, coffee and some slightly smoky notes in the finish.
Bourbon flavour and taste! Works well with the smokey espresso aroma. Not my favorite porter but definitely a fine brew.

Pours a black brew with a medium brown head with regular retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate bitter with dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel and herbal hops, Medium bodied, smooth, well balanced, low carbonatation, flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a bitter finish and a bittersweet aftertaste. Delicious

Dark brew with a well laced and tan head. Tight but expressive aroma with dark chocolate, roast, some almost raisin like note and a hint of floral hops. On the palate it takes it time developing flavours in stages and leaves a bitter chocolate finish. Very nice brew indeed.

Poured into a glass it has a nice dark brown color and a light head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malts. I taste almost a little cherry or licorice, vanilla and chocolate. Nice bitterness to compliment. Very good porter.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Porter mit schöner braunen Schaumkrone. Geruch wunderbar nach Kaffee, Schokolade, Röstmalz. 
Geschmack angenehm nach Kaffe, leichte Rauchnoten. Im Hintergrund schmeckt man ganz leichte Frucharomen von Waldbeeren.
From bottle pours dark brown to black with very little head. Taste is coffee and chocolate. Very smooth and not as thick as the aroma would suggest. A very comfortable and pleasant quaff.
UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 Basically perfect all around. Setting the bar for porters. If you want to get a friend into porters use this one as the intro. Works every time!!

355ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown/black with a two finger, mocha head that leaves huge lacing. Aroma has big notes of chocolate, and roasted malts. Taste is balanced that starts with a milky chocolate, then goes to a creamy bitter dark chocolate and ends with a drawn out bitter aftertaste and dry finish. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Full and rich in the mouth with a great, creamy/oily/slick texture. Overall really fricking good. Seriously. Awesome taste and mouth feel. Would buy again for sure! Cheers!
33cl bottle from 2d2dspuma. Color is perfectly dark. Very thin head. Body is hipersoft and light oily. Taste is light bitter. Aroma is high chocolate, coffee, roasted, light metal. Quite good!

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours very dark with a small tan head. Nose is dominated by chocolate and coffee but also has notes of vanilla and caramel. Taste is sweet chocolate and roasted malts with a very balanced level of bitterness. Mouth is medium with soft carbonation and a great balanced finish. Excellent

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2015 Re-rate. Bottle. Pours a clear reddish dark brown with a frothy tan head that lasts a bit in a ring. Aromas of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, and light coffee. Flavor is sweet caramel, chocolate, vanilla upfront with a bitter roasted malt and coffee end. Medium bodied, slight dry finish with a smooth mouth feel.

Black pour with a surprisingly light-colored head. Chocolate is the resounding flavor but the hops add an interesting layer of complexity.

Bottled June 2013; BBE undated; Drank Dec 2013 - Jet Black in colour. Very Malty; roasty (almost burnt) malts, dark chocolate, caramel, coffee, hints of vanilla, some liquorice. Hoppy; earthy hops. Fruity; some dark fruits. Rich roast taste. Sweet roast chocolate malty and quite dry throughout. Becoming noticeably salty and Increasingly bitter and dry into the lingering finish. Liked this. Good Porter!

355 mL bottle. Pours opaque black with a thick beige cap. Aromas of chocolate, breakfast blend coffee, vanilla, raw sugar and brown spice. Lightly sweet and mildly bitter. Coating mouth feel and lasting finish of cocoa. Moderate carbonation and above average body. Delicious.

350ml bottle. Had waited a while and this didnt disappoint. Pours a very dark brown, almost black with brown head. Great aroma of strong coffee, chocolate and malts. Really great taste. Smooth coffee and chocolate. Yum
A bit of a mild aroma, really good chocolate and roasted coffee flavor. .. great beer!

Draft - pours black with soft brown hue , tan head , nice lacing . Mild chocolate and coffee roast flavors . Medium body . Slightly bitter finish . Exactly as advertised ....rich , dark , and sexy . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma agradable y muy interesante. Se perciben notas a chocolate y maltas caramelo, así cómo un ligero dulzor, sin embargo, a la vez se perciben aromas herbales proporcionados por la variedad de lupulos utilizados.

En cuanto al color, café obscuro muy profundo, cuerpo medio, carbonatacion practicamente nula. Corona de espuma media de buena retencion, su color es caova dejando un fino burbujeo en las paredes del vaso conocido cómo encaje de Bruselas.

En boca es suave, ligeramente picante, malta tostada y un final fresco.

Al paladar es una cerveza compleja, ya que a pesar de ser fácil de tomar, presrnta sabores complejos y difíciles de distinguir. En primera instancia se perciben las maltas tostadas, ligero chocolate y notas acaramelizadas, posteriormente un sabor fresco brindado por los lupulos invade la boca. Ciertas notas herbales se distinguen, sin embargo el ligero dulzor inicial se ve contrarrestado con el agradable amargor final, equilibrabdo de excelente forma esta cerveza.

En resumen hablamos de una porter diferente, ligeramente menos dulce y más herbal, sin embargo un paso menos fuerte que una stout, cumpliendo de esta forma su objetivo.

Bottle poured into a nonick pint, pours pitch black with a very small and fizzy brown head; aroma is very faint but chocolatey and malty; very roasty and smokey with a little chocolate up front; aftertaste dissipates quickly and is roasted coffee; texture is just right...smooth with a hint of carbonation. Very good! Needs to warm a bit before you drink it.

small frothy light brown head. fair lacing. fully diminishing. flat dark brownish-black body. aroma: moderate malt, dark bread, caramel, dark chocolate, wood, light alcohol. if: moderate sweet bitter. ff: moderate sweet bitter light acidic; long duration. palate: light medium body, oily texture,lively carbonation, metallic finish. Dulçor de caramelo, amargor de stout, lupulado, saboroso. Muito saborosa e bem feita. Ligeira acidez na segunda metade da cerveja não chega a incomodar. Esperava algo mais diferenciado, no entanto, dada a alta nota no ratebeer. Tradicional toque de café no paladar. Dulçor maltado. 50 s
Dark brown pour with a dark brown head. Nice roasted malt nose. Taste is quite nice, a great balance of roasted malt, hops and slight bitterness.

Bottle-Pours a deep dark brown with a light brown thick head with a reddish tint. Smell figs and dark roast coffee. Lots of sexy smokiness and caramel malts that are balanced and the hops are blended well together. Very robust. Nice brew.

Pours black with a thin light brown head. Aroma has a roasted coffee and strong chocolate scent. Flavor is sweet with a robust caramel chocolate coffee flavor. Aftertaste of coffee lingers. Well above many porters I have drank.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a diminishing creamy tan medium head. Aroma is chocolate, cocoa, licorice, mild coffee ,charred and roasted malts. Taste is moderate light+ sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is viscous and carbonation is soft. Finishes balanced with lingering licorice.
very nice aroma,mouthfeel is very smooth as is the taste.very well balanced with chocolate malts and a bit of coffee.medium body and nice finish.

The aroma is chocolate and malt, with a bit of roasty coffee bean in there. The head is pecan in color and frothy, never quite thinning completely. The brew itself is black as night. The taste is a marvelous blend of coffee and chocolate, topped off by a mild bitterness from the hops. It has a thick oily feel on the palate with a malty, coffee-like aftertaste. Wonderful porter.

Pours pitch black with very little head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, malt sweetness. Taste is coffee and milk chocolate, with some caramel. Mouthfeel is very smooth & creamy and the sweetness balances out the bitter finish really nicely. Really good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I really like this one. I am not a big dark beer drinker, so this porter I find balances easy drinking with flavor. But it is definitely take compared to some of their other beers, like KBS.

(355mL bottle from LCBO) Pours a black with a quite frothy tan head, recedes leaving a ring and lace. Aroma reasonably strong for a porter, dark chocolate, roast malts, brown sugar sweetness, coffee, slight dark fruity notes. On the tongue the flavour moves from roasty into slightly sweet and then back to bitter, very nice balance. Roasted and chocolate malts are quite prominent, nice dark chocolate flavour with toasty bitterness, a good helping of sweetened dark-roast coffee, slightly burnt flavour later on with quite a decent bite of bittering but not overly green hops. Dark chocolate and a slight nutty flavour linger long after swallowing along with a little roast. Mouthfeel is moderate but not watery like some porters, carb fairly soft, dry and powdery in the finish. I usually find myself wanting a bigger dark beer when drinking a standard porter. This is a serious exception to that rule - great concentration of aroma and flavour at a reasonable ABV with a dry, drinkable character. Lovely stuff.
Was expecting something a little different from this porter but overall a very drinkable smooth beer from founders.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2014 355ml bottle. Pours black with a frothy tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, cocoa powder, brown sugar and roasted malts with a hint of vanilla. Taste is caramel, dark chocolate, molasses and licorice. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, smooth and somewhat powdery texture. Sweet and chocolaty finish. A really decadent porter.

Bottle at Monks American bar. Pours black with a medium sized brown head. Aroma has chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, light caramel. Taste is light sweet, bitter chocolate and lightly burnt malt, mid-bitter roasted finish.

This is just about the perfect porter. I prefer other dark brews, but this has the "porter" dryness and bitter chocolate notes. This should be the standard for porters and then we can start experimenting, yum.

Pours black with moderate light brown head. Heavy dark aromas of coffee, some berry and charred oak. Intense burst of flavors when first tasted. The oak turns into vanilla, coffee also, hopped so that a blackberry tingle hits the back of the tongue. Mouthfeel silky. Aftertaste long. Lovely beer. Prefer their breakfast stout a tad more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark brow-black. Three finger high, beige, head. 
Nose: Caramel malt, Coffe, roasted malt, chocolate, dark bread and hazelnut. 
Taste: Soft, creamy taste. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasty with a perfect balaced bitterness. Medium body and a little carbonation.

355 mL bottle from my brother served cold in a tulip glass. Deep brown-black with a decent mocha head. Roasted malts, some chocolate and coffee notes, tight when cold, a little milk chocolate, fairly full for a porter. Medium+ body with fairly full effervescence. Dark-roasted malts with a bit of dark chocolate and coffee, somewhat powdery, quite full for a porter; dry with moderate bitterness and a nice roasted malt and dark chocolate finish. Quite nice for a porter.
Bottle. Deep dark brown color.Tan head. Wonderful coffee aroma. Taste is a great coffee-chocolate taste. Great stuff.
One of my favorites. Dark, roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Very smooth and drinkable. Awesome beer.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2014 Pours black with brownish foam.  Neutral aroma.  The taste is very cloying through the overuse of caramel malts.  The alcohol is also way too strong.  This beer is highly overrated and there are far better porters out there.  It totally lacks the English ester profile.  Tastes like a beginner´s homebrew.  Go out and buy all the dark/black malts that you can find and throw them together.  I am tasting it side by side with a Fuller´s London Porter and the Founders is not even in the same class.
Black with tiny off brown lacing. Nose of chocolate and roasted malts, a little booze. Taste of burnt malts, coffee, vanilla and a nice bitterness. Finishes dry and long.

From chicken scratch during tasting at bier baron (brick cellar) in DC. 

A: standard dark chestnut brown. Excellent clarity. Cream foam covers surface and sides. 

S: cocoa, hazelnut, classic porter malts. Really well done here. 

T: flavors remind me of my beloved black butte porter from deschutes. This is maybe a hair more dry. 

M: creamy, full bodied, with low carb. Slick finish. 

O: if I moved from deschutes territory, this an Edmund fitz would be my go tos for porter.

Serving type: on-tap

06-23-2011

355 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is roasty coffee and dark chocolate. Flavour is rich and roasty with dark chocolate, some coffee and some earthy bitterness. Medium-full body. Slick mouthfeel. Ridiculously drinkable.

12 oz bottle poured black with thin tan head and heavy lacing. Nose is cocoa, vanilla, chocolate, roast malts. Taste opens sweet with chocolate,@ roast malts, light hops...end quite bitter with a lingering hop taste.

Kaatuu lasiin sysimustana ja niukkavaahtoisena, joka kuitenkin jättää kevyen reunuksen. Hajussa on paljon lakritsijuurta, kevyemmin taas suklaata ja limppumaista sekä ruisleipäistä leipäisyyttä. Hyvin hennosti on myös paahdetta. Mussa on vahvimpana puhdasta lakritsia, jota tukee ruisleipä, suklaa ja loppupuolella myös maitoisuus. Suutuntuma tuntuu alkuun hyvin miedolta, mutta on kuitenkin melko täyteläinen ja kermainen. Katkeroitakin löytyy suht mukavasti. Paljon saatu näihin prosentteihin, toisaalta kevyt, mutta toisaalta runsas. Toisaalta simppeli, mutta toisaalta hyvinkin monipuolinen.

Slightly more coffee than I generally prefer but I do love how this porter finishes

caramel, coffee, chocolate, roasty, resin, citrus, leather, vanilla, butterscotch, black, minimal head, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, umami, metallic ,full body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation, astringent,
UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 A fantastic porter. Pours black. Is thick, almost need a spoon! It drinks smooth with a hint of bitterness.  Smoky on the backend.

Smells quite nice. Smoky, earhty, metallic, dark roasted malt. Dark black, with long-ish lasting brown head. Quite well balanced and full flavored for 6.5%. Creamy, chocolate, burn flavors upfront, finishes with some coffee, nutty and slight hope bitterness. Good body to this for the percentage. Pretty great porter.

Bottle--almost black pour with a small tan head that did not leave any lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and coffee. Taste starts with the roasted coffee and ends up with some bittersweet cocoa. Medium thickness and creamy feel on the finish. Happy Founders is in Florida. Total wine.
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 Black with a beige head and plenty of lace. Aroma of milk, roast, coffee, and  chocolate. Rich roasty taste thats fairly bitter. Smooth, medium body. Very solid.
Black, nice brownish head that lasts a short time. Malty, glue aroma. Malt burned taste coffee nice bitter aftertaste. Medium body medium carbon
Bottle pours opaque black with tan head. Nose roast chocolate and coffee. Taste bitter up front, then roast, coffee, dark chocolate. Smooth mouth. Light bitter and roast finish. Smooth transitions.

Appearance - black pour with tan head. Very smell head 

Aroma - not much of anything 

Mouth - very creamy. Low carb. 

Taste - hit with alcohol at first but as it got warmer more chocolate came out. Nice and toasty. Smooth aftertaste. Not hoppy like black butte. 

Overall - excellent. I like how the chocolate is pronounced. Might be the best porter I have had since bells. More winter like a stout.
Founders Porter is really well balanced and smooth. Not quite as complex as the oatmeal breakfast stout.

Bottle poured into nonic. Finger of tan head settles to a cap on top of near black opaque liquid. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, mocha, burnt toast. Taste is all kinds of roasty/burnt malt bitterness, a little cocoa sweetness, a touch of late hoppy bitterness and maybe some veggies and dark fruit sweetness. On the low end of full bodied, slick and creamy texture, low carbonation, abrupt bitter finish.
Bottle at home 6th December 13. Smooth and full of chocolate. Good and tasty porter. Not bad, but nothing amazing

Black with a good tan head. Aroma of coffee and toffee. Velvety palate with some bright carbonation. Taste is rich and big, with dark coffee bitterness, some tartness and pleasant alcohol warmth. Excellent beer.
Sample from bottle @sbwf13. Dark brown with brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt and caramel. Taste is similar, well balanced and pleasant. Long roasty finish with chocolate notes. Solid.

Gull flavored with chocolate a great Porter.

Bottle, pours an opaque dark brown body with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, cocoa, coffee, and a hint of tobacco. Taste is similar, although the roasted malts are a bit stronger. Smooth mouthfeel, almost creamy. Nice bitter finish.

Bottle from BeerRitz, Leeds. Close to black with a thin tan head. Mild sweet coffee aroma. Very pleasant flavours of coffee and a little chocolate. Some burnt toast on the finish. Very drinkable. Flavours not as strong as expected given the ratings on here. Really nice but not spectacular.
Molasses nose from 12oz bottle, one finger of caramel foam. Molasses dissipates to a bready aroma. A proper Porter with a slightly bitter finish.

Dark and rich and really good! Not bitter like some porters but this is an enjoyable beer that is going to well with dinner.

Extremely dark brown, fluffy tan head, unctuous, thick bodied, dark malt, rich, hidden abv, chocolate, smooth. Dry finish
Black with a nice lasting beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate and dark roasted coffee. Taste baking cocoa, bitter black coffee, with a dark roast finish and aftertaste. Medium slightly slick body.

Lively nose of dark chocolate, smoke, fresh coffee beans and roasted nuts. Palate is malty, rich and full of coffee, warming alcohol, bitterness and a touch of citrus bitterness from the hops. Well made and very drinkable. Surprised that a beer that has travelled across the world can taste so good.

This one pours jet black with a 1/2" head that dissipates in about 5 minutes. Some say it doesnt linger on the tongue, but with 45 IBUs the bitterness hangs in there for a long time. Dark chocolateley coffee overtones rule the taste of this one and it mushrooms the nose with a nice smell. Though hardly an IPA, this "sweet" beer might meet their needs as the venture out for maltier beers. This one reminds me of their Dirty Bastard scotch ale just a bit. Well done Founders. Well done.

Smells like a fireplace with dark wood burning.
Drank from the bottle.
Tastes of malty sweetness, rich and heavy.
Stayed on the tongue but no lingering bitterness.
Best porter (not one of my favorite styles historically) that I have had. A must try, so balanced its good!

Great local porter for the Grand Rapids crowd. Even better if you are joining us from elsewhere.
Pores a very dark brown with a strong dark porter head. Hints of chocolate and smokiness surround the malt and hop build in this drink.

Pours almost black with a tan head that laces well. Nose is a mild roast coupled with chocolate, no hop presence. Light / medium mouthfeel with a light creamy texture. The taste is exceptional and well balanced. The roast is forward, but counter balanced with chocolate and malt. Slight hop presence as it warms. Clean finish of roast with a touch of chocolate and malt sweetness. A slight hop bitterness lingers against the dominate roast. I prefer stouts, but this is outstanding.
Smooth and chocolaty. Awesome year round brew! Pretty easy go to, especially if you want a porter

Appearance: Dark brown with tan finger thick head.
Aroma: Toast, roast/slightly smoky malts, note of chocolate and grassy.
Taste: Low sweetness, medium bitterness and low/medium sourness.
Palate: Thick rough texture, light/medium body, low carbonation, astringent, with a lingering bitter/sour roasty malt finish.
Comments: Tasty and slight lace.

Beautiful beer with a rich black appearance and a taste to match. The mouthfeel was as full as I would expect, with a strong heat which surprises me for a relatively low alcohol beer. I usually do not like this level of bitterness in a porter, but the hop selection is great, and it does not overpower the beer.
12 oz bottle. Pours black with light tan head. Aromas of coffee and dark fruit. Dry flavours of dark roasted barley/malts, black coffee, ash and bitter chocolate. Excellent.

Bottled. Black beer, thin beige head. Sourish dryfruity (plums, raisins) aroma, tar, charred barley, milk chocolate, vanilla, roastedness, lots of juicy hops. Dry heavily roasted malts, dark chocolate. Rather heavy, sour roasted maltiness. Medium malty, rich in fermented/sour fruits, burnt barley, old coffee..., Truly a robust and complex beer. Medium body, light carbonation. Lots of stuff, but maybe not in a perfect harmony. Palate fits well in this.
Dring this Black Velvet and dream of the Goddess Athena....Just Awesome! End of Story, just bought this today in Athens, Greece for 3.6 euros (including 23% VAT)
Dark rich looking pour with a crema like head. Aromas of fresh roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Medium body with a dry finish. Timeless beer style and a beer brewed so well to style. Bottle pour.

Poured from bottle. Pours a rich dark brown with tan head, but it dissipates quickly. Chocolate, fairly strong coffee notes, but smooth and a very pleasant finish. This is good, but just not quite as good as Fullers London Porter.

Aroma: malte torrado e algo de chocolate. Aparência: Preta, linda, com uma espuma densa. Sabor: amarga, com toques de malte torrado e chocolate. Bem balanceada. Paladar: leve retrogosto amargo, muito café. Geral: bela aparência, corpo. Boa bebilidade. Sabor agradável. Excelente stout.

355ml bottle. Pours an opaque black, with a smallish tan head, which lasts well and leaves reasonable lacing. Bitter espresso and cocoa notes and dark, roasty malt make up the aroma. Very mild herbal hops up front lead into strong espresso and bittersweet cocoa in the mid-palate. Espresso and nutty, roasty malt notes come through in the finish. This is a strong, satisfying porter. Very nice.

Coffee and roasty chocolate aromas permeate upon pour. Slight lacing. Very thin head. Smooth, silky chocolate hops and a hint of carbonation. If you want to get into porters, this is a good starting point.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2014 Pours pitch black with little to no head at all. Roasty aroma with some chocolate notes. Flavor of roasty coffee with a subtle chocolate. Very little bitterness, mostly maltiness. Medium body. The best part about this beer isnt as youre drinking it; it comes AFTER you drink it. Its a great beer to drink, dont get me wrong. But after youre done with this beer the wonderful coffee/chocolate flavor lingers on and on and on and on coating and tingling your palate for hours. I would like to thank this beer for introducing me to the wonderful world of porters.

Opaque black beer with a blink-and-its-gone brown head. Smells roasty but with citrus hops evident in the background. Chocolate flavors with some interesting citrus hop. Also get roast coffee notes as well. Charred aftertaste along with still more hops. Perfect palate, good thick mouthfeel with some fizz to keep things interesting. Excellent porter.
Pours black with yellowish head. Coffee chocolate nose. Creamy texture, a bit of fizz. Sweet 50% cocoa chocolate. Not too dark. Rounded with crisp bitterness. Medium bodied but quite slick. Nice.

Black pour with a dissipating beige head. Chocolate, vanilla, biscuit, roasted malt, coffee, peat, very slightly fruity. Rich and full bodied. This Porter is bursting with flavours and aromas and one of the best Ive ever had.

Tremendous.
Deep roasty aroma and pitch black appearance. First sip I get chocolate, ripe fruits and maybe a little alcohol. Overall really nice.
Pitch black with khaki head. Aroma of chocolate, bit of smokiness, dark malts. Full, smooth mouthfeel with a nice balanced finish. Not overly bitter, nor dry.

12 oz bottle.
Outstanding as all the others say, but with an asterick.
This should be in the "Cholate Porter" category since it so tastes of chocolate. A handome beer, rich, thick and creamy. Well done !!!

Rated on 10-02-2013 (Bottled on 03/03/2012) This beer pours a medium sized tan head that mostly diminished, dark brown opaque body, spotty amounts of lacing, and fast rising carbonation. The Aroma is malty, chocolate, coffee, roasty, and hint of spice. The Taste is bitter, malty, coffee, chocolate, roasty/burnt. The Palate is smooth and this beer is light-medium bodied. In conclusion, this beer is very quaffable, worth trying and I am surprised that I have not already rated this until now. It is a very roasty beer all the way around and I recommend this beer if one likes Porter styled beers.

A doozy. Caramel head sits atop uber-dark brown pour. Bitter chocolate nose. Chocolate on the tongue with moch-java-vanilla town zinger. Velvet mouth. Thin to medium. Baby bitter linger. Fantastic porter.

Bravo! This Porter captures everything. Wonderful aroma of coffee and chocolate, followed by a taste that doesnt disappoint! Great pour for a thicker porter. Full bodied beer with a perfect balance of carbonation. Youll be left begging for more!
Bottle 33 cl at Rotary pub. Black with a tan head. Milk chocolate, coffee, mash, savory. Full/medium body, medium carbonation, slightly bitter finish. Nice!

Preta com espuma café-com-leite. Espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma de café, passas ao fundo. Sabor de café, chocolate amargo e um amargor herbal no final. Pouco dulçor e bom amargor que persiste na boca depois do gole. Bom corpo. Interessante. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rich and delightful porter with bitter chocolate and sweet malt profile that is a treat for the palate. Strong flavors and higher ABV more like an imperial porter.

Bottle black body with tan head wonderful balanced Aroma with roasted malts and some malts taste is oily malts with a slight bitterness perfect balanced aftertaste is roasted malts and some bitterness great beer
Bottle at THT tasting. Pours Almost Black. Aroma is coffee and chocolate. Taste is medium bitter, a bit smoky and light sweet. Medium body with soft carbonation.
Poured very dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate and roast malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, vanilla smooth.

Bottled at SBWF.  Very dark brown, small head. Earthy roasty aromas. Dry with soft mouthfeel and medium body. Deep earthy malt with notes of licorice and coffee. Mid bitter finish. Really harmonious. Quality all the way.
12 oz bottle pours a dark black color with a nice tan head. Aromas of chocolate, dark roasted malt, coffee. Full bodied, smooth and silky, a great beer

Pours black with a quickly dissipating thin khaki head with minimal lacing. Aromas of chocolate, toffee, coffee beans. Smooth, velvety mouthfeel, bittersweet chocolate, toffee, vanilla bean tastes appearant with a slight lingering bitterness. Nicely balanced, no one flavor over powers the others. Nicely done.

12oz bottle black with a 1 finger creamy tan head into tulip. Nose is vanilla, coffee, cream, campfire notes, raisin. Mouthfeel is light, milky, with a bit of creaminess on the tail. Taste is cream, milk, bitter dark chocolate, raisinets, rich. Finish is dark chocolate, french roast coffee, hershey, mocha, lingering bitter with some occasional sweet notes. Excellent.

Aroma: Smooth Aroma very subdued. I smell toffee, caramel and roasted and chocolate aromas. roasty, toast, nuts, caramel, 

Appearance: Dark and liquid, not thick. Some light does shine through but it is very dark. Head was about a fingers length but did not last long. No lacing here.

Taste: Very sweet and smooth, slight bitterness on the back end. Not much carbonation to speak of. I taste caramel and toffee notes. Aftertaste is lasting and makes you want another sip right away. 
Palate: Creamy and flat. Medium body.

12 oz bottle into tulip

Lille, France

Appearance: Pitch black with small tan head

Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, burnt oak. 

Taste:Dry and then a bitter finish. 

Palate: Medium body, silky/velvety texture, slightly bitter finish, soft carbonation. This is one of my favourite attributes of this beer. 

Overall: This has always been my favourite porter. It drinks a lot more like a stout, and frankly has better palate than most stouts out there. Its always been overshadowed by the breakfast stout, but I think this is a seriously good beer. The flavor is good, but my favorite thing is always the texture. I cant imagine anything better for a porter. Im always very happy to have a 6pk at home. This is a rare treat in France.
Aroma is malts chocolate roast, appearance is black with khaki head, taste is a balance porter little buy of everything you expect. Love this beer and for the price I will be drinking this often
Bottle. Jet black with a minimal tan head. Aroma is cocoa and milk. Flavour is deep creamy chocolate, velvety, fruity roast on a lingering dry fruit finish.

Pours black with a nice thick 'n rich tan head that gradually fades to a ring and coating. Good lacing. Aroma is mild after settling with some chocolate, raisin and roast coffee - and a touch of booze. Taste is quite rich and malty with some baker's chocolate on the front and coffee grounds towards the back. Bitter finish with notes of grapefruit. Just a touch watery. A distinctive porter, and one with craft and depth. I prefer Fuller's, but this is a class act. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Smelling of grain, dates, chocolate and figs.Appearance: A dark black colored beer. A off-white head with some lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting bread, dark fruits, coffee and peel.Palate: Medium low carbonation, a soft and oily texture. A good body with a slightly dry finish.Overall: Fruity, coffyish, balancedNote: Bottle 355 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2013-10-05.

Tap...pours dark...looks black in the dark corner of the bar....dark brown sugar colored head...moleasses and guinness esque aroma and flavor....creamy smooth palate...sweet lactose finish yum...lacing delicate but clinging to the glass for dear life

Pours black with thin, cappuccino head. Aroma is sweet cream chocolate with coffee notes and some caramel. Medium body. Similar flavor. Chocolate, coffee and caramel. Nice nutty Munich malt grains. Restrained hoppiness lending a dry but round finish. Nugget, cascade, Willamette, fuggle. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Glug, Grainger Market, Newcastle. This dark brown-black beer pours with a very thin brown head. It has sweet chocolate and slight red fruity flavours, more milk and dark chocolate on the body and a creamy sweet and slight roasted finish.
Mmmm. Pours from a bottle with minimal head. Smells like roast coffee, chocolate, and toffee. Great, chocolate, vanilla, roast taste. This is really good.
Poured from a cold bottle. Dark brown color, no head. Roasted malt smell. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate delicious.
Oil black. Moderate tan head. Chocolate, charcoal, vanilla nose. Rich toffee, chocolate, with mildly bitter burnt finish. Thick, full body.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a medium sized head of fine to large sized light brown colored bubbles that were very long lasting and left behind a no visible carbonation opaque dark black brown colored body and an excellent lacing. The nice aroma was brown malt mild chocolate and dark malt. The off-tasting mouth feel was smooth at the start and mediumly tingly at the finish with a mild coffee aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of roasted malt chocolate brown malt and dark malt. A decent one that I would consider buying again.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2013 One of my favorite porters with its thick creamy texture. And probably one of my favorites by Founders. An early on favorite for me and my good beer experience.
Smooth, dark, creamy, full bodied. What a Porter! Heavy aromas of coffee, with dark maltys flavours, could sip away all night at this one :D

12oz bottle. Dark brown pour, decent tan head. Plenty of deep chocolate, caramel, dark fruit and coffee in the aroma. Huge chocolate and dark fruits in the taste, big roasted malt, nice cocoa notes, some dark roast coffee, bit of lightly bitter piney hop. Lingering coffee and chocolate. Full and silky mouthfeel. This is some good stuff.
Rich dark malts on the nose. Full body and creamy chocolate raisin flavors. Good muted coffee finish.

Enjoyed on tap at Blues BBQ. Served in a shaker pint.

A: Pours a dark brownish black color with a light khaki head forming on the pour. It recedes to a thin film that leaves sticky sheets of lace down the glass.

S: Super roasty on the nose with a nice dried malt profile. Light unsweetened chocolate with a light coffee bean note.

T: Lots of great dry coffee bean notes. Roasted malts with a creamy chocolate note. Dry espresso finish.

M: Creamy and medium bodied with a dry, roasty finish. Medium carbonation level with a touch of sweetness as well.

O: World class porter. Great balance of sweet and roasty with a spot on mouthfeel.

Serving type: bottle

07-04-2013

Not too strong of an aroma, but burnt malt and a heavy bitterness come through. Completely black body with creamy redish head. High bitterness, heavy smoked flavour, dark chocolate. Very smooth, great porter.

Pours black like a good porter. Aroma is strong bitter coffee and chocolate. Flavour is slightly smoother than the aroma. Maybe it's just me but I prefer the smooth rich toffee porters to the harsh bitter chocolate porters. Still extremely enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very dark beer with a note of coffee and cherry. Not so fizzy. A strong roasted and herb flavour in the aftertaste.

This lovely, ebony lady slips seductively into my curvaceous snifter giving generous, pillowy, cappuccino-colored head and an eruption of sinful, aromatic pleasure: notes of dark chocolate, dark-roasted coffee, roasted grains and nuts; maybe a hint of brandy on her lips. Copious lacing forms like sexy lingerie in a playful tease before she welcomes you into her voluptuous bounty. Playful hoppy notes tantalize the palate and her sassy, yet sweet disposition delights to the last drop. This is a guilty pleasure I shall hope to repeat often. Im pretty sure the girl on the bottle just winked at me. Among the best!

12 Oz bottle from Redmonds. Dark brown, almost black, mocha coloured head, short lasting. Nice nose, roasted malt, milk chocolate notes, oats, light coffee in the aroma. Flavour is lush coffee and chocolate, offset by bitter notes. Big robust body, thick, slick mouthfeel, medium soft carbonation. Finish is perfectly balanced. Tiniest hint of alcohol warming. Close to perfect this.

Pours black with a two finger, light tan colored creamy head. Aroma is chocolate first for me, then coffee. Taste follows the aroma. mouthfeel is a little bit thinner than I would like it to be. Overall this is an amazing porter.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2013 12 oz bottle. Pours a beautiful black with a thin-ish mocha colored head. The aroma is coffee heavy. Its got a gorgeous chocolatey bit and some roast to come with the light hoppiness on the finish. The taste is incredible. Its got a beautiful coffee and chocolate flavor with a little bitterness on the finish. It coats the mouth in perfect fashion and lingers just long enough to make me want to take another drink ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours deep black with dark brown head. The nose is rich roasted malt, bitter chocolate and slightly smokey. Taste is roasted coffee, malts , chocolate and a hint of vanilla. Very smooth and easy to drink.
Awesome beer, great taste, great aroma, especial color, great head... One of the bests Porter a every had... It´s a special beer for sure.

Bottle. Pours deep black with tin mocha head. Aroma is coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted malts, pecan pie and faint hops. Taste is roasted coffee, malts and chocolate covered nuts. Simple beer that has medium to full body with light carbonation. Nice tasting porter.

Bottle at parents place in NYC. Pours pure black with little to no head. Aroma is tasty malt, delicious. Taste is not necessarily smooth, but very pleasant malt notes. It's pure malt goodness. Roast, nuts, pecan. Finish is medium long, meaty, full delicious, like a piece if cake, awesome! Mouthfeel is full bodied and nice. Great beer.

Think I got a bad bottle flavor seemed off and I was left with a very dull after taste.  There were some hints of coffee and dark chocolate but not what I have had in the past.  Will give this another go later this week since Founders has treated me well in the past.

Pours a dark black with some tan head from a bottle. Strong aroma of coffee and chocolate. Creamy in texture. Variety of tastes dominated by chocolate and coffee with some bitterness from the hops. One of the best aftertastes out there.
Bottle from BlackHearts and Sparrows. Like an imperial stout. Aromas of milk chocolate and vanilla, hint of liquorice. Taste is sweet and bitter, with long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied.

Not a bad beer. Smells like chocolate. Appearance is a dark black with little to no head. Granted my bottle was a little old. Taste is pretty basic and straightforward. Almost all chocolate with a little coffee. Beer is a little thin but not too thin. Overall this beer is pretty good.
355ml bottle form Appellation Wines. Pours black with a good tan head. Big aromas of chocolate and roasted coffee. Some dark fruit and nuts coming through on the taste. Finish surprisingly dry. Good.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2013 From 12oz bottle. 

Pours very dark with creamy head. Nice coffee aroma. Nice basic porter taste.  A good everyday beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
