Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours black with a short khaki head. Sweet chocolate roast nose, espresso and a touch of aniseed. Really creamy body and flavours - smooth dark malts produce lots of espresso and chocolate. Very rich beer with a nice bitterness. Great brew from Founders.
Rich and creamy porter, lots of roastiness but also lots of chocolate in the aroma and taste, very well balanced and rich without Delivering a big thrill it is still very impressing.

This must be what God drinks. Such a thick and creamy porter. A spectacular head thats creamy and foamy. Its like liquid chocolate coming out of the bottle and is surprisingly coming going down. Holy balls its a good beer.

Pours black with chocolate mocha head. All roast and coffee. Mildly astringent with some hop bitterness. Thick mouth feel, creamy and clinging. After of fresh coffee and chocolate. Friggin tasty porter.

Muito boa, aroma e sabor sensacional, forte de sabor mas sem sentir o sabor e aroma do álcool 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a very nice porter. It pours black with a medium brown head. It has a full roasty, chocolate, coffee flavor with a pleasant lasting hop finish.

Pours dark with brown frothy head reducing to a little lacing. Sweet chocolate and coffee malts on the nose with a little smokiness. Flavour is espresso, chocolate and a little roasted malt with some alcohol later. The slight sweetness is vanilla but this is a classic porter with those malts dominating. Its creamy and very, very smooth. A beautiful soft finish, medium-heavy body, medium finish, very little carbonation.
I really like this beer. The roasted grains really come though on this Porter and the slight bitterness leaves you wanting more.

Nose: Coffee bean, chocolate and smoke a little disappointing as it lack punch and faded quickly. Taste is rich drinking chocolate leading, to a vanilla, dark chocolate and coffee bean finish. As the beer warms the coffee tones develop leading to a more mocha experience. Mouthfeel is perfectly matched to the taste, creamy and full. 

An excellent porter with a disappointing nose.
Very little head which is a off white color. Sweet smell of chocolate on the nose. Taste is somewhat complex with nice balance of chocolate and some hop presence.

Really nice full but not overwhelming porter. Tastes like it borders being an imperial stout. This is well balanced and very smooth to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2016 (bottled) A pretty world class Porter , best American non Imperial porter ive drank !Its got the chocolate malt used with skill and the hop bitterness not too floral ..great unity of flavours . A really smooth POrter ,  slick stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 Pours pitch black with a dark tan head. Rich, smoky, with hints chocolate and coffee. Thicker and better mouth feel than most porters, but packs a bigger smoke and hop punch than most stouts. Overall this is a good as porters get. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Coffee aroma with an espresso taste. Rich dark color chocolate on the palate.
Poured from a cold bottle. Dark brown color, no head. Roasted malt smell. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate delicious.

Pours dark brown black with a frothy chocolate brown head. Aromas of smoky balsam wood, dark fruit, & currant are followed by flavours of bitter chocolate, coffee grounds, & dry grassiness on the finish. The mouthfeel is smooth and medium bodied. From the tap at beverage world, this is a good quality porter.

12oz bottle. It pours opaque black with a lovely big crema head. The nose has dark and milk chocolate with dominant yeasty/cream note. The taste has delicious dark chocolate with hazelnut and cream - lovely.The palate is medium to full bodied with a creamy texture and a dry fairly clean finish - possibly too drying and not creamy enough if Im being picky. Overall, a lovely porter

Pours near-black with a luscious tan head that doesnt stick around as long as Id like. Strong roasted coffee aroma with chocolate notes and just a hint of smoke. Flavor is similar with some dry bitterness in the finish. Luscious mouthfeel with a tiny bit of fizziness on the tongue.

Draft at the Brass Tap. Dark brown pour with a mocha head. Rich roasted malt aromas. Robust with dark roasted malts running the show. Vanilla and caramel undercurrents with tingly bitter finish courtesy of the hops. Above average mouthfeel and body. A damn fine porter.

355ml bottle.
Pours a dark brown, verging on black, with a creamy brown head.
Rich, roasted aroma, loads of chocolate and licorice, coffee, caramel, tar, faint smoke.
Off-dry, full bodied, mid bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich, velvety taste, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee beans, licorice, tar, iodine, hints of smoke, caramel.
Long, balanced, dry finish. Very good indeed. (2013-08-27)
Bottle at the Sheffield Tap. Black with hardly any head. Lovely light chocolate malt aroma. Light chocolate, light roast, and and a touch smoky. Smooth and tasty.

Pours an opaque, very dark brown with an even, smooth, mocha colored head. Cola and roasted malt nose. Nearly viscous mouthfeel with smooth creaminess. Faint figgy cherry flavors with a faint plastic note. Very light smokiness.

Bottle from Trafalgar Wines, Brighton. It pours jet black with a small tan head. The nose is rich roasted malt, coffee grinds, dark chocolate and burnt toffee. The taste is roasty, earth, coffee, chocolate, ash, dark fruit, touch of berry, salted caramel and light liquorice with a dry, roasty finish. Medium+ body and average carbonation. Flavoursome, smooth and well-balanced. Highly drinkable. A great porter.

Well well well. I FINALLY got to try this long heard about Porter. (They just arrived in South Florida.) Picked up a sixer at Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. Pours a nice black, not too thick or oily, with great thick tan colored head. Used my Stout glasses. Aroma is rich with chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and bread. The taste was very good with cocoa, dark chocolate, heavy coffee (expresso??), rich roasted malts, slight toffee and lactose. However, it wasnt too thick or oily. It had a medium mouthfeel with a dry, roasted finish and the coffee bitterness lingered. Slight sweetness on the finish also. For an "off-the-shelf" beer it is very very good. I will be picking up another sixer today.

Black beer with a nice toffee head. Aroma of chocolate, expreso, olives and balsamic vinegar. The flavour is a lot more concentrated on coffee, more than I usually would like in my beer. High on the bourbon touch, it is woody, bittersweet, with plenty of fresh hops, but not too insulting for a porter. It is not as thick as it smells. Medium bodied, chalky and with some questionably high carbonation for such a hyped beer. Still, it is a beauty.
Bottle. Very dark. Hints of chocolate and coffee. Smooth chocolate and malty aftertaste
12 oz bottle pours midnight black with a small milk chocolate colored head. The aroma is roasted malt and biscuits. The taste is smooth roasty toasty malt with the finish that lingers

An excellent full bodied dark ale. One of my favorites. Very smooth taste with a hint of chocolate. Made with 4 varieties of hops.. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone I just had a couple of pints of Guinness-excellent

Rich strong burnt aroma with caramel and bread. Black color tan head with moderate retention. Burnt malt flavor with hints of smoke and toasted bread. Dark chocolate and crisp medium bitterness in the aftertaste. Low hop flavor. Medium full body and moderately low carbonation. Its been a while since I had such a great porter. Make you wanna have more.

Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma is creamy coffee and light molasses. Taste is really really smooth creamy coffee with, again, light molasses for the mid palate. The finish is a perfect blend of mellow roasted malts and easy bitterness. Beautiful!
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2014 Drank from a bottle, aroma is roasted coffee, taste is very bold, rich, and sexy, love it

Bottle from Bierkompass!

Pours deep black with frothy brown head. Smell has lots of dark roasted malts, its slight vinous with some dark dried fruits. Starts very smokey, with roasted malts, lots of coffee and some chocolate. Middle part is rosty-malty with lots of coffee and chocolate. Goes into a strong coffeeish finish with some bitter roasted malts and chocolate notes!

Bottle at Tilleys, Newcastle on 27 July 2013.
Poured a deep, dark amber with a thick tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate and coffee. Flavours of grain, dates and lashings of cocoa. Lasting bitter burnt malt and espresso palate.
September 2010 from bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Caramel, chocolate, coffee and dark roasted malts. Rich, robust and near perfect. Nice dry, hoppy finish. Awesome porter.

Black as midnight and opaque with minute and intermittent carbonation. Sticky web of suds atop messes up the glass well. Initial metallic burst gives way to a rich, complex chocolate malt nose with hints of roasted coffee and cacao beans, dark ganache, a lot of burnt sugar and molasses, and fresh liquorice root. Oh wow, where has this bad-boy been hiding all these years. Big, voluptuous and juicy body; malty thick with pronounced hopping guiding this elixir passed the tonsils. Very spicy, herbal in back with a twiggy bark and ashen aftertaste. Lots of grainy, mudcake-like chocolate on the mid-palate. A hint of brandy melds in with notes of charred plums, liquorice root and bitter coffee to give it plenty of complexity. Very long, oily and viscous. Punches above its weight. A lovely Winter warmer!! (12fl.Oz, BB 03/02/14, The Freo Doctor Liquor Store, Fremantle)

(Bottle): Pours almost completely black, small tan head. Aroma of heavily roasted malt, smokiness, very dark chocolate, earthy notes. Coffee flavour with bursts of dark chocolate and a sweet/smokey balance that is just beautiful. Ends with a touch of hops and a mild bitterness that perks things up. Sublime.
Black pour. Big tan head. Plenty of lacing. Roasty aroma. Creamy roasty taste of malt. Some notes of coffee and chocolate. Pretty good.

Pours very dark brown, almost black, slight khaki head thin lacing. Aroma big roast, chocolate malt, bit of caramel sweetness and earthy hops. Taste roast malt, sweet chocolate, slight bitter earthy hops, coffee grounds, no alcohol presence. Mouth feel is medium full, medium carbonation, balanced finish. Overall outstanding, one of the best beers, certainly porters out there.

Poured from 355mL bottle. Black with dissipating beige head. Aroma predominantly coffee and roasted malt with hints of chocolate and soy sauce. Taste quite the same, but also with a medium hoppy kick at the end. Fairly light creamy body.

Draft at the brewery in Grand Rapids. Pretty classic porter all the way around with a little American flair as the hops poke through. Nice notes of bitter baking chocolate and coffee. Im sure this is copied ad nauseum across the U.S.

Im simply not a huge fan of the hoppy bite that comes as soon as you swallow some of this beer. The deep. roasty flavors with more coffee than chocolate notes are taken back by that hop/bitter punch at the end. This ruins the smoothness for me....but if youre into that, this is still a nice, smooth drink.
Pours totally black with a brown head. Aroma is malt, chocolate, roasty, caramel and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet leading to a roasty and moderate bitter finish. Great stuff!

Bottle... Nice pour, creamy head. Nice smokey chocolate flavor. Full mouth. Awesome porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a pint glass. 1/2 an inch of Dark tan head that dissappated quickly. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Taste is more of the same. More bitter than Great Lakes Edmund Fitzgerald. Smooth mouthfeel with fine carbonation. Dry, bitter finish. A very nice porter.

Malty chocolatey aroma. A little too bitey for my liking and too astringent on the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bam! This was great, lovely roast balanced against the remainder of the beer. Nice and dark - just a lovely drop.

I'd loved the breakfast stout, but my colleagues told me this was even better. 

Pours a huge tan head, thick, oily beer with lovely lacing. 

Smells of chocolate, mostly. Some sweet vanilla and a touch of malt too. 

Very smooth taste, with clean and balanced malts and chocolate. 

Creamy mouthfeel and not overt carbonated. 

Pretty much your perfect porter - like grandad used to drink. Still reckon the breakfast stout is my thing - it's like licking the bottom of a coffee pot!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The aroma is chocolate with other Malts present. It is black with no light coming through and a dark brown head. It has a very rich taste with chocolate and malts a slight bitterness.

355mL bottle. Pours black with a mocha head and a dark chocolate/coffee like aroma. Creamy mouth feel with espresso coffee flavour at the forefront and a sweet molasses/slight choc joing the fray. Not bad at all for a porter.

355 ML bottle

Pretty much black pour. Dark tan head that falls to a collar and film. Spotty lacing on the sides of the glass. 
Nose is of earth, coffee, licorice, vanilla and oak. Yeah not oaked but has the nose of it. Just a wonderful nose. 
Lots of vanilla in the taste, earthy coffee, licorice and chocolate. Just a complex beer that is very well balanced. 
Smooth, rich, and sexy beer. Quite elegant and enough carbonation to carry this. 
Sensational beer
Jet black color with a reddish-brown head. Has a rich, creamy vanilla taste that goes down smooth. Full of flavor.
Really nice. Rated this with another app and BeerBuddy unfortunately won't let me import comments.

12 oz bottle for 2 bucks. Pours black with a light brown head. One of the best-looking porters I have seen. Malts and chocolate are present in the aroma. Slightly smokey as well. Taste is similar but sweet with a smokey aftertaste. Malts and bitterness linger a bit as well. Very smooth and a pleasure to drink. Simply amazing. Only the Duck-Rabbit and Thirsty Dog porters can come close to this one.
Bottle from kris wines, london. Black color, brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, licorice, coffee. Balanced taste, medium body, roasty, coffee, some hops.
Bottle at BrewDog Bristol. Pours with a black body with a large light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and vanilla. Smooth silky chocolate texture. Minimal carbonation. Rich. Good beer.

Bottle @ home, 27 / 7 2013. Dark brown almost pitch black, very small tan head, okay lacing that doesnt last long. Aroma, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, . Taste, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, licorice, vanilla. Dry roasted aftertaste. Great porter.
wow that is tasty. very very drinkable.. for me the nose is a little one-dimensional. pour is dark, taste is layered malts with addictive bitterness. long palate. YUM

Pours a deep rich brown with a slight tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, sweet malt. Taste is an array of flavors none of which overwhelm.....chocolate, coffee, vanilla, a touch of smokiness, subtle bitterness......well put together, not too much of anything but a lot of flavors to pull out.

Pours black with creamy beige head. Aroma is chocolate, espresso, and burnt toast. Taste is smooth, mouthfeel is silky, dark chocolate, oak barrel, brownies. Sweet bitterness lingers on the palate, slightly dry finish. This a
real nice dessert beer.
Bottle at Svinet, Stockholm. Black colour with a brown head. Aroma of coffee, liquorice, some roasted malt. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Rather bitter finish.

Bottle, 12C. Pretty much black with a modest tan head that never quite disappears. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, hazelnuts. Velvety texture. Sweetish chocolate, mild roasted and slightly smokey notes, unobtrusive bitterness as it dries out a little towards the end. A bit of pepper there too as well as a little astringency. Solid drop.

12 oz. bottle. I can;t believe I havent rated this yet. Pours dark brown in color with a medium sized khaki head. The aroma and flavor are chocolate, more milk than dark, some roast, earthy and a touch resiny hop character. Flavor is presented with a silky smooth mouth feel and medium plus body. This is a solid porter that is readily available.

It doesnt get any better than this. What else can I say that hasnt already been said by others. An excellent offering by Founders. With a sweet, chocolate-caramel flavor, quite possibly the best porter anywhete.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2013 Black pour, tan head. Looks just like the label, dark, rick and sexy. Am array of toasted and roasted malts, nuts, dark chocolate, espresso. Taste is all there, everything you would imagine. Slight bitterness in the finish, but in a welcomed way. Probably the gold standard for an American porter for me, near perfect!

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a black with tan head that disappears quickly. Aromas of dark malts, espresso, vanilla and some burnt notes. Taste is powdered dark chocolate, some espresso and a dark malts that linger. Is actually really quite balanced! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2013 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours black with a dark, sticky tan head leaving great retention and sticky lacing. Very nice looking and smells divine. Definitely smokey but very balanced and not overpowering at all. There is a heap of espresso and a touch of vanilla in there with some powdery chocolate. Works very well. Sweet and meaty. Taste is all of this but toned down a little. A great aroma leads to a solid taste. Not outstanding to drink but very solid and superbly balanced. Good stuff

120z bottle from Good Spirits Co. Almost balck colour, decent beige head. Chocolate malt aroma. Toasted fruity malt flavor. Smooth with milky texture. Second tasting of this. Not as good as it was first time.

Amazing balanced flavor with great aroma. Nothing was overloaded but everything a porter should have was there. Head remained constant and lacing was solid. Per usual, another amazing beer from Founder's.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Looks great. dark dark brown. Creamy tan/coffee head.
A: A little acidic on the smell. Coffee... chocolate. Nice notes but a little light and wet.
T: Tastes amazing. Great coffee and chocolate notes. Not overpowering. Smooth on the finish. Perfect on the flavor, perfect on the bitter, perfect on the boozy tinge. 
P: Smooth smooth smooth. Great flavor development. Sits with a solid medium body. Carbonation is on the money.

Overall this is a near perfect beer. Everything about this screams that this is what a porter should be. Amazing flavor profile that doesnt have to be some imperial something thats 12%abv. Definitely one of the best beers you can get.

Bottle thanks to trade with Phatdog1! Pours an opaque brownish black with thin ring of tan brown head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of chocolate, soy and roasty wood. Taste is more of the same, nice balance, almost more like a stout. Solid.

The smell of roasted malts as soon as I poured the beer. A suttle smoked flavor with lingering hint of coffee. 45 IBU and coming in at almost a 40 for SRM. This beer lives up to its name as Dark,Rich,and Sexy!Cheers.
Poured from a bottle. Roasted malt aroma with a hint of coffee. Smooth, bitter finish. Excellent for the style. I wish this had bit more carbonation.
Jet black with very little head, smooth roasted malt, espresso, bitter chocolate. Really enjoyable beer.
Bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Smells of toasted malts, coffee, and chocolate... maybe raisins? Tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, and some tangy dark fruits.

Draft at Blind Tiger. Pours pitch black with a tight, medium-sized mocha-colored head. Aromas of light chocolate, espresso and roast. Taste is roasty with lots of dark chocolate and coffee. Lightly bitter in the forefront but overall very wonderfully smooth and balanced in the finish. Got better and better as I continued to drink this. Great porter.

Bottle, thnx to Stakem. Pours a cola brown, headless beer with low carbonization in the glass. Small amount of head settles directly. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, slight roast, yet very rich and full aroma. Flavour is sweet, with touches of dark chocolate, some coffee and a big caramel base. Wow.. incredibly well balanced and full bodied, for such low abv. Very impressive. Long, cloying aftertaste, very sweet... Awesome brew!

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2013 Pours a deep black with a thin but appropriate mocha head. Aroma is nice and classy, with coffee, chocolate and faint roasted grains. Taste is sweet but only so slightly, with roasted malt acidity and hops bitterness quickly counteracting it. Flavors are black chocolate and café au lait. Mouthfeel is nice and silky with carbonation actually a touch higher than expected though. Overall a really nice porter, one I can see myself coming back to over and over too.
Finally got around to rating this one. I had high expectations for Founders and they largely delivered
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2016 pours pitch black with a beige head. sweet taste of roast, chocolate and coffee. verry complex taste! for me this is one of the best porters!

Bottle from Good Spirits, Glasgow. Pours jet black, with lively carbonation and a tight, long-lasting tan head. Black coffee, charcoal and plain chocolate aroma, with a touch of grassy hop. Flavour was complex, with some sweet caramel, prune and blackberry fruits upfront, followed by more dark chocolate, roasted malts, and culminating in a rich, full finish, with the alcohol warmly evident. A great beer.
Big, black, and creamy. Thats how I like my beer. This was all of the above with some chocolate and coffee...

Excellent American Porter version. Smooth character like all English Victorian ladies, with an American attitude. Chocolate, coffee, malts, smooth to the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark black pour but with slight cola like transparency. Off white head. Chocolate, espresso, lead, oyster. Chewy tannin like bitterness. Lighter than expected initial feel with good carbonation. Easy to drink even during warmer months 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle. very dark brown/black, thin tan head. really nice aroma, quite subtle but its dark fruits, a funky veggie smell and a solid smoky meat thing. Foamy and a touch fizzy in the mouth. The smoked meat thing is there, as is roasty coffee, a touch pepto bismol, some choc and a good bitter finish. Good.
Very dark with a strong and ashy chocolate, malt and yeast aroma. Oily in the mouth. Sweet with a slightly bitter finish. A porter that wants to be a stout. Very good.

Bottle at home. Dark brown/black pour, thick creamy beige head. Soft raisin fruits, quite big roast, light cocoa, subtle vanilla, toasty notes on the nose. Soft sweet milk choc malty front, full-bodied, some vanilla and peppery spice coming through a big rich meaty roasty backbone. Nice, surprisingly crisp hoppiness on the finish. Nice full prickle of carbonation. Its pretty good, though probably not worth 100. Then again, since when did anyone trust Ratebeer?
12 oz bottle, pours black with a small head, coffee & chocolate aroma, pretty standard, nothing too out there. Great beer, well made and everything works well, but not enough to make it outstanding.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. This is an ok porter. thats it. all the characteristics are there. Dark, smokey. Malt does all the talking here, hops are way in the background. Roast coffee and hints of chocolate. There is really nothing special here and i have had may porters as good and a few much better. Not quite sure how it has scored so high on here.

Bottle from Beer Hive, Edinburgh [180613]
Black, big frothy tan head, some lacing
Aroma of roasted malts, slight burnt note, some dark chocolate
Taste of deep dark malts, creamy dark chocolate, soft roasted malts, rich dark malts, not that complex, decent flavours 
Palate - Medium carb and body, rich malt palate, smooth oily texture. Finish as main flavour, bit of a dry linger
Overall - Decent rich dark malty porter. Its rather good but no way a 100 RB beer

Slightly chilled bottle. Quite a thick pour, had to force a head and it didnt endure long. Smell is faint molasses. Taste is soft smoke with a touch of yeast. Not particularly complex or strong flavours, but its a nice porter.

On tap at Bridge Tap in STL. BY FAR, the best Porter I have ever had. Very smooth with notes of some coffee and chocolate. This porter was actually refreshing to drink! I would definitely order this again!
A staple porter for anyone who loves a dark beer with character. Smells of chocolate and deliciousness
Bottle. Hazy dark brown. Nice head. Dark chocolate aroma. Nice lacing. Deep chocolate taste.

Pours (near) black with a thin tan head. Aroma: plain chocolate, coffee grounds, roasted malts, caramel. Taste: dominant coffee notes, chocolate, dark fruits. Slight smokiness in the dry, bitter finish. Smooth & oily on the palate. Excellent porter - flavourful, robust, balanced.

Bottle. What surprised me most about this porter is the taste of hops that prevails over most typical porters, which can be too strong on the coffee flavor. There is a coffee smell, but it doesnt dominate the taste. I could pour this over ice cream and be just as happy.
Bottle.  This is a top notch porter at a great price.  I get it regularly.

12 ounce bottle into signature pint glass, bottled on 5/8/2013.  Pours pitch black color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass.  Aromas of milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, roasted malt, coffee, toast, floral, light pine, and roasted earthiness.  Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roasted malt notes with light hop presence; and good strength.  Taste of chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, toast, floral, light pine, and roasted earthiness.  Moderate coffee/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, toast, caramel, light pine, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic balance and complexity of roasted malt flavors with a light-moderate hop presence; with great robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a very creamy and lightly slick mouthfeel that is very nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a highly excellent porter!  Great balance and robustness of flavors; and very smooth to drink.  A highly enjoyable offering as expected.

5 oz. flight draft at Malted Barley in Westerly RI.  Sexy looking beer, jet black with a nice tan head, good lacing.  Smell is great.  Bakers chocolate, caramel, hops and coffee. Taste is just as good, chocolate and sweet caramel in the foreground and coffee in the background, plus a nice hop presence in the finish. Combination of sweetness and bitterness stays with you between sips.  Palate is pleasant, not overly thick, very drinkable.  Founders is fairly new to me and the more of their products I try the more respect I have for them.  Great beer, give it a whirl!

Black colour with a thin chocolatey beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, chocolate, coffee and roasted malt. Taste is lightly sweet, with a bit of a sour almost salty finish and light bitterness, Medium duration.. Medium-full body with a slick texture and light carbonation. Was hoping for a bit of a thicker texture and a bit more on the tongue and palate, but still a good beer.
Yeah yeah, very good. Well done Founders. 100 no. But ya, I cant grumble - accomplished and effective and interesting and opulent and umbrella.

12 oz bottle.  Pours very dark brown, almost black with a small, thin beige head.  Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee.  Creamy and rich with chocolate and coffee taste.  Very smooth and alcohol is well hidden.  This is very nice and an excellent Porter.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines;  dark brown with a tinge of red, medium tan head, creamy coffee aroma, delightful creamy coffee taste with a decent sweet edge, some dried fruits and plain chocolate. Slight bitter finish.
Great standard porter. Nice chocolate malt and well balanced hops. Nothing is wrong about this brew.

Pours a black dusky color with a beige head that laces well. Aroma of bitter chocolate, cocoa nibs, and toast. Taste is dark chocolate with a rich punch unlike any porter on the market. Simply the best.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Black coloured beer which generates a moderate amount of head. Lots of chocolate and licorice sweetness, some roastiness and breadiness. Quite heavy bitterness on the finish. Quite full palate. Enjoyable.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Black with a biege head. Aroma and flvour of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and smoke.

Bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Roasty aroma with coffee, chocolate, licorice and had a hint of smoke. Flavor was rich and smooth with black coffee, roasted malts, vanilla and had a roasty dry finish.  a smooth and easy drinkable porter.

And so to Fucked Up. Wow. Thomas, check out the bass player and then listen to the sound they make. The contrast in music and vocals was startling. Lots of cathartic exorcisms going on. He was in the crowd within 10 seconds of the first song. He brushed against me and he was very sweaty. Less than two hours later Im sat in my kitchen drinking this lovely number, ears ringing and excited about the noise we are going to make in a few hours time. 100 eh, we shall see...

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Sampled this directly after Vitesse Noir so was initially struck by a slightly underwhelming flavour......... silly old me, its entirely unfair to compare a 5%er to an 11%er. In reality this is excellent: super smooth, oiley mouthfeel, with perfect bite in the taste. The malts are blended perfectly (I believe) and the Porter aspect of this beer means it is very drinkable and erm palatable. This review has been sponsored by complete nonsense.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 355ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours opaque black with a lovely big crema head. The nose has dark and milk chocolate with dominant yeasty/cream note. The taste has delicious dark chocolate with hazelnut and cream - lovely.The palate is medium to full bodied with a creamy texture and a dry fairly clean finish - possibly too drying and not creamy enough if Im being picky. Overall, a lovely porter.

Tap in Butcher & The Boar, Minneapolis. Deep brown with a thick off white head. Very smooth drinking porter, roasty, dryish, some hints of cocoa and coffee, bitter finish. Hides booze level well. Nice.

Preta com espuma café-com-leite. Espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma de café, passas ao fundo. Sabor de café, chocolate amargo e um amargor herbal no final. Pouco dulçor e bom amargor que persiste na boca depois do gole. Bom corpo. Interessante. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chocolatey. Smooth. Rich. Everything you want in a good porter. Recommended highly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml Bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£2.60):
Light coffee with some roasted malts, hints of chocolate and a nice earthy aroma that is light but noticeable. The aroma is a rich some with some sweet caramel touches with some light bitterness.

Opaque mahogany colour, almost black. Has a thin, medium brown head with red tinges about 0.5cm tall and holds great with some lacing too.

Sweet malts with some roasted one on top and a good helping of chocolate. The beer is lighter than I was expecting and quite rich too with a tiny but of spice right at the end.

Medium, very smooth, some rich and sweet flavours. The balance of the beer is pretty much perfect and the beer is clean with a dry, sweet finish.

Brilliant beer that is not as dark or heavy as I was expecting but it managed to have a great balance between the sweet malts and the darker, roasted malts that follow. A very easy beer to drink and one that goes far too fast.
Beautifully dark with long lasting head (the way i like it) . Silky smooth mouthfeel a nice porter

This black nectar folds into the glass crowned by a light brown head. Nose is malt, molasses and caramel. Thick viscosity and very creamy on the palate. Flavor is bold with forward taste of dark roasted malts, coffee, molasses, and dark chocolate. Finish is well balanced with some dry hops evident. An excellent porter. Try it with brats off the grill.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 18.05.2013, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting cocoa colored head. Aroma is slightly rich, salty licorice, dark malts, coffee, chocolate, caramel, roasted grain, dark sugar. Taste is smooth and roasted, coffee, roasted grain, dark chocolate, burnt caramel, hay, some licorice and grass. Longlasting mild bitterness. Very nice stuff!
Bottle. Pours a dark brown-black with a thin brown head. Aroma is chocolate, malt, nuts, and some fruit. Taste is chocolate, nut and hops.  Bitter chocolate and coffee finish. A great porter.

The best widely available porter period.  Dosent seem special at first, but the flavor kicks in when goes down the throat.  Rich milk chocolate espresso, with a pleasant toffee nutmeg bite.  Wow, if you havent had it, go get some right now.  If you dont live in founders distribution area, consider moving...
One of the best examples of a porter that there is.  Nice and smokey with a creamy mouthfeel.  This is worth trying and isnt incredibly rare like a few of their other beers.
Finally I get to try this.  Dark, roasty, malty, chocolatey.  A delicious porter for sure.  Time to crack open the Breakfast Stout now =)
12 Oz bottle pitch black with beige head, chocolate, coffee, roasty, toast, nuts, smoke. Cream of the crop if you enjoy Porters
Porter noir. Arome de torréfication, de biscuit et de pain roti. Assez sucré et ronde en bouche. Bière très riche, près du stout.

35 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with some sediment and a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, liquorice, coffee, vanilla, and chocolate. Flavour is roasted malt, liquorice, and bitter coffee.
On tap at CBC. Black colour with beige lacing. Roasted and hoppy aroma. Same for taste, with some malts and sweetness.
Smells very roasty and malty, slight hop flavor.  Taste is very malty, sweetness is balanced out by the roasted malts though.  Kind of thin feeling, could maybe be a little thicker.

Standard porter by Founder's with all the requirements of a basic porter. Thin finish, good selection of malts, will satisfy the person looking for malts and not hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sampled @ CBC 2013. Opaque pitch black color, small beige head. Smell and taste malts, roasted malts, bread, lightly ashes. Medium body and carbonation. Nice porter.
bottle into glass,  pours pitch thick dark black,  with brown head,  taste is crazy good,  roasty, chocolate, coffee, nuts, very smooth,  LOVE IT
Sweet, malty chocolate taste. Tangy aftertaste bite that quickly goes away. Pours super dark with no head.

Dark, Rich, and Sexy. However, the girl on the bottle looks none of the above so it's got me pondering. Nice chocolate taste, solid beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark and thin. Very little head which quickly vanishes. Malty taste, thin, smooth mouthfeel. Above average

Drank in pint poured from 12 oz bottle. Aroma - roasted chocolate and coffee nots. Appearance - pours and looks like a stout with little froth. Taste - fantastic porter. Rich and roasted. Get the coffee bean flavor. Palate - a little more heat on the mouth feel but still fantastic. Overall best porter I have had. Very very good.
Bottle 0.355l at Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Bottled 071212. Colour is deep black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Soft, gentle and fabulous.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2014 Bottle poured into a pint glass. This looks basically black, though not quite the motor oil black of some stouts. There is a very thin brown head which dissipates quickly without any lacing. The aroma is a variety of chocolate, coffee, roasted grains, and cola. One of the most complex scents Ive experienced for a beer. The taste follows the nose. Light, slightly oily feel. Pretty good, though Im not a huge fan of the coffee character.

Pours a pitch black body with a medium brown, everlasting, creamy head that leaves lots of lacing on my glass. The aroma is very strong and unusually inviting. It might not be that exceptionally complex, its all chocolate, chocolate and chocolate, with some dark caramel and gently roasted notes, but its still absolutely delicious. Maybe its just very well balanced. The taste is moderate sweet and the finish is surprisingly bitter, and surprisingly lovely. The strong flavours follow the aroma, with a bit coffee added in the back. Excellent mouthfeel with a full body, a lovely oily texture (hardly dry at all) and soft carbonation. A masterpiece! 
[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 4 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2013 Bottle.  Dark black pour.  Strong coffee chocolate aroma.  Small brown head.  Chocolate and roasted coffee... surprisingly sweet with nice mouthfeel.  One of my favorite porters.

Bottle. Pours a dark translucent red, with a small creamy and reddish head. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel and toffee. Body is oily, with a soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with caramel and coffee, as well as nice notes of kandi and molasses giving a sweet and quite fruity finish.

12oz bottle. Pours a dark brown-black color with a thin mocha colored head. Aroma of coffee, cocoa, dark roasted malt, and some vanilla. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, with some hop bitterness.
12 ounce bottle.  Pours almost black with a small tan head.  Aroma of roast, chocolate, and caramel.  Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel, and mild coffee.  Could drink this everyday.

355ml bottle (Viisi Penna, Helsinki, Italian weeks 2013)
Rich roasty aroma, some cocoa cakiness, a bit mashy. Smooth palate, pleasant carbonation. Lovely roast, so mellow, but very tasty, smooth, rich, no astringency. This is why I love US porters. Bit of bacon in the finish. Very nice indeed. Porter = good.

Great smooth full body porter. Roasted malts with chocolate and coffee undertones. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of the best porters I have tasted! Taste and aroma of dark chocolate. Pretty tasty.
Not excessive odor. Occasionally with flavor. Not much taste, but perfectly okay to drink anyway.
Bottle at the Sheffield Tap. Very enjoyable. Quite a striking coffee aroma. Thick chocolaty taste, really loaded, quite a dry burnt crispy coffee finish.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Bottle at home. Pours black with brown head and heavy lacing. Aroma is chocolate and dark fruits. Taste is exemplary for this style; chocolate notes, sweet, slight hints of bitterness - really even. Finishes full and creamy with some tingle on the tongue. Blurs the line between porter and stout.

Pretty dark pour with little bit of khaki colored head. Smells of roasted coffee dominates, chocolate, cocoa. The coffee comes through a lot on the taste as well as some smoke and burn. Roastiness, little bit of sweet in the form of chocolate/cocoa. Some bitter on the tongue afterwards but not overly. Medium bodied, slick. Strong porter overall, need to try with a cigar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle, pours silky smooth, deep dark black, thick tan head. heavy chocolate aroma, cocoa. creamy mouth, heavy on the chocolate again, a nice dark chocolate linger in the finish. big tasting porter

[bottle]
Mocha and pumpernickel aroma with some popcorn and nondescript fruit. Oily black appearance with a tawny, beige cover. Smooth cereal grain flavour with licorice and mint chocolate chip ice cream, coffee, and other complexities. Full body, moderate carbonation, moderately bitter finish.
Chocolate, nuts, roast, and coffee in the aroma.  Flavor is bittersweet, with chocolate, raisin and nut.  A fair amount of bittering hops in the finish.  Really good.

Bottle, courtesy of my little brother.  Beautiful dark, nearly black pour. Half finger of brown/tan head that dissipates to ring, leaving irregular lacing.  Big roasty, chocolate nose.  Hint of licorice?  Medium body, moderate carb.  Slightly oily.  I peeked at other ratings and want to adopt "velvety" because its a hell of a fine word for this.  Smoky, roasty, chocolaty sweetness (moderate) but with nice bitter bite, lasting bitter finish (roasty, coffee-like bitterness more than "hoppy," but quite well balanced).  Wickedly tasty.
On tap at Taco Mac at Philips Arena. Pours a deep, rich chocolate brown with a mocha head. Aroma is chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is chocolate forward with some coffee. Very tasty porter.

Deep dark brown with medium brown head. Quite stable. Lacing.
Aroma.. roasted malts intense, but not too much. Decent hops, expressive chocolate, bit licorice.
Sweetish to bittersweet long finish.d
Very good and enjoyable.. bit lack to be excellent. Reminds me of milk stout. Til now best chocolate aroma from all that I have enjoyed.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass. 

Appearance: Black. Thats all there is. Mild carbonation, and no light gets through, theres no lacing, and theres also just a very small head that quickly dissipates. Of course, if you do an aggressive pour, youll get a really nice tan head. I recommend doing so.

Smell: Espresso. Roast. Maltiness. Mmm. Its rather light though.

Taste: It smells a bit better than it tastes... the initial taste is mostly just roastiness, but after it sits on your tongue for a bit, I get some dark coffee bitterness, with a hint of dark chocolate in there as well. Theres the warming of alcohol at the finish as well.

Mouthfeel: Its definitely rich, but not nearly as creamy as I was expecting it to be. Sort of surprising, but not a huge deal.

Overall, its an incredibly big, robust beer. The thing about it is, I feel sort of goofy drinking this in August. This to me screams winter, in front of a warm fire place, or maybe even as a substitute on a cool morning for warm coffee. This isnt my type of beer to casually drink -- I tend to prefer lighter beers for every day drinking -- but theres no denying its quality. It smells phenomenal, and its taste is one that I feel can surely grow on me as I get older. I dont feel its as fantastic as the rating suggests, but its undoubtedly a well made beer. Im very interested to see just how my taste buds change when I get another sixer in a couple years.

Pours a dark opaque brown with a fluffy mocha head. Aroma is nutty, bready, toasted malt, milk chocolate, toast and caramel. Taste is mostly chocolate and coffee, a good bit of toasted malt, biscuits, and toffee. Medium bodied and medium carbonation.  One of the most well balanced, delicious and complex porters Ive had.

Pours nearly opaque dark brown/black with a 1 finger brown head that doesnt stick around long. Aroma is surprisingly weak; some hops, burnt toast, and caramel. Taste is dark malts, some nice English-style hops, and toffee. Palate is thick and rich, but a little dull. Overall, this is an excellent porter, and could be a better stout than most stouts.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika.
Black color, good foam. 
Very good aroma intensity, roasted aromas , leather, licorice, malt and some dried fruits. Medium body & high complexity.æsolid bitterness, very well balanced. Very enjoyable

(35 cl bottle from Toft Vin; BBD Unknown) Pours black with quickly receding, tan head, some regeneration and nice lace. Aroma is roasted malt with notes of chocolate and chalk. Oily texture, soft carbonation, full body and a slightly bitter finish with accents of roasted malt. Taste is mildly sweet with a little bitterness in the end. Less exciting than what the good ratings led me to believe. Girlfriend says "Its nicely dark and complex."
Colour is as dark as my deepest darkest secret. Odour is of roasts and hops. Tastes of roasts, chocolate, coffee, and Odins chest hair with a nice hoppy finish. Definitely a sexy beer.

little brown head, quicqly dissapearing, pitch black. nose is chocko, fresh prune, raisins. medium body and some length, taste is chosko cooffee and a light sweetness. overall nice and very drinkable due to its lightness,
UPDATED: APR 2, 2013  A great Porter. Not as aggressive as Smuttys Robust but better than others Ive had. A very enjoyable beer.

355 ml. bottle. Black with a creamy, tan head. Roasted aroma with chocolate, coffee, faint licorice and caramel malts. Taste is light bitter. Impressive palate for a 6,5 % alc.: Medium to full body with a creamy texture, soft carbonation, excellent for a porter. Finishes long lasting bitter with hops, roasted malts and chocolate Excellent porter, well balanced and lots of flavour for a 6,5 % alc.

Pours Black-brown with a decent tan head. There is some lacing. Initially I smell caramel, roasted coffee, molasses, and malt. Its a very pleasant aroma that fades soon after the pour.  I taste roasted coffee, bitter chocolate, and a little smoke. This porter finshes nicely with grassy espresso hops and the faint memory of bakers cocoa (and maybe a little raisin?). I dont get the Brewers claim of a "silky" mouth feel. This beer is watery with moderate carbonation affecting the back of my tongue. This is a very nice porter  with very drinkable appeal.
Was a great beer. I like the darkness and the taste. My kind of porter. I will be drinking this again.
Bottle. Poured ultra dark. Rich roasty malt taste. Smells like choco milk. Semi harsh aftertaste. Good sippin.

Bottle at home. The colour is very deep dark brown and appears clear with a small light brown head. The aroma is filled with leather, dark wood, roasted coffee, BBQ-saus, dark chocolate and some smoke. Its even more roasted in the flavour with ash, coffee, fried pancakes and dark chocolate. Yummy. Has a light and silky mouth feel, and a medium bitterness. Lots of taste and aroma in a relatively light beer. Nice!

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2014 355ml bottle @ Bierhof, Athens.
An absolutely amazing beer!!!!! Blackened black colored body with a really nice brown head living for about 15-20 minutes as a one finger ring on top. Aromas were rich, dark chocolate and coffee. Taste was amazing. Same as the aroma, but some dark fruits added, and maybe a little roasted, burnt sugar. And the aftertaste... it tagged along for the whole night!!!! An exceptional beer!!!

Bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours a heavy black, with a half-inch thick mocha head on top. Nose is full with notes of vanilla, chocolate bark, roasted coffee beans, and a touch of alcohol. Absolutely full body coats the palate well. Really a smooth beer, that is rich and decadent in feel.

Huge amounts of roasted malt. Coffee, oak, vanilla beans, chocolate bread. Fantastic flavor balance. This is a truly fantastic beer and one of the standards for the style. I want some more.

Pours very dark with a nice foamy head.  Laces well down the glass.  Aroma is dark chocolate, cocoa and coffee.  Nicely blend of aromas!  Taste is slightly bitter and stringent with a creaminess at the finish.  Coffee aftertaste.  Great brew but maybe a little dry or chalky at the end for my tastes.

After twelve straight hours of rain and cold, I need a good dark beer and this Founders Porter is a perfect choice.  Looks amazing coming out of the bottle, nice tan head and almost completely black; beautiful porter.  Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and a herbal hops.  Great smoky flavor filled with dark chocolate, toasted malt and a nice amount of spicy hops.  Almost a perfect beer; robust, balanced, and delicious.  Im already ready for another.

Deep brown, near opaque pour producing an inch of thick, bubbly, light brown to brown foam. Nose is full of roasted malts, caramel, coffee, chocolate and liquorice. All you can ask basically.. Also a whiff of alcohol, but its quite pleasant. Malty liquorice is my best description of the flavour, with close to full mouthfeel and creamy, close to to oily on the palate. Well balanced, and hints of bitterness towards the end. Wish i had bought some more bottles..

Its Founders.  Its dark.   Its really, really good.  Pours dark with a quickly dissipating tan head.   Taste is chocolate, toast, espresso, dirt, smoke....all balanced perfectly by 45 IBU soldiers.  The mouthfeel is just right- not too heavy but substantial enough- the ideal porter.  One of my top 5 beers.

Pours a completly dark colour with a one finger tan head. Aroma of spruce, coffee and chocolate. Taste is as awesome as expected. Same flavours as the aroma, with a warm caramelish finish. The thing that sticks out here is the fantastic balance and the smooth finish. Just a enjoyment to drink. One of the best porters Ive had, if not the best. It just leaves you thinking, "how could this have a such a complex taste, yet so balanced, smooth and fantasticly easy to drink. Conclusion: An awesome beer indeed!

undated 12 oz. bottle poured a very dark mahogany color, looking nearly black in the glass. The thick tan head has a red tinge and good durability. 

Aroma: roast malt with hints of dark chocolate and spicy hops. 

Plenty of rich roast malt flavor. Predominantly dark toasted malt but without a burnt quality. A tingling note of spicy hops in the flavor and in the lasting aftertaste. Ample coffee and a bit of smoke in the finish. Good bitter/sweet balance.

Smooth; full body; good carbonation. 

O - a rich porter thats a tad too smokey/expresso for my taste.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Vika. Pours black with a tan head. Roasty aroma with coffee, dark fruits, dark chocolate and a hint of smoke? Sweet and roasty with a light bitterness in the finish. Smooth and desserty with a medium to full body. Delicious beer!(2013-02-16)

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small tan head. Aroma of fresh coffee/espresso, chocolate, licorice, light ash/smoke, dark fruit and light piney hops. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of coffee, chocolate and licorice. Full bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome mouthfeel for the ABV. Very nice beer overall.
Definitely an american version of the style. Hoppier and less stout-like than most porters Ive had. The flavor is rich and full of chocolate, roasted malts, and a hint of coffee. Pretty bitter.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours dark brown, black in glass, tanned head with big bubbles. Smells of roasted malts, yeast, caramel and hops. Taste is moderate sweet, quite dry, still some yeast flavors in there. Hints of coffee and chocolate, Moderate bitter, earthy hops. Very enjoyable porter - smooth and delicious. This beer gets better for every new sip i take. Nice!

Bottled 11/5/12. Consumed 2/14/13. Pours deep brown-black with a thin brown head. Aroma is chocolate, earth, nutty, creamy, some light fruitiness. Taste is very full; sweet, chocolate, earth, nutty, some nice hops for balance; a long bitter chocolate and coffee finish. Chewy mouth feel. Some lacing; not much. Where this ale really wins is in the taste. Its very full and rich; its still potent while the alcohol is pretty well hidden. An excellent porter.
Bottle to pint.  Pours a oily dark brown, nearly black with a tall foamy tan head.  Taste is dark chocolate, bitter coffee. Pretty decent porter.
delicious pours dark brown/black minimal choc white head, tons of bittersweet choc on the nose taste is sweet then pretty bitter in the finish nice balance very smooth.

12 oz bottle, pours a near black color with minimal tan head. No lacing present on glass. Aroma is sweet and nutty with chocolate that gets more intense as it warms up. Taste is more bitter than expected, minimal sweetness noted. Active on the palate, full body, delicious chocolate aftertaste.
Poured from bottle a dark brown/black with a two finger chocolate milk colored head. Aroma of malt, coffee, and roasted grains. Tastes similar to smell with the addition of dark chocolate.

Bottle. Pitch black with a lacing light brown head. Aroma is sweet roasted malt, chocolate, salty licorice, light vanilla, light coffee. Taste is medium+ sweet, light salty, light+ bitter. Medium body, oily/creamy texture, soft+ carbonation. Finish has roasted malt, licorice, light coffee, herbal hops.

Too often in a fit of oh shit the babys going to wake up, poop everywhere and need to be changed, fed and played with I dont let the beer mellow, to come down a few degrees. I started this review in haste before deciding to take my own advice. Glad I did.

STYLE: American Porter

ABV: 6.5%

LOOK: Unremarkable, the midpoint between oily and soda. An appalling lack of lacing. What head?

NOSE: Were off to a rather good start. Over a foot away, I can smell the chocolate and red fruits as it pours. Better as it warms. Smoother too. Weve gone from metallic to mid-range coffee.

MOUTH: It settles into coffee and lightly burnt malts. Not the extraordinary failure I thought it was at first. Medium body, dirty, barn doors, green pear. It has to be sessionable, but not because the ABV is relatively low. It simply lacks something robust, be it flavor or texture.

Beeradvocate Rating: 95

ratebeer Rating: 100

Hayward Abbey Rating: 82

0.355 l bottle at Vihreä Haltiatar. Black color. Aroma and flavor is dominated by coffee and licorice with firm bitterness and some nutty chocolatey background notes. Full bodied. Plenty of coffee and licorice, even to a point of masking other flavors. I did not find this so complex and special as most raters.

The nose is all dark espresso beans with subtle undertones of grapefruit.  The flavor follows suit but with some dark chocolate in the mix.  It pours a dark brown with no head,   The palate is wonderfully complex with a lot of bitterness in the back.
the 100% rating pretty much says it all. rich with dark bread, cocoa, bing cherries, a bit of burnt wood, etc. just fantastic.

Poured from 12oz bottle to snifter. Color is rich very dark brown, almost completely black. Head was tan colored although it was barely there and dissipated quickly. Aroma is heavy on chocolate and coffee. The taste is similar to the nose, includes roasted maltiness and a nice balance of bitter hops to go along with the sweetness. Medium bodied with smooth carbonation. Overall this a great go to Porter, always enjoy having one of these.

12oz bottle from local SAMs club. Dark brown, basically black pour with cappuccino colored thick frothy head a few fingers tall. Nose is sweet, malty chocolate scent that's not too strong. Relatively light mouth feel. Robust flavor, sweet at first. Rich chocolate, roasted nuts, typical malt backbone that's syrupy sweet and just slightly bitter and rooty. Finish is light with some roasted nut flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pitch black with a creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, lots of dark chocolate, coffee, hint of vanilla. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, dark bitter chocolate aswell as sweet milk chocolate, vanilla, light bitter hops. Medium body, average carbonation, dry roasted finish.

pours dark black with a thin tan head. aroma is dark chocolate and coffee grounds. Taste is dark chocolate and black coffee, verry bittersweet, good bbalance, a bit earthy. Good porter but i still like edmund fitzgerald just a bit more

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2013 Beautiful black with tan head. Aroma is roasty joyousness. The taste, for a porter, is pitch perfect. Sweet, then roasty, then slightly bitter. And theres a nice bit of a tingle at the back. Overall, one of my favourite porters.

Bottle. Pours pich black with very little head or carbonation. Very sweet and tastes of dark malts, a bit of chocolate and coffee. A bit watery in consistency and a bit simple in complexity, but it tastes really good. Would definitely drink again.

This is probably the simplest, yet most awesomest straight up porter style ale that Ive ever had. Its dark, dark brown in color with a dense, medium-brown head. The aroma is smooth, but rich and roasted with a slight anise character. The flavor is very, very nice, slick, almost light-bodied really, very, very tasty. It finishes dry and clean with some very sassy roast. What a perfect porter, and still fairly traditional.
Black beer, light brown head. Aroma roasted dark chocolate. Taste has medium bitterness and chocolate, no sweetness. Dry finish light body.

Draught at Beer Authority NYC sept 2012. Black beer with a nice brownish head. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, tar aroma. Vanilla, dried dark fruits, chocolate, roasted malt flavour with nice tar and licoricenotes. The coffee flavour turns up after a while and it´s wounderful, not att all bitter och burnt just plain nice coffee flavour. This is truely love in a bottle - a magic moment that you will expirence over and over again :-)

A deep black pour with an awesome tan head that retains for a bit. The aroma is magnificent with lots of roasted coffee, chocolate, and toasty barley. The taste follows along well and doesnt disappoint. Smooth, creamy texture loaded with roasted malt flavor and molasses. To top it off , it even finishes with a bit of lactic and chocolate that lingers well and make for a complex amazing beer. Definitely a favorite and will keep getting lots of it!

Bottle thanks to Phatdog1! Faint toffee and chocolate aroma. Poured a dark brown almost black color with a nice bubbly khaki top and great lacing. Tastes mostly of coffee (not overpowering though), but has hints of dark cocoa, and roasted malts. Medium body, medium carbonation and sweet on the palate. Solid porter! Defiantly worthy of the top 3 rating in this style

Aroma is dominated by roast with a nice balanced chocolate character. Subtle dark fruit and medium low hop notes compliments the dark malts. The roast has a nice coffee aroma. The hop note is more dank than fruity. 
Pours a dark brown almost black with brown highlights on the edges. The head is small and tan and recedes quickly to the edges where it persists. 
Flavor starts with some semisweet chocolate but this quickly fades to a nice mocha/coffee notes. Behind that comes a nice hop flavor. Some pine resin and just a hint of citrus. The fruit notes in the flavor are minimal. Bitterness is moderate and astringency is minimal. No alcohol flavor. Finishes with a touch of sweetness to balance a bitter chocolate and coffee note. 
Mouthfeel is medium to medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Astringency is low. Mouthfeel has a nice silkiness to it. 
Overall this is one of the best American Porters I have ever had. Nice balanced roast and chocolate character with some clean balanced hop notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smooth roasted malt and chocolate flavored porter. Great finish and Smooth overall. Nice

On tap at a local place. Served in a pint glass. Pours dark, dark brown with a thin beige ring of a head. Nice roasty, chocolate aroma with some herbil hop notes. Sweet chocolate flavor with a mild bittering hop presence. Full bodied with low carbonation. Roasty, mildly bitter aftertaste. Very nice.

12oz Bottle A - Pours black with a minimal tan head. Good lacing. A - Lots of chocolate. T - Semi sweet chocolate, bitter coffee, & roasted malts. M - Medium bodied with a creamy texture. Tingling bubbles with a bitter dark chocolate finish. O - An adult beverage of excellent quality. Yummy!

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2014 Black. Big, full, tan head. Lots of sticky lacing. Chocolate malt aroma with hops and coffee in the background. Flavor has chocolate and coffee evenly balanced with hops. Some roastiness. Medium body. Hop finish with some drying and bitterness, with the chocolate and coffee reappearing much later on after the finish. Very smooth, well-balanced beer

.35l @ Vihreä Haltiatar
Pours pitch black with low tan head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, dark fruits and syrup. Flavor is lactose, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Somehow a bit dissapointing flavor for a 99/99 beer imo.
Dark dark brown with tan head. Coffee and malt on the nose. Coffee, chocolate, malt and a hoppy bitterness. Very nice porter.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Pours dark brown with a very thin head. Aroma is licorice and boozy.  Dark chocolate flavor with a full, rich mouthfeel.  Not too slick.  Overall very good.
Just an outstanding beer. Nice mouth feel. Not thin and not heavy. Dark  chocolate notes but subtle. I dont detect any bitterness. Dry finish. I can see myself drinking a lot if these.

En bouteille au mondial de mtl, robe noire mousse moka, arôme de caco, goût de café chocolaté.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer pours a nice dark reddish-brown with nearly no head, but what does exist atop the beer is a nice chocolate color. Although the aroma is subtle, there are hints of chocolate and dough. This beer is slightly sweet when it first hits the tongue, but it grows more bitter as it goes down the throat and lingers on the taste buds. It is a thick beer, but the creamy slick nature of the liquid itself makes for a pleasant experience.

Chocolate coffee malty smell.  Taste similar to smell with some smoke and burnt flavor.  Dark oily color as well as mouth feel.  Similar to the breakfast stout without the smoothness of the oatmeal and a little more bitter.  Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark pour with an espresso head.  Aroma of chocolate and some roasted nuts.  Mouth is think with a bitter finish.  Some chocolate, but the hops really take away any undesirable sweetness.  A little oily.  Bitter finish lingers.  Really nice porter.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. The pour is a deep dark brown to black with a longer lasting tan head.  I got whiffs of dark malts, smoke, coffee, and chocolate even before I poured it out and clearly after it hit the glass. The body is creamy and bold.  The taste is slightly sweet up front with a wonderful sharp bitterness at the rear.  It looks, smells, and tastes like a Porter should.

On tap at the Lewiston Village Pub. A heavy brown colouring with a minimal head and a coffee-caramel type scent with a hint of berry making an appearance in a most unexpected way.  The taste immediately settled into a pleasant combination of coffee and satisfaction.

Draught, dark black with a white head, but when held up to the light there are hues of red. A shockingly smooth beer with robust full body mouth feel. It is not bitter but not creamy. It is an excellent porter with a clean palate aftertaste.

Delightful porter. Aroma of chocolate malts but very faint. Pours a near black. Tastes a bit grassy/mossy/woodsy. Favorite year-round founders. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark roast almost burnt aromas with some hops.  Very dark and opaque for a porter.   Personally, I like my porters with a bit of a rounder palate and a sweeter profile...this definitely falls on the hoppier side of the spectrum.  Good, well balanced, but wouldnt be my go-to porter (that probably is Anchor or Mad River...).

Pours dark with a brown head that laces..smells of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, and some hops. Taste is great and balanced. The roasted malts and hop balance is just about perfect. After taste is coffee. Really nice. Substantial body that coats, but isnt syrupy. Awesome beer.
A bit more of a coffee taste than I like, but what a good beer.  Im more of a pale ale drinker, but this is a great tasting beer.

Dégustée au Mondial de la Bière de Montréal 2012. De couleur noire et opaque. Nez de grains de malt rôtis (notes brûlées), moyen de houblon herbeux (herbes asséchantes), léger-moyen de chocolat noir et de café avec des traces de chocolat au lait (lactiques). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture  moyennement crémeuse. Notes lactiques de chocolat avec des tracesa de noix grillées lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût de malt assez rôti, un moyen goût de chocolat noir et des traces de pain brûlé. parallèlement, une légère-moyenne amertume de houblon herbeux asséchant sde développe conjointement à un léger goût de café et ce, jusquen finale. Post-goût long et plutôt sec, moyennement amer de rôti, léger de chocolat et de houblon herbeux ainsi quun léger goût de café.

Thanks for the gift, Harold. This one was nice, with tons of roasted coffee, some chocolate, and a hint of vanilla and grassy hops. This brew looked great, with a nice black body and a tan head. Taste was as expected with roasted notes, coffee, some light chocolate, and a touch of grassy hops to round it out. Very balanced and well done.

This one was as good as expected. The body was a deep reddish-brown with some silky lacing. It smelled like well water, grass and chocolate. Flavors were almost matched, but the earthy undertones were fantastic, roasty and dry for a satisfying brew. Good stuff here.

Pours a nice black color with a good two finger mocha colored head. Smells of ground coffee mostly. Taste also follows with coffee and a little chocolaty malt followed by a bit of bitterness. Overall a solid porter worth picking up.

Smells heavily of cacao. Lots of musky roast malt as well. Pours syrupy black with mocha head. Medium to low carbonation. Drank this in a brown paper bag to lighten my load walking around on New Years Eve in New York. Cracked it at Penn Station waiting for the lady friend. Bottle.

Bottle. Dark brown, tan head. Good lacing. Nose is roasted malts, some light coffee. Taste is roasted malts, bitter chocolate, fresh water, and some breadiness and banana reminiscent of a yeasty Belgian dubbel. Light lasting bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel.

Beer appears as a lifeless black, with a carbonated slightly off-white head.   Aroma of chocolate, and a tiny bit of bitter hops.  Palate is very smooth, a bit bitter, and creamy.  Nice balanced porter, but not exceptional.

Rich dark toffee aroma. Slight alcohol aftertaste. Thick but smooth chocolate flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Home. Opened to celebrate my rating # 3000 and to sweeten the backlog work, Cheers me! Pours pitch black with a creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, lots of dark chocolate, coffee, hint of vanilla. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, dark bitter chocolate aswell as sweet milk chocolate, vanilla, light bitter hops. Medium body, average carbonation, dry roasted finish. A mighty fine porter, yummi. 291212

Pours dark brown/black with a nice espresso head that fades to a ring. The aroma is deep chocolate and vanilla swirl with toasted malt and a bit of coconut. The taste is roasted malt, vanilla, oak, chocolate, and coffee. There is a silky smootheness that coats the tongue to the long finish. One of the best porters Ive had.

12 oz bottle: Pours dark black with a thin light brown head. Sticky, oily on the glass. Aroma is nice chocolate malts, caramel, floral hops and slight licorice. Taste is nice an malty, thick chocolate layer with a mix of lighter toasted malt and some floral hop flavor for balance. If it had just a tad more hop it would be nearly perfect. Nice mouthfull, very easy to drink, great aftertaste that makes you want a second drink. Easily one of the best porters out there.

This is my favorite Porter. It surpasses the others by providing an excellent overall experience. Pours smooth with a minimal toffee colored head. Malty and roasty with coffee, fruit and cocoa, balanced by some hop floral dryness toward the end. Dare I say a "sessionable" porter. Perfect for the colder months in the snow belt. Founders nailed this one.
Smooth coffee and toast flavors. Dark roasted chocolate and hints of raisins. Very smooth and medium/heavy bodied.

Appearance: Nice dark motor oil, small off white head quickly dissipates.

Smell: lots of coffee, dark cocoa and dark toasted malt aroma. Im getting some vanilla as well.

Taste: taste has coffee, dark chocolate caramel, and bitterness of the malts used. taste a lot like a the breakfast stout with less coffee.

Mouthfeel: mouth feels a bit heavier, more full-bodied than other porters. Its creamy and has a little bit of tanginess to it. Not getting the bozziness as it a 6.5 abv but its well hidden.

Overall: Good porter.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-20-2012

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2012 Bottle 35,5 cl. Black and opaque with a nice, light brown head. Roasted malty with licorice notes and a distinct coffee aroma. Taste is roasted, sweet salty licorice malty and lovely strong coffee notes. Medium body. Dry and  lingering, medium bitter finish. Maybe the perfect porter?
Very dark with a creamy head. Mild aroma and a taste of chocolate with a hint of coffee.

Old review, Bottle. Pours a thick dark black color with a beautiful lasting brown head. Aromas and flavor of fudge, roasted and choc malts, caramel, tons of fuely hops. Perfectly layered and balanced for the style. Aftertaste is unreal with vanilla and mocha flavors sticking around on the tongue. An exceptional porter in all regards. Cheers.
Smelled coffee as soon as I opened this one.  Nice lacy tan-colored heard.  Palate is clean followed by slight bitterness.  Taste coffee, a bit of caramel.  Nice porter.
From bottle. Black pour and tan head. Taste and aroma is full of chocolate, toasted malt and nice hops.
Had this bottle, draft, and growler now and its always spectacular. Big chocolate and coffee aroma and taste. Nice dry vanilla finish.

Pitch black pour with a khaki head.  Nose is light chocolate, cocoa, dry, coffee, bitter, and roasted.  Very smooth on the palate, rich roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, more coffee, and a grainy finish.

12 oz bottle, Whole Foods Columbus.  Jet black; initially a big, brown, frothy and creamy head that becomes a thin covering yet a notable ring the whole way down the glass persist; huge lacing despite the head becoming thin; head can be revived by swirling for more than an hour.  Aroma is utterly and overly dominated by roast and coffee; this one-dimension-ality is not something that I am willing to praise.  Flavor is up front deep roast, coffee, and completely unsweetened chocolate as suggested by the aroma; this is followed by dark chocolate and vanilla, but, despite all this, there is not enough clarity in these flavors and so Im not floored by that aspect of the beer.  Mouthfeel is really great; silky, creamy, frothy, and maybe just the tiniest bit thin for a big beer, but Im not going to deduct points because it is what it should be for this beer.  This appearance and palate of this beer are world-class elements of this beer; but the aroma and flavor simply arent complex enough for the prestige that this brew carries.  Absolutely, this is a really solid porter, but its too basic to call this 100th percentile overall.  Well above your standard micro porter, though, and for a beer that doesnt bill itself as "imperial," this is really very good.
Best porter Ive had.bitter,chocolate,coffee,malty, roasted...good lacing, poor head.

Pours jet black with a big khaki head. Aroma is roasted malts. Taste starts with some hop bitterness and roasted malts. Finishes with a nice chocolate note. Nice lively carb. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Superb, crisp and balanced porter. Perfect blend of hops, malt, and velvety textured. I love this beer, its the best for a cold night.
Bottle.  Pours a deep brown with thin mocha head and lacing.  Nose is chocolate and coffee.  Tastes is chocolate and roasted malts. Decent bitterness, creamy mouth feel.  Top notch porter
Dark brown color with a nice nose of coffee and chocolate. Taste follows with a sharp hop bite. Smooth mouthfeel with a bitter finish. Superb.

Pours dark chocolate brown with medium, expresso-foam colored head that recedes gradually to light lacing on glass and surface. Toasty aromas. The effect is that this is a beer of substance, stature. Deep roasted notes, a coffee-like, dry bitterness, a hint of sour, with caramelized grains. Its chewy, like a black bread, leaving the tonque with lingering entertainment. It can be sipped and savored. Though its substantial, its not heavy. Founders does it again. (I had this years ago, but had not rated it - my bother declared this to be his daily afterwork reward, so I had to resample.)

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2012 Bottle pour..into tulip..wow..this offering is indeed dark..rich..and sexy..aroma Is a terrific combination of chocolate..with some vanilla and just flat out goodness..only had a small sample as part of a tasting unfortunately because this was by far the best porter I have ever enjoyed..the mouthfeel is amazing and it achieves greatness without having to have a enormous abv..this beer puts to shame many bland porters and founders nailed this one..the palate lives up to the print on the bottle and it would be nice to get some more of this to have year round..has some qualities of a stout..but who cares what you think of the porter/stout classification..enjoyed this more than Everett..definitely worth seeking out...

Bottled 355ml. -Black coloured, medium sized dark brown head, chocolate and light roasty nose. Roasted malt, roasted bread and dark chocolate with notes of vanilla and coffee. Bitter finish with some hops presence. Smooth, easy drinkable and enjoyable porter.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a nonic pint glass. Bottled on 3/3/12 printed on bottle.

Appearance: Pours pitch black with a huge 3-4 finger fluffy light chocolate brown head which dissipates very slowly. Excellent head retention and lacing. Looks exactly the way I want a porter to look.

Smell: Roasted malts dominate with a little bit of milk chocolate.

Taste: Dark roasted malt up front followed by unsweetened chocolate and earthy hops in the middle before ending with coffee and burnt toast flavors at the finish. Aftertaste is bitter and roasty. 

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a high amount of prickly carbonation. Not quite as creamy as I would have liked, but still nice.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. You could drink a few without any trouble on a cool day.

Overall: Excellent beer overall and one of the best American porters Ive tried. Like everything else Ive had from Founders, I would highly recommend trying this one.

Pours a dark velvet.  Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Taste of chocolate and robust roasted malts. Perfect on a winter day

----Hophaze out

light chocolate coffee aroma .  dark black poor. Foamy tan head. Medium sized chunks of light colored sediment. Some lacing. and nice sharp sweetness. YEast chocolate coffee tea.  lightweight with natural carbonation. a really nice beer .  a bit light and weak but very drinkable without being wimpy .

Dark almost black with aroma of chocolate and coffee.  Rich roasted coffee and chocolate the predominant flavors...great on a cold night

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Taken from my BA account, reviewed on 2/26/12

Live tasting 12 oz. bottle into Duvel tulip...

Appearance; pours a deep dark brown out of the bottle, that becomes black in the glass with cola edges... Single finger head falls exceptionally quickly, leaving nothing but a very thin ring of bubbles around the edges..

Smell; lots of roasty malt, coffee, caramel and chocolate... 

Taste; quite similar to the smell, jumps right in with coffee and roasted malts, the caramel and chocolate are more subdued and quite nicely accent the roastiness... Medium finish with a nice lingering roasted malt/coffee flavor.

Mouthfeel; on the light side of full bodied, with a bit more carbonation than I would expect, but it definitely compliments the flavor and body of the beer... Slightly sticky, it hangs around a bit on the sides of the glass but nowhere near the extent of a beer like Ten Fidy... 

Overall; a damn good beer! My second Founders experience, Ive got a few more in the fridge and I cant wait to get into them!!
Pours a dark deep black. This porter has a very smokey flavor and is very smooth. Would definitely drink again. Had it with vince at his house from six

An excellent example of this style. Pours black with creamy chocolate milk head... Aromas of roasted malts, coffee beans, and chocolate. More roasty malts, coffee and dark chocolate flavours. Smooth, creamy, and well balanced. Drinkable and delicious.
12 ounce bottle.  Pours dark brown/black, medium head.  Smells like chocolate and coffee.  Taste is smooth, creamy chocolate, coffee, roast, malt.  Full body.  Delicious.

Nice malty aroma: Roast, caramel, sweet. Great malt balance. Roasted and "burnt" flavor at first, followed by some caramel sweetness, and some great coffee flavor in aftertaste. Rich, smooth mouthfeel.
Bottle. Pours a pitch black with a slight white head. Aroma is a strong chocolate Colombian coffee. Taste is insanely smooth. Easy to drink. Very creamy aftertaste. Really great.

The roastiest of roasty flavors on the nose and to taste.  I feel like I should be next to wood stove with a pipe...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Another fantastic entry from Founders. Dark, velvety pour. Chocolate, smoke, coffee, roasted malts.  Bitter afters that works perfect. Drinkable throughout. Great porter.

I had this on-tap and later the same night had it out of the bottle, and I think I like the bottle better - heresy, I know. My notes are for the bottled version.

Slides out of the bottle a black, tarry amber that develops about 1/2" of head that looks, both in color and consistency, like café au lait. Foam is sticky and substantially smooth. No lacing, just foam stuck to the glass. Smells of a classic, rich porter with coffee notes and a bit of metallic copper.

Heavy roasted flavors right away with a dry bitterness at the end that reminds me of baking chocolate or a roasted espresso bean, along with some hop character. Sits heavily in the mouth, creamy with pleasant, light carbonation.

Bravo, Founders!
Black beer. Small brown head.Smell: Lots of burned malts, some chocolate, tobacco and stuff. Taste is actually pretty much chocolate. Very well balanced with the roast. Massive beer for 6,5 % alc.!

12oz bottle poured into snifter glass.  Dark brown color with surprisingly thin tan head.  Aroma of milk chocolate, marshmallow, vanilla, roasted malt and light coffee.  Taste is much like the aroma, full body with creamy and soft palate.  Light bitter finish. Wow this is good.
A bit smoky for my taste, but definitely a nice huge malty porter.  Dark as night.  Moderately hoppy afterbite.  Sweetness and roastiness in balance.

One of the most interesting porters that still fits to style guidelines. Deep dark color with a small egg shell head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, toast, with American/English style hops that poke through. Flavor is moderately roasty for a Porter but still fits the bill, extra IBUs balance nicely. The upper end of the Porter style, some may say this is a Robust Porter, either way another winner from one of my favorite breweries. -Alex [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */,net
chocolate, caramel, nuts, black, heavy cloying sweetness, full body...just a good balanced porter with a great flavor
