The taste is balanced between sweet chocolate notes and bitter roasted flavors. Some smoke. The hops show in the slightly bitter finish. The finish is a bit wet. The bodys medium, the carbonation active on the tongue. The beers a bit too acidic/astringent. the texture is oily. Overall, a very good, flavorful porter, acidic finish considered.

Dark brown pour with barely any head. Wonderful aroma of dark roasted malts, with chocolate, coffee, and a bit of leather. Taste is rich and roasty, slightly dry, with a bittersweet chocolate finish. Really opens up as it warms. Palate is quite robust and fantastically easy to drink. One of the great porters.
Beautiful beer.  Full and strong yet still nuanced.  Chocolate and roasted flavor permeates.

Chocolate aroma with a hint of dark fruit. Deep dark brown a tan subdued head. Mild bitter start , then sour which then surprisingly finishes clean. I can feel lots of carbonation on my tongue which is unlike most Porters Ive had. Feels thinner than other porters Ive had. Refreshing and easy to drink.

Thick black dark tan head,  bitter chocolate and licorice aroma. Dark roasted malts, pine hops, and dark chocolate on the palate.  More pine cone hop finish. Not as thick as the aroma would indicate but still very rich and tasty.

Bottled. Opens with a huge shh, which is quite unusual for american brews. Black color, huge rocky brownish head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, slight caramelly, licorice. Slight sweet taste, medium bitter. Slight sticky palate. Bit overcarbonated, which doesnt always seem to be the case. I should try it again.

Bottle. Heavy malt aromas of dark bread, toasted and dark bitter chocolate, light to moderate resin for the hops and earth for the yeast, with notes of charcoal, milk and tobacco. Head is small, frothy turning wispy, light brown with fair lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic, and moderately bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, oily with a soft to lively carbonation and finishes a little chalky and slightly dry and sticky. Deep, rich and full of flavors and aromas, this is a Porter perfect for winter evenings sipping.

12oz bottle from pushkinwow (wow!)  Pours a pure black, with a small bit of head. Lots of roasty aroma.  Coffee, caramel, and bitter chocolate.  Oily and bitter.  This is terrific. I dont drink a lot of porter, but if I could get this. I would.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2012 Cigarette ashes. Opaque pitch black/brown; cardboard brown head, slushy, minimal lace. Slick oily feel, ashy feel. Caramel and toffee malt. Sweeter than expected. Dusty in the nose; beautifully balanced between the chalky nuttiness and a sweet caramel balance.
One delicious porter. Black but will let light through, roasty toasty aroma and flavor, so easy to drink, and not crazy abv which is a huge plus. great beer.
This beer to me is very dark, rich, and delicious.  This beer was the deciding factor into which style of beer was my favorite.  If you like porters, this one will treat you really nice :)

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color porter with a nice thick foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate is quite powerful and interesting. Taste is a nice mix between some black chocolate notes with medium roasted malt notes though the overall mix is balanced by just enough sweetness. Body is full and has a super nice creamy texture with good carbonation. Very well brewed and something I wouldnt mind having on a regular basis.
Very complex porter.  Love the texture and smoothness.  Rich yet drinkable.  If you like porters its one of my favorites.

Det här är en god porter där smaken präglas främst av mörk choklad och lite kaffe. Jag tycker mig kunna känna lite humle i aromen vilket känns märkligt eftersom maltigheten tar över smaken på ölen och där kan jag inte känna någon som helst nyans av humle. Dessutom kan jag känna en liten nyans av syra, men det är chokladen som gör det största jobbet här.

On tap at Rattle & Hum, New York.
Thin off white head.  Clear deep pour.  Lots of chocholate in the aftertaste.  Yummy!

Man, stingy bitch*s rating this beer.  It simply doesnt get any better than this.  One could mount a niggling criticism that it is mislabeled as a porter, as many have noted, and certainly there is truth in this charge.  However, once you get passed that, you can drink it for what it is:  the best porter in the world (and if you take it as a stout, among the best of that genre as well).  Contrary to the previous evaluator, I rate the carbonation as a major strength, but I personally dislike weak carbonation of stouts of the Guinness variety.  But this stuff by the truckload!

Almost perfect...if it wasnt for the over-carbonation it would be a perfect 100 for me. Black dark color....chocolate and coffee aromas. Taste: Dark Chocolate, coffee, some caramel hints....amazing after taste. Best Porter I ever had.

Bottle from the Taliban.  I think they mislabled this bottle.  Surely this is approaching a stout instead of a porter.  Inky black pour with a dense head that fades quickly.  The nose is great with floral hops and roasted malts.  No wonder this style counts as food!  The body is very creamy and full.  Sweet and smokey up front with a hoppy finish full of coffee and chocolate.  Possibly the best porter Ive tried.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2012 bottle - gorgeous porter. Pitch black pour with dissipating beige head. Dark, rich malts, with plenty of roasted character, dark chocolate. Sweet caramel and brown sugar. Hint of pine and orange peel. Some mineral character on the nose that detracts somewhat. Body is smooth and milky. Delicious.
Bottle.  Black with a medium brown head.  Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, and a little metal.  Taste is of coffee, caramel, with a nice drty roasted finish.   Very full bodied, creamy.

Easily the best porter I have ever had.  12 oz bottle to pint glass.  Pours black with small tan head.  I get lots of chocolate and coffee.  Taste is sweet, but dry, with very good short bitter finish--complex does not really describe it.  Velvet in the mouth.

12 oz. bottle. Pours black with a thin tan head, and no lacing. The aroma is dark chocolate and coffee. The flavor is very sweet, with just a little roasted bitterness in the finish. The palate is medium to heavy, creamy and sticky. Overall, this is a clean and tasty beer. Quite a good porter.

Purchased from "Jungle Jims" - Alright, my dark twelve ounce bottle poured forth a black brew with a finely bubbled tan head of foam and a rich mocha aroma. Tastewise, this is a rich, complex porter with no errors in taste, body, and appearance!

I was very excited to try the best rated porter, but apparently it has been knocked out of the top spot. This is really more like a chocolate stout and is defined as porter only for its being well hopped. It is black enough to block a flashlight beam, and leaves oily tan lacing on the pint glass. Aroma is straight chocolate, while the flavor contains some nut and oat accents as well. Very smooth throughout, nice full body. Highly recommended.
Bottle.  Pours very dark brown, brown head.  Aroma of chocolate nibs dipped in coffee.  Taste is chocolate squared.  Too chocolatey to be a porter, imho.
Chocolately as chocolate gets in a porter that isnt spiked with actual chocolate.  Delicious.  Dark, rich, and flavorful. 9-22-2010

Pour quite dark brown with creamy beige head nice lace. Aroma chocolate, roast, dark malts, cereal grain, cocoa, hops. Taste dark and milk chocolate, cocoa, roast, cereal grain, nice hop balance, very balanced. MF medium body light carb. Very tasty easy drinking and quite balanced with a silky profile quite good.
Deep brown almost black with a thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. These flavors continue on the palate with added toast and biscuit notes. Nice balance, great porter.

16oz draft from Hanger poured into a shaker. Pours black with about a finger of dark tan head. Aroma of dark coffee and bitter chocolate. Taste is Medium bitter. Strong coffee and chocolate taste. Full bodied with a thick texture. Nice carbonation and a long coffee finish. Overall, very good. I would love to drink this again.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2012 Pours black ish with garnet hue, tan head. smells of chocolate heavy roasted malt for a porter and coffee. Taste is bittersweet cocoa and moderate roared grain. There is some green raisin and non discript dark fruit, lingering coffee like bitterness. It seems moderately oily and hoppy with some dryness. Lower carbonation and good body, would drink this again and again. This is basically a stout.
Pours black with some head and lacing. Nose is coffe, roasted barley. First sip is nice balance of dark malt flavor and bittersweet chocolate. Finish is clean and balanced.

12oz bottle pours a thick black with a small brown head. Aroma of roasted caramel malt, roasted espresso beans, cacao, with some dark fruity tones of plums. Taste is the same as aroma with some bitter cacao and hops. Palate is a full bodied, creamy, oily texture with moderate carbonation. Finish is roasted caramel malt and espresso ending with a sweet bitter cacao, and some lingering notes of dark fruit and caramel malt. Has a nice rustic burnt flavor. Overall an excellent porter. Very much enjoyed this brew.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2011 12oz bottle from Tim, thanks 
Appearance: Pours dark brown with a medium sized creamy brown head and good lacing 
Aroma: Rich chocolate, roasted coffee and dark malts 
Taste: Silky mouthfeel of roasted malts, dried cocoa, grainy, ashy and roasted coffee 
Very nice and smooth, wish I could drink this all the time.

porter of the century. can drink this anytime. dark pour nice mocha head. nose is chocolate and coffee. nice dark malts. mouthfeel is perfect balance not to thick or thin. flavor is everything a porter should be.
Spot on for appearance & palate.  Im not certain porters should have this much roastiness.  Darn good porter.
I am not a huge porter fan, but this is the best I have had.  Thick, smooth, easy drinking, a ton of flavor, definitely worth trying and a go to porter for me.
Chocolate malt and coffee porter with mild hop bitterness.  Very smooth and balanced flavor.  The mystery ingredient could be cinnamon?  Similar to Rogue Mocha Porter with less hop bite.

Dark black color with the pour.  Large brown head.  Foamed over slightly.  Ooops.  Rich chocolate taste with coffee.  Smells amazing.  Super excited to try this beer.  Rich roastyness.  Coffee, chocolate and some vanilla.
Bottle at Olympen. Black underneath a huge, creamy, beige head. Bitter chocolate and roasted coffee in the nose and mouth. Good dryness, hints of tart berries. A great porter.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2011 Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

A: Deep brown almost completely opaque beer, literally only the tiniest light goes through the edges. Thin caramel colored head that dissipates to a lacing that lasts the length of the beer.

S: Bitter dark chocolate and espresso flavors, in a good way. Reminds me of a fine mocha espresso.

T: The bitter taste of good dark chocolate mixed well with an espresso shot, just as it smells. Heck even my girlfriend who dislikes beer likes it, thats how good it is, without being overly sweet at all. Leaves a bitter taste in mouth.

M: Thick and medium carbonation make this an easy drink.

O: Ive not drank many porters, but this is my favorite. Great job founders for making a very robust beer thats easy to drink.
Bottle, poured dark brown with an out of control foam. The smooth vanilla is what sets this apart from other porters.

12oz bottle. one of the best porters i have had. the aroma of coffee, roasted malts and chocolate blended together is wonderful. the deep rich taste of each plus a blend of hops that comes out and give this beer its true character. perfectly balance from first taste to last and then you want more.

You smell the roasted and coffee notes right on top. Taste like it smells but with a little bitter finish and a little vanilla flavor. Well balanced, drinkability is high even though its a porter. Im not blown away but its good and on style. Once again great work by founders. Well see later this week how the Bells version compares.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2011 (2)- Ma 2e expérience a été légèrement différente. Température plus adéquate, énorme collet dans un verre plus étroit. Plus corpulente, plus sexy et moins amère...mais encore loin dêtre LA porter. Je réajuste à 3.9, sans plus.

(1)- En la versant, je ne retrouve pas vraiment le sex-appeal annoncé. Totalement noir dans le verre, elle ne produit pratiquement aucun collet. En la respirant, jai limpression davoir une old rasputin, beaucoup damertume  de torréfaction comme un café aux noisette brûlées. Je perçoit aussi un peu de la sécheresse quon retrouve dans les vins. Au goût, lamertume est très envahissante, pas beaucoup de chocolat, pas beaucoup de corps. Jespère que jaurai à réviser ma critique plus tard. Pas mauvais mais loin dêtre impressionnant.
Aroma of roast coffee.   Pours black with very little head.  Tastes very roasty with distinct coffee flavors.  Very dark and yummy.

12oz bottle. Black with velvet mocha head. Chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, some smoke; very smooth, nice carbonation, nice bitterness that grows towards a nice dry end, long hoppy, chocolate and malt profile at the end. One of the best porters Ive had and probably the first one Ive really enjoyed in a long time. Worth seeking out!

Draft.  Pours a thickish dark brown with tan head and good lacing.  Smell is roasted malts, dark chocolate and a tad roasted coffee.  Taste is much the same as smell with some caramel like undertones and a nice bitter kick. Probably the best porter Ive had to date.
Very very dark brown almost black with a small tan head.Rich and full of flavor.Flavors of coffee and caramel a touch of sweetness and a bitter finish.Beer taste bigger then what it is witch is cool.

pours an amazing brown head. smells of roasted toffee/coffee. you can taste all the roasted grain almost silky smooth like chocolate milk. little hop aftertaste which i like. this is one of my go to porters
UPDATED: NOV 25, 2011 On draft at Cloverleaf during Founders takeover night.  Burnt coffee and bittersweet chocolate flavors.  So easy to drink with smooth oily palate.  A rich and complex porter.

12 oz bottle poured in a dimpled mug: very complex aroma chocolate, coffee, toast, spruce, earthy, soy sauce, smoke: pitch black color, minimal head, brown foam; medium sweetness, salty, lightly bitter; full body, soft carbonation, oily feel, an abrupt burn then sweet burnt finish;  great beer with meal and just finishing a long hard day.

Bottle.  Dark black pour, a little carbonation and chocolatey and slightly smoky aroma.  Flavor is slightly sweet nutty chocolate, creamy and finished very mellow and earthy.  Surprised I hadnt rated this one until now.

A lot of chocolate and coffee in the aroma. Nice combination of bitterness and full body. Very dar and incredible lacing. Kind of oily on the palate. As far as porters go, the taste is nutty and burnt and exctaly what Id expect a porter to be.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2012 Very very good, right up there with Edmond Fitzgerald, which is the best porter ever brewed.

Bottle. Pours black with an a beige head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, hay and coffee. Flavor is sweet and malty with some chocolate and coffee. Medium body, average carbonatin.  Nice roaste beer.
Somewhat new to the craft beer scene. Been drinking and researching for about a year now and this the greatest porter Ive ever had. Delicious.

355 ml bottle @ Melkebaren, Sandnes. Reddish dark brown body with a big, creamy beige head. Strong aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and caramel. Flavor has lot of sweet, dark malt, coffee, chocolate and dry fruit. Fine body and a long and bitter aftertaste. A very nice and strong flavored porter.

Sampled at GBF11
Balck with a bubbly beige head.
Milky chocolate in both aroma an flavour.
Light and slightly sourish.

355 mL bottle.  Smells lovely; all roast and chocolate, with a sweetness that is just right.  The flavour borders on a stout, without creating any doubt that this is a porter.  Roast, mocha, no metallic tang.  The body is full and creamy.  Excellent beer.
Dark brown color/ tan head. Rich milk chocolate, medium roast coffee aromas. Medium bodied. Lightly sweet milk chocolate flavors with espresso, mildly astringent burnt malts--good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hoppy Loft: pitch-black with a huge mocha head, smells very strongly of bitter chocolate, in the background some chocolate malts & coffee, tastes like mocha ice-cream, chocolate, sweet with slightly roasted, creamy malts, hint of wood in the finish, I am not getting the prickly bitter hops that follow in the finish, wonder how it would have been without them, slightly sticky
This porter is excellent, smooth, silky, and beautifully aromatic. Besides pictured rocks this is my favorite thing from/in Michigan.

1. Look  This is a dark black porter with frothy brown head.
2. Sniff  There is a big coffee aroma and chocolate notes as well.
3. Sip  This porter is full of flavor and has a consistent bitterness from start to finish.  Its full bodied flavor and long lasting coffee taste definitely help this beer stand out.  
4. Another Look  A very long lasting big head.  The beer looks very mouthwatering.
5. Evaluate  Overall, this is a tasty porter that is well balanced.  I really enjoy this beer.  I love the sweet taste and the slightly bitter aftertaste.  I would recommend to my family and friends especially around the holidays.
Beautiful pour, solid color with good initial aroma. Very even and almost milky mouthfeel that goes down deliciously smooth. One of my favorite porters and one of the best founders offerings.
Poured from a bottle. Very dark, lots of head. Roasted malts on the nose. Roast and chocolate tasting. Excellent beer, great value.

pours black with a thin beige head and lots of lacing.  aroma is bitter chocolate, with some wood.  carbonation is light, body is medium full.  taste is dark malt, bitter chocolate and some hops but only at the very end.  finish is quite bitter for a porter.  a very fine beer.

Short 12oz bottle.  (Bottled on 04/28/11, 10:19.)  Aroma of chocolate oozing from the glass.  Black color, nice legs, medium brown colored head.  Sweet nose of toasted malts, burnt sugars, and a touch of lactobacilus.  Loads of chocolate, some coffee, molasses sugar, and mild wooded hops.  Thick flavor of burnt grain,  sooo much roasted flavors it gives an espresso character. Light fruit.  The combination of burnt coffee and the hops have a bitterness that mellows out any sugar flavor that may still be there.  This beer is excellence, a masterpiece of a Porter.  So good it could possibly pass as a Milk Stout.

355 ml bottle. From bierkompass.de.
Black colour with tiny tan had. 
Caramel, toffee malt with chocolate. mild coffee and lots of sweetness in aroma. Flavour is smokey dry hops, sweetish malt, dry malt and lots of dryness in aroma. Some tobacco in dry flavour.

(bottle 7/18/10). Black color. Huge tan head. Moderate chocolate and roasted malt/coffee aroma. Flavor of the same. Long duration. Light bitter finish. Slick texture. Soft to moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

I read a forum thread today about a whats better, GL Edmund Fitzgerald our Founders Porter.  This one is dark, nice head and some lacing.  Just like GLEF.  Smith and creamy, just like GLEF.  This one is less bitter and less porteresque, with the characteristics of a milk stout more than a porter.  Good beer, but I give the nod to Eddie Fitz.

Ok, so I had a bottle of this months ago. I was going to wait to get another one to rate it, but the hell with it. This is the best porter Ive had. It was pitch black with a slight mocha head. So much coffee and chocolate in there its crazy. Founders stouts are world-renowned of course, which I think contributes to why their porter kicks so much ass. The 6.5% ABV seals the deal. I drank this as a digestif, and couldnt have been happier with my choice. I like the Edmund Fitzgerald and Bells porter just fine, but Founders version to me is top of the class. Just plain awesome.
Initial smell and taste are of the 45 ibis. It smooths out into a roasted woody taste with a nice long aftertaste.
355ml bottle from jsprime. pours dark brown with a tan head. very roasty nose. complex flavour profile. not too drinkable for a porter. good, but not my fav porter.

Pours inky with just a touch of brown head. Nose is pleasant coffee, dark chocolate, and a generic but delightful light sugar. Flavor is rich and expands on the coffee and chocolate notes, with mild but supportive hops, brown sugar, and a light fruitiness. Finish is slightly sticky. Excellent porter.

A: The beer pours an almost black color with a finger of mocha colored head.

S: Roasted malts dominate the aroma.  There is an intense coffee aroma to the beer that is quite pleasant.  Lots of bitter, cocoa powder notes with a light sweetness of toffee.  A slight earthy character underneath it all.

T: Lots of roast and coffee flavors all the way through.  Perhaps just as much bitter dark chocolate and cocoa powder with a light hop bitterness.  Earthy tones, a bit of espresso, and some light caramel on the finish.

M: Medium bodied with a smooth, medium carbonation.

O: An outstanding porter, one of the best Ive had, come to think of it.

I dont find porters to be particularly interesting in the first place, and even within the subset there is not really much interesting about this brew. That said, theres nothing to complain about either, in fact its quite good. Looks nice, smells very nice, tastes pretty bitter as dark brews go but its good shit. Has a bit of the metallic aftertaste often found in brews of lower quality than I would expect from Founders, but its not a huge detriment. Surprisingly easy to drink, definitely not a meal in a bottle.
Black with a light compact head; tobacco and chocolate aromas; dry and oily palate, bitter finish.

Pour is just what I like; inky black and theres not even color around the edges. Its solid black with a thin head that doesnt last long. Inviting roasty smell. The roast carries on into the flavor, but it doesnt over power the smooth chocolate. The chocolate notes here are not as bitter as other porters. More of a milk chocolate. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth. Hops and toasted bread come out more as it warms. Long finish thats dry with just a hint of bitterness.

Nothing not to like about this one!

Extremely dark brown, almost black. Mouthfeel is very thick and creamy. Very full bodied. Taste is slightly chocolate, big roasted malt backbone, slightly sweet and balanced with a nice bitter finish. At 6.5% ABV you can have a few no problem. The aroma is full and rich. An amazing beer.

This beers smells of rich chocolate malts with a brush or smokiness.  It lingers with a bit of hop bite at the end.  It pours a jet black body with a bubblier head than expected which was brown in color.  It tastes of milk chocolate and a bit of smoke with some lingering hop bitterness.  This beer is very smooth almost like velvet and with an abv of 6.5% this beer could be a dangerous porter if too many are consumed, but damn delicious.

Could this be the perfect porter?  Everything you want out of the style is here.  A light roastyness and mild sweetness with notes of chocolate, coffee, caramel, and burnt malts.  I love this beer and always like having some around.
Beautiful chocolate milk colored head.   Aroma of lots of chocolate and a little coffee.   Flavor echos the aroma.  Its well balanced with dry and slightly bitter finish.   Yum!

Bottle - dark brown with a 4 fingers of chocolate brown head. Aroma is chocolate, toast, caramel. Fabulous nose! Leans mildly bitter. Palate is thick like pudding, and very smooth. Im getting chocolate on the finish with a little spiciness of alcohol. Very nice!

Finally got around to picking some of these up. Bottle pours into a pint glass a rich black, with only the slightest hints of brown when held to the light. Half-inch light tan head. Nose is very chocolatey, with some coffee and dark bread. Taste is...wow. More chocolate and coffee, heavily roasted malts, oatmeal stout smoothness. I literally cant believe how good this is.
Black pour, small brown head. Aroma is chocolate with roasty notes.mmm. Flavor is big milk chocolate with a roasty finish and chewy, full mouthfeel

Date: June 28, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: Founders, Grand Rapids, MI Appearance: Dark brown with medium amount of head Aroma: Coffee/Chocolate Flavor: consistent with aroma Other: A very good porter, but not quite as tasty as Bells version.
Pours black with little head.  Nice malt aroma, nice porter taste and good  balance.  Not as much else there as I remembered.

Bottle: Literally black, as usual, small stable lacy tanned head; leathery-fruity, not too toasty, nose with some herbal hops underneath; solid bitter-sweet flavour, soft and medium bodied; slightly lingering toasty-leathery finish, accompanied by a light acidity. Fine Porter.....

Basically black with a thick tan head that lingers and leaves some amazing lacing.  The aroma is mostly roasted coffee and a bit of caramel and plum.  The flavor is also strongly coffee with nice bitter dark chocolate notes, just a little burnt.  Very smooth and highly drinkable.
What a great porter!  Cofee, chocolate and just a touch of burnt malts. The palette is awsome.  Me likey.

Location/Date:Bottle on 6/30/2011
Appearance: Pours a nice opaque black. 
Aroma: Nice roasty aroma with some chocolate.
Taste: Light bitterness, heavy malt, chocolate, roast.
Palate:Medium body, medium finish.
Summary: A really good porter, one of my favorites.

Dark rich and sexy is a good description for this delicious porter.  Pours nice and dark with a tan head.  Great aroma.  Lots or roasted malt flavor with a hint of biterness.  Coffee and burnt chocolate.  Very good.

12oz bottle thanks to weihenweizen, pours black with a thin tan head, aroma is full of chocolate with a hint of coffee, the flavor has an awesome front end with coffee notes and finishes with dark chocolate, very flavorful all the way through, just a solid beer all the way around.

Savannah, Ga - Habersham Beverage Warehouse - 12 oz bottle. Coal black pour, thick mocha colored head, nce lacing. Fragrant aroma - plenty of dark chocolate, rich potting soil soil. Full-bodied flavor with lots of rich dark bakers chocolate, day old black coffee and some earthy black dirt. Mouthfeel is tick and chalky. Best porter I have had in ages.

pours nearly pitch black with little light showing through the sides of the glass. smallish beige head. aroma is toasted dark malts and chocolate. about as perfect as a porter can get without going crazy. deep dark chocolate and roasted malts show through well on the tongue. great lasting taste and semi dry and bitter finish.
Bottled sample.  Unreal beer.  Chocolate malt flavour. Great carbonation.  Would like to get my hands on more.

Creamy dark chocolate.  There are roast and coffee flavors, particularly in the finish, but this is a chocolatey treat.  One of my favorite porters and an all-round fantastic beer.  Its lush and thick on the plate for the abv.  Smell isnt terribly strong, but the taste comes through big.  Perfect malt sweetness for the beer.  This is a real treat and probably my favorite dark beer from Founders, so far.
Poured from a bottle. Appearance is a dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate, bitter black coffee, and slightly bitter influence of hops. Thick mouthfeel. Wonderful Porter.
Poured dark smelled weak tasted licorice chocolate great porter but not my favorite from founders friend brought from ny
I would have to agree that this is one of the nicest porters i have ever had. Very well balanced with not too much chocolate and no smoke or nonsense, just a fantastic porter.

Whole Foods Market, DC sixer ($11): Pours a near black color with a tan head that leaves a smattering of lace. Aroma is of chocolate, milk, milk chocolate, a little bit of creamy diner coffee, roasted malts, sex, a tiny bit of liqueur, and some other things that I like. This beer feels creamy and smooth... really. The chocolate flavors in this are done to a level of perfection. Coffee is very mild mild and takes second whistle to the chocolate. Oh, and there are hops, but they are ever so well-balanced with the rest. In the right conditions, there will be a slight booze note, but will merely serve to accentuate the flavors. Dank.

Near black, with a dark tan, one-finger head.  Not much lacing.

Smells of sweet, mellow chocolate, mellowed still by some caramel.  But mostly chocolate.  Beautiful.

Taste is very chocolatey as well but its a milk chocolate.  Very mellow.  Full bodied.  Dried by some caramel.  Bit of coffee roast to bitter it up.

Nicely blended.  The taste just keeps developing after each sip.  It encourages you to take time between sips to soak up all the layers.  Well done.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2nd ES/CS Beer Tasting. (thanks J.S.!). Quite much black colour with a small beigeish brown head. Aroma is ashes, liquorice, some mild roasted malts as well as mild notes of tobacco. Flavour is ashes, roasted mats, some chocolate and coffee along with mild liquorice and quite bitter finish.

Pours black with a chocolate brown thin head, which completely dissipates. Nose is lovely syrupy dark chocolate. Some mineral notes in there as well. Taste is silky chocolate, black coffee, some mineral notes to balance the sweetness, which is on the bitter side of sweet. Also some subtle flavours like tobacco. Brilliant stuff. Could drink this anytime, anyplace, anywhere.
Pour is black as you would expect with nearly no light tan head. Nose is of very milky chocolate and light coffee notes. Taste is the same, very very smooth. Great mouthfeel for the style.

Bottle from Bierkompass. Poured black color with a creamy brown head. Awesome chocolate malt and milk coffee aroma. Flavor is pretty much the same, sweet chocolate and roasted malt, just the right amount. Weak hoppy notes. Some tar/smoke in the dry finish. Flawless porter.
Aroma is chocolate and dark roasted malt.  Pours almost black with a rich tan head.  Taste is chocolate malty up front followed by bitter roast notes with a mild lingering sweetness/smokiness
Pours dark brown with notes of dark chocolate and coffee.  Coffee shows with deep and roasted grains.  You also get a nice fluid creaminess with a light milk chocolate ending.  WOW!
Dark brown nearly black color with tan head. Creamy scent with hints of mocha coffee. Porter with chocolate and coffee taste. Almost a Smokey finish. Nice dark Porter.

Im not sure what caused it, but Im madly in love with Founders Porter.  I believe this beer to be the worlds best, honest Porter, my ultimate go-to bottle.  Bittersweet and rich yet light on the palate, this brew drinks frighteningly easy, disappearing from the glass too quickly for rational thought to hold out much longer.  Java-encrusted roasted malts are followed by a hoppy bite that leads to a dry, dark chocolate fade.  Whenever I get the inevitable "Whats your favorite beer" question, this sixer provides a quick-n-easy answer.  (2/17/09)  NOTE:  No more Founders in SC.  Thanks to the brewery for giving our state a shot.  Maybe next time things will go better on our end.

12 oz bottle from Chevy Chase Wine & Spirits in Washington DC, served in a tulip. Pours deep black with a small tan head. The head fades slowly to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of lace.The nose has big chocolate and roasty notes, along with earth, smoke, and a hint of barnyard. The flavour is dry and roasty, with plenty of coffee, smoke and herbal hops. The finish is long, dry and roasty. On the palate, it is medium in body with a dry texture and soft carbonation. Overall, an excellent porter with a dry, roasty character and a nice earthy, herbal hop profile. I wish I had another bottle. 2011-05-15
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2011 Porter with notes of espresso and dark coffee or cacao beans. Quite a nice beer, although not as much depth as I was anticipating.

(bottle, 35.5cl) Black colour with a beige and short foamy head. Mildly sweet roast-malty aroma with notes of chocolate, leather and vanilla, accompanied by a spicy herbal hoppy touch. Roasty bitter and slightly sweet flavour, medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Leather and moderately roasty malty taste with notes of chocolate/cacao and shy salty notes towards the roast-bitter, subtle fruity and slightly spicy hoppy finish. 11.V.11

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2011 Six pack from Binneys Downers Grove IL:  Jet black with a thick light brown head. Aroma is milk chocolate. Flavor starts rich dark chocolate followed by a bakers chocolate bitterness and a bitter-sweet chocolate finish. Full body is rich and creamy with moderate carbonation. Awesome (Imperial chocolate) Porter.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thin brown head. Very nice coffee aroma with roasted malts and chocolate. Dry taste with bitter coffee and chocolate. Dry, roasty finish. Definitely up there as far as standard porters go.
Bottle This is one of my favorite beers. Wonderfully rich with chocolate and coffee. Very smooth beer. Just love it. =)
(Bottle 6/5-2011) Large brown lasting head, well rounded sexy porter.

08-APR-2011, bottle @Sonni, @Ulkløbben tasting, from "Fish & Beer".
Dark, dark brown with beige head.
Nose is coffee, just faint coffee and other roasted notes. 
Taste is very roasted with quite some hops.
Coffee, turns sweet espresso, ending bitter in a long bitter coffee taste.
Quite bitter with no alcohol(!)
I like porter. This is not the easiest one...

12oz bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee.  Pours a dark brown color with a tan head and minimal lacing.  Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, a little coffee.  Medium to heavy body on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet and bitter, roasty, chocolate, with a clean, bitter finish.  Excellent.

Pours a very dark brown with a medium milk chocolate head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, hay and grass. Tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, dark fruits, and hops. Medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation. Amazing porter.

Appearance: very dark brown, nearly opaque, tiny mocha head with a little lace.    Aroma: almost completely chocolate, with some coffee notes.   Taste: blast of acidic coffee up front, then bitter melted bakers chocolate.   Finish: chalky dry, with roasty burnt coffee and bittersweet dark chocolate lingering.   Notes: Pretty good porter, obviously.  I only had two bones to pick:  the blast of almost lactic acidity before the good roasty coffee and chocolate flavors kicked it, and the overly prickly palate.  Still a good porter, but I probably did it no favors by having a Great Lakes Edmund Fitzgerald immediately before.

Almost black pour with tan head. Aroma is chocolate and roasted coffee. The flavor is a smoky roast note complemented by a sweet chocolate character. Solid porter and something that I keep in my fridge regularly.
Tried this beer at the Casanova Beer Cave Festival (2011), had a potent coffee flavor.

Bottle. Pours black with a small beige head. Coffee beans and milk chocolate notes in the aroma. Coffee, a touch of chocolate, lots of caramel and a little smoke in the taste. Most of all coffee. Medium dry. Quite smooth and creamy texture. Well balanced. Elegant.

Tap. Darker tan head with curtains of lacing, dark mahogany color. Lots of roasted malt in the aroma along with dark chocolate.  Roasty qualities really dominate the flavor, bit of smoke, dark chocolate, and some dark fruits to round it out with a tiny bit of hop coming in. Drier finish, on a medium to heavier body. Nice.

Pitch black. A hughe light brown head that keeps growing and growing,... Roasted taste, lightly some sweetness. A bit hard to smell a thing.  Roasted coffee, slight chocolate. Good porter for sure. Could use a small boost, specially at the smell.

WOW. Got a 6 pack of this because I have had some good founders expereinces and I love porters. Super deep brown color to being black with a capachino tan head that lasts well with good lacing. Aroma is a great cocoa nibs with roasted malt, great for malt lover like me. The taste is a little bitter up front and roast coffee, ending with maybe some bitter berries. Even smooth texture with a full head on top and lighter body underneath with medium carbination. A top tier porter

Purchased at Archer Liquors in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a cool spring Sunday after a 5K run while watching the White Sox.  Appearance is beautiful, very rich dark brown with a prominent tan head.  Aroma has a strong chocolate presence with hints of cocoa, roasted malts, pretty sweet in nose, and with all those notes I would expect some sort of creaminess/lactose in the nose but its not there, which to me is somewhat interesting as I was expecting it.  But then again, this is a porter and not a stout, and Im glad that the lactose isnt present.  Taste is extremely good, not too heavy and not really that thin, finds a nice balance with good carbonation.  Hints of obvious chocolate but not dominant, along with a bit of roasted malts and (to me) a small hint of coffee in the mix.  It rounds those things very well where each ingredient can be detected but not dominant.  Has an outstanding drink ability to it as well, I feel like I can easily drink multiple in a row, next time Ive got to get a 6 pack instead of a single bottle.  For a traditional true porter that isnt enhanced by additional ingredients (i.e. coconut, smoked malts, etc) I cant think of a better one.  Very very good stuff.

12 oz Bottle.  Pours a solid black color with medium, beige head.  Aroma is sweet and roasted malts with coffee and some toffee.  Taste is amazingly delicate and complex with dark chocolate and coffee dominant but notes of roasted grains.  The real strength of this beer is its hop profile - perfectly balanced with the malty sweetness.  Pleasant hop grassy and spicy hop notes thats not overly bitter.  Great on the palate with a nice medium body and creamy texture.  Amazing beer.

This has to be my favorite porter and one of my favorite Founders beers and I was drawn to their IPAs. In fact Im not a huge fan of porters but think thats wrong! Roasted malts with some chocolate tones and a sweetness which is well balanced by a bitter backdrop. In that backdrop is that slightly smoky rich ashy flavor which I dig in porters but usually they dont seem to pack enough flavor in. This one delivers!

0.355l bottle @ Baran, Bergen. Pours a pitch-black body with a dense creamy tanned head leaving nice big lacings. Aroma is roasted sweetness, woody, cigar, deep milk chocolate a tan smoky and also reminds me a bit of basement. Body is medium to full and the carbonation is average. Strong and really tasty with big flavors. Notes of cocoa, dark berries, grill-burned toast and vanilla with a really suitable hopy and bitter finish. Ends of with a longlasting fizzing chocolate aftertaste. A truly solid porter.

Bottle. Oily black pour with a tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, hazlenut, roasted malt, earthy hops, toffee and coffee. Flavors of rich dark chocolate, booze soaked dark fruits, coffee, caramel, bitter/earthy undertones. Thick body, rich/roasty/bittersweet and satisfying throughout with a bitter/roast finish. Overall, there are two porters that tie for my favorite and they are both from MI: this and Darkhorse Special Black Bier. They both kind of go beyond of what I usually get from this style. This is one amazing brew, theres lots of beers double in strength that fail to capture its focus and flavor.

Appearance: Opaque black body with no red whatsoever. Forms a thick, brown, creamy/frothy head which retains very well and leaves pretty lacing on the glass throughout.Smell: Roasted barley, dairy, a hint of alcohol. Smell seems to indicate it will be a bitter, dry beer.Taste: I wish all porters were as flavorful as Founders! This is that rare beer that is hearty and robust and still manages to retain the qualities of a porter. The palate is, for lack of a better decription, "typical" porter with the toasted malt, a milky/dairy sweetness across the middle, and slight milk chocolate on the finish. Its not a particularly bitter or dry beer as is common with stouts, so there is next to no coffee flavor or bitterness here. The finish is surprisingly clean, with a hint of confectionary sweetness (frankly, I wouldnt have minded some aftertaste here).Mouthfeel: Silky smooth and soft. It doesnt coat the entire mouth the way an imperial stout would, but definitely covers the tongue from start to finish. Drinkability: While not the tastiest beer Ive ever had, Founders Porter is one of the most quaffable. Between the flavorful, but tame palate, gentle mouthfeel and smooth finish its difficult to not throw this beer down as if it were a shot. Its a fun beer to savor. The 6.5% ABV feels right, but might be a tad higher than would be preferred from a porter as I would love to session this but think Id get overwhelmed quickly.Overall, the best porter Ive ever had and an excellent beer in its own right.

NOTE: Watch the video version of this review at:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mGtkTVfrDXc

(Bottle, Bishops Arms North, Stockholm) Black colour with frothy, pale brown head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of creamy chocolate, cocoa and coffee with milk. Malty, roasted taste with creamy chocolate, coffee, dark bread and a smooth cocoa bitterness in the finish. Slightly more than medium body, with a touch of dark fruit sweetness. Tasty and well balanced porter. Very nice.

So, I saw this on the menuand thought, "Man, Im not really in the mood for a porter, but Ive wanted to try this for a while. What to do?" Try it, obviously. Smooth and rich, with a good mix of tradtional porter flavors, plus maybe a hint of spruce? maybe? Well made. Very tasty.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2012 Bottle @ home. Very dark brown appearance with a creamy, dark brown head. Roasted, espresso, dark chocolate, thick malty nose. Thick, creamy, a bit syrupy mouth feel. Roasted, dark chocolate, light vanilla, light to medium espresso dark malty flavor. A little bitter aftertaste along with espresso and chocolate. Excellent Porter!

Black with a medium brown head. Aroma is sweet, hard roasted malt, coffee, a little vanilla and moderate dusty hoppiness. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Soft and smooth. Fantastic porter that suited my casserole dinner perfectly. 030411

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 010411.
Black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt and sweetness. Flavor with chocolate and coffee balanced to caramel and spices.

12oz bottle. Poured a dark color with a off-white/near tan head. Aroma was roasted notes, vanilla, chocolates, anise notes, coffee definitely. Woah! Flavor was rich and roasted malts, chocolate. Great beer!

Bottle from Breeze Thru.  Pours an opaque black with brown chocolate milk head.  Aroma is roasted malts, perhaps a bit burnt?? plus caramel, coffee and chocolate with a slightly salty addition (nuts? soy sauce?).  Taste is bittersweet chocolate, caramel, some coffee, some tartness.  Finishes super smoothly bittersweet and somewhat thick with a touch of alcohol in the end.  This offering won our porter taste test back a year or so ago and it is easy to see why.

On tap at Haymarket into a 4oz tasting glass, first beer of the night, a good one for sure...Dark pour for porter, a nice black color with a really nice dark tan head that has good retention and lacing...The aroma is unique, lots of coffee but with a bite of hops, nuts and chocolate come through as well, slightly acetone note. I like this...The taste matches the aroma a coffee porter with some hops, yummy and balanced, and drinkable. This is a winner.

Bottle 355ml @ Schouskjelleren Mikrobryggeri, Oslo
Pours black with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long chocloate finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Indeed a very rich beer with smooth chocolate, dried fruits and some coffee. Creamy mouthfeel and long, silky but bitter aftertaste.

12oz bottle purchased on 2/26/11 one day after it arrived at the store. Poured into a Sam Adams Perfect Pint Glass at cellar temperature (about 55 degrees.)

Pour reveals a very dark brown beer with a perfect tan head which dissipates to thin lacing which sticks to the edge of the glass from beginning to end (which didnt take long.)

Aroma of deep dark toasted malts. I smell chocolate milk. A hint of mocha. This is what I want to smell when I pour a porter.

Rich creamy malt flavor engulfs my whole palate. finish of semi-sweet chocolate and bitterness work together beautifully. A little coffee flavor too. Toasted raw barley flavor with the alcohol at the very end. Great balance of flavors.

Mouthfeel is rich and creamy. Smooth with a medium carbonation that a porter should have.

Drinkable? Hell yea! Smooth as silk. Didnt take long for me to get through this one. Could hardly wait for each next sip.

This is a perfect porter. Ill be buying another six pack asap.

Bottle. Pours a nice black color with some reddish notes in the bottom of the glass, and a frothy tan head. Aroma is very sweet with vanilla and chocolate notes, but also some heavily roasted malts and faint coffee. The flavor isnt as sweet as the aroma indicates at all. I get alot of roasted and burnt malts along with coffee with peat and charocal, whilst I only get hints of the chocolate (more of a cocoa to be honest) and vanilla. The body is medium with a creamy mouthfeel. Overall a great Porter, even though the aroma kind of fools you :P

Dark solid pour. Very balanced between the chocolate and coffees. If you have never had a Porter or you really like Porters than this is a winner. Just an all around good beer. Will continue to drink it.

Definite chocolate and coffee notes on the nose. Pours black with almost no head. Very thick mouthfeel. The taste has a bunch of different things going on none of which I can identify but they cOmbine to make a big beer that lingers for entire senatorial terms.

Deep brown with light, creamy, tan head.  Smooth roasted coffee beans, sweet caramel, toffee, dark fruit.  Flavor is roast crescendo with just a touch of sweetness.  Finishes residual roast, coffee, unsweetened chocolate.  Somewhat acidic.  Very good, straight-forward porter with no surprises.  Fairly complex profile.  Would tend to lean towards Darkhorses Special Reserve Black.

(bottle - 12 oz) Dark black pour with a huge amount of bubbly tan foam. Heavy chocolate and mild roast coffee in the aroma. Chocolate and a very mild roast begins the flavor and then intensifies. Smooth and roasty through the body and into the middle with a nice and bitter aftertaste. The heavy carbonation really enhances the body.

Pours black as night with a huge fluffy longlived head leaving pretty lace. Aoma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, tar, fruits and fresh grass. Fullbodied mouthfeel. Flavor is fruity, tar, meaty, peaty, perry and very tart; excellent. Fullbodied tar palate. Dry tart longlived and well balanced finish. So enjoyable.

Bottle [12oz] shared with HogTownHarry & garthicus -- c/o HogTownHarry. Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with an average size diminishing creamy light-brown head. Nice aroma of roasted malt and coffee along with light leafy hops and chocolate. Flavour, which is even better, of roasted malt, coffee, light hops, some light lactic notes and a good amount of chocolate and a nice dry, roasty bitter finish. Medium to full bodied. A great Porter, well done!
Bottle. Black with medium beige head. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, bitter and coffee.

Off tap at Bar louie last night 20 oz pour.  deep rich and sexy indeed.  Nice roast, carmel, chocolate, big coffee but not too over-whelming, crisp developing awesome finish.  quite the treat on tap--dont remember it being this good from bottle.
Bottle from Vinens Verden. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, lots of licorice, chocolate, coffee and hops. Nice dry finish.
Bottle 355ml. Pours almost pitch black with brown head.  Aroma is dark chocolate,  cocoa, coffee. Taste is medium sweet,  light bitter. Full body,  oily,  average carbonation.

Tumman ruskea, lähes musta porter. Niukka, beige vaahto. Tuoksussa on suklaata, kahvia ja paahtunutta mallasta. Maussa on suklaata, kahvia, paahtuneisuutta ja tummaa, kuivaa hedelmäisyyttä. Keskirunsas ja hieman liukas olut. Portereiden kärkipäässä.

Pours black with a slight nut brown hue in the edges with a nice light brown head. Aroma is full of well-rounded roast, liquorice, almost vanilla, doughy yeast notes, notes of coffee and slight vegetal. Taste has a lot of liquorice and still well-rounded roast. Cocoa, coffee, almonds and bready malts. Still a vegetal notes. Quite a large hop presence as well, bitter in the after taste. Carbonation is high, but it suites the beer well. A really good porter!
Poured from 12oz bottle from Manny57.  Pours dark brown almost black with nice amount of tan head.  Aroma is bitter coffee, brown sugar and roasted malts.  Taste is similar to nose.

Bottle. The Rover, Göteborg. Black colour with a beige head. Malty, roasted, chocolate and licorice aroma. Flavor of roasted malt, licorice, coffee and a light fruitiness. Strong carbonation and a bit too light body that lowers the score for this beer. Maybe this bottle was slightly off?

Pours pitch black and completely opaque without even the slightest hint of lighter color when held to a light and a one finger beige head that quickly fades into a lasting ring. Sporadic spots of lace left behind.

Nice roasted malt aroma with hints of bittersweet dark chocolate, oatmeal, toffee and roasted coffee/espresso bean. Smokey but not acrid or burnt smelling with subtle lactic/cream and even some hazelnut. Beautiful roasted coffee in the nose that isnt overly powerful, burnt or stale. Smells great!

Chewy medium body with lots of roasted malt, slight hops, sweet chocolate and a lingering dry finish. Deep roasted coffee/espresso bean flavor along with hints of chocolate, toffee and oatmeal. A bit more acrid/burnt tasting than the aroma suggested with bittersweet dark chocolate, toffee, oatmeal and nut. Subtle bitter dry hops toward the end of the palate with a dry finish. A bit too roasted for my preference with bitterness lingering throughout but still pretty drinkable with a nice lactic creamy flavor mid-palate that gives balance and adds to the mouthfeel. It could use a bit of sweetness to round things out but overall this is a very good representation of the style.

bottle from ølbutikken
very dark brown, settles black, smooth light brown head.
aroma of roasted malts, flowery and faint sourish hops,  aroma is not *that* strong, i have to struggle a bit to descipher the nuances.
flavor is chocolate, roasted malts, dry mild hoppy balance. quite fresh. palate is very smooth. aftertaste is sweet yet a little dry. It tastes a bit like those stouts that contain oatmeal, sweet and smooth. Also reminds me of the milky sweetness ive seen in some milk stouts.
Very easy to drink, goes down like chocolate milk.
Draft at 4th ave pub. . Pours dark black. Smeels and tasyes of coffee, cocolate and almonds. Ab is not over bearing likr imperial stouts but is has the same consistency. Very good. In fact...awesome
Bottle (355 ml) from Bierkompass.de. Black with a small beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma with coffee and salmiak. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.
Very rich roasted malty flavor, very smooth and creamy. One of the best porters hands down!

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Pours black with a brown head. The Aroma is roasted with roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, some liquorice and light smoke. Taste has the same notes and add some more hoppy notes in the end. Balanced!

Bottle at Bar&Cigar.
Dark black with a full brown head, really good looking! Heavenly aroma of sweet malt, chocolate, vanilla, Fruity taste with licorice and more chocolate. Kind of roasty as well, and good bitterness. I find the overall feel a bit thin, but its a great beer, as expected from Founders!

Pours a really dark brown almost black color with a creamy mocha head that sticks around for a while. Smells of chocolate, roast, a touch of alcohol. Smells almost like a stout. Taste is creamy roasty chocolate. Has a touch of hops and alcohol burn in the finish but leaves you salivating for more of its roasty goodness. Very Creamy mouthfeel, crisp carbonation, thick body. Great brew! Could be a stout could be a porter, frankly I dont care Ive just got to get me some more. One of the best porters ever.

Black. Has a light brown head, mostly lasting. Sweet aroma, notes of coffee, dark chocolate and laqurice. But not much though. Flavor starts heavy sweet, lots of notes, laqurice, faint notes of blood, iron.  Dry texture, syrupy too, soft carbonation.
engelsk lakrids aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice lakrids finish.

Bottle pours deep brown/black with a beige head.  Aroma smells of chocolate, coffee, and burnt marshmallow. Flavor shows the same with an additional hint of vanilla and fudge.  Overall body is moderate to full, and finishes with dark chocolate bitterness.

Thanks to HogTownHarry. Appearance: Gorgeous , pitch black, thick tan head. Aroma: Peat, malt, smoke, vanilla, almost a strawberry tone to it too. Flavour: Milky, quite a lot of turf/peat, toffee, sticky, a little boozy, beautiful chocolate milk with coffeeness to it. Delicious.

Big and dark brown, with a milk chocolate head, this thing checks in a little heavier than most, at 6.5 percent ABV. Theres a full rounded mouthfeel and excellent head retention, indicating a nice protein body, with a generous and completely balanced hop finish.

Although not as well known as many of their offerings, this is an above average porter, an excellent winter warmer, and one well worth seeking out.

Serving type: bottle

Bottle from Beermerchants.com. Poured like a glass of texas tea, with a diminishing beige head. Appealing snout with dark fruit, coffee, dark chocolate burnt toast and malts protruding. Thickish mouthfeel. Flavour was roasted malt laden with yet more dark choc and coffee and a hint of molasses. Some well placed hoppage gave good balance to proceedings. Extremely well proportioned. A quality porter to bring up my 1200th rate.

Bottle. Very dark brown  almost black, small to average, and fully diminishing dark brown head. Moderate malty, lightly sweetish aroma, lots of roasted malt and some coffee with vanilla. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, lots of roasted malt, some coffee with light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish, roasted malt, some coffee and hoppyness. Nice dryish - roasted porter, some coffee in the flavor.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Blck colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Roasted and ok coffee and chocolate notes. Average moderate bitter flavor. Some coffee and chocolate notes. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Good but not great.

330ml bottle from Bierkompass

Pours black with a nice brown head. Aroma and taste have hints of roastness. Nice, smooth and long lasting finish.

355 ml bottle.
Pours a black colour with a beige, small, creamy head. Aroma of pleasant roasted malts and chocolate. Flavour of smooth chocolate malts with roastiness, mild hops and coffee. Medium bodied with a very rich and smooth mouthfeel. Dry and fruity finish. A very pleasant porter.

bottle. aromas of chocoalte marshmallows, coffee, and vanilla.  taste follows, but with additions of chocolate malts, nutmeg, and burnt coffee.  on the palate it is rich and creamy, followed by a smooth finish characteristic of a fine porter.  this is spot on, and there is no question this is rated as high as it is.  killer!

The Platonic Ideal of a porter (or as close as one can get).  Pours a red-tinted dark-as-night Mahogany capped with a half-inch of latte-foam colored head.  The bouquet is nearly a mirror-image of the taste to come:  chocolate and coffee and roasted goodness.  The head eventually subsides into a high-gravity Belgian lace.

The liquor has a full and silky mouth feel, a bitter-sweet concentration of that bouquet that hit your nose after the pour.  The malt is dark; the intensity is high and the finish is pleasingly long.  What I like here additionally is the muscular hops hiding just behind the roasted malts.  Some porters lack this balance; Founders does not.  Lovely brew.

Dark pour with a tan head, quicky fading. A ton of rich and creamy coffee. Id say that the bottle says it all....dark, rich and sexy. Extremely smooth. Its like drinking a dark chocolate shake with just the right amount of sugar to make it palatable. Rich barley malt and cocoa powder. A really fantastic beer.
Thats a good porter. Its not a stout - but its not a dark colored brown ale. Its a porter. Rich and complex. Roasty.... sure, roasty. Roasty, toasty, delicious the mosty - no need to boasty.
Bottled from Bierkompass. Dark, almost black color with almost no head. Aroma, roasted coffee. Taste, dark chocolate, dark fruits. Dry coffee finish. Excellent porter.
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of roasted malt, liqurice, chocolate, bitter and coffee. A flavor of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, minerals, soy sauce and bitter finish.
Black body, dark brown huge creamy head. Malty, roasted and strong coffee aroma. Overwhelming syrupy full palate. Dark bitter chocolate, mousse and again very potent coffee flavour. Wow.

Black and thick pour with little head.  who-boy, lovely aroma.  Roasted malts, dark, ripe fruits, chocolate, molasses, earthy, milk, light vanilla.  Medium, full body with nice tiny dancing carbonation.  Flavor is packed full of those delicious roasted and chocolate malts, light burnt malt, a touch of molasses, and faint vanilla.  Great porter.  A real winner.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2011 355ml. Lumpy, 100% pitch with an uneven, shrinking manila head haloed with white- an odd effect Ive never seen before. Aromas lush, raisiny high cocoa chocolate melted on burnt toast, blackcurrant, blueberry; some strawberry and vanilla tones peeping through the blackness. Huge, mouth-filing palate like a rich chocolate mousse; flavour all about luxuriously bitter, high cocoa chocolate but with a lovely, softening streak of blackcurrant and plum running under it. Still-smoking charcoal, lemon dabbed sparingly on barely edible, burnt (English) pancakes. Deep, inky, highly drinkable stuff with a fullness and pungency leaning towards the imperial even at 6.5%. Impressive.

Human eyes were not meant to penetrate the stygian blackness of this eldrich concoction. If not attenuated by a pale corpselike head of pillowy foam, that abysmal darkness would drive mortal man mad. Complex congeries of roasted coffee, caramel, and chocolate conspire to bewitch the mind. Just a touch bitter on the finish.

Bottle from beermerchants.com A black coloured pour with a small beige head. Pleasing roasty, coffee aroma. Tastes of chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, dark fruit, very rich. A top quality porter from one of my favourite breweries.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2013 going from memory - trade with fopa - thanks man!  doesnt get much better; will find and have many more..
Had again 04/13 - dropped from 4.4 to 4.  will try one more time, but this bottle wasnt nearly as good as I remembered; had a acidic burn toward end...
Just as described on the label: dark, rich, and yes, sexy. This porter has nice roast, chocolate, and coffee.
Bottle 355ml. Color deep brown to black with red fires and medium brown head. Aroma chocolate, coffee, roasted. Taste sweet, chocolate, coffee, spicy.
Dark appearance with a medium head. Flavor changes as the beer warms. It initially has coffee, alcohol, cherry,  and dark chocolates which then change to a milder chocolate. Very smooth.

Bottle 355 ml from www.erzbierschof.ch. Deep brown to black, brown foam, unctuous. Scent and taste of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee marc, dark fruits. Top of the range with hints of mocha, toffy, raisin, perhaps Xeres. Quite of chocolate sweetness and its bitterness, creamy and rich.

Bottle poured into a snifter.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aromas of chocolate and roasty malts.  Initial taste has some bitterness.  Lots of chocolate flavors come out.  The sweetness of the malts is well balanced as a bitter hop flavor is also noticeable throughout.  The body is full.  The beer is very drinkable with only 6.5% ABV but no sacrifice in flavor.

Tasted on tap at the brewpub. Second best beer of the night, only second to Nemesis. Pours back with nice thick tan head.  Nose of smoke and liquorice. Thick body, flavour of roasty malt, liquorice. Finish is bitter and smooth.

12oz twist off bottle dated 1/28/09.  Ive had this bottle since fresh, in the fridge.  Pretty sure mreusch sent it my way, thanks Matt.   Pours a deep rich dark black with heavier body for a stout and smaller tight even deep tan head.  Rich and beautifully balanced nose of roasty, nutted, chocolate malt with noticable coffee hints...perfect.  Tight small carb with great body that gives this beer a fully, almost creamy, feel.  Lightly bitter and roasty up front, moves into some faint chocolate and coffee bittering.  The finish remains bitter and full of roasty coffee and bitter chocolate.  Very balanced and full o flavor.  I need to have more of this.

Rich dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, coffee, & some caramel/toffee; Flavor of roasted malt, burnt coffee, caramel, chocolate, and some dark fruit; Finish is slightly bitter with some smoke; Nicely balanced & complex; Overall, delicious porter.

Pours a deep, dark brown with no real head to speak of,  Aroma is of dark, roasted malts, a hint of coffee and chocolate.    The flavor follows this with just a touch of a bitter finish.  This is a very good brew, and almost stout-ish.

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL. This really is the standard in which all non-imperial porters should be compared. A great nose with great balance. Rich and creamy smooth, yet superbly hopped. The pour was pretty as well. A big creamy, dark cream colored head, spotted lacing, a medium-thick appearance, and dark black-brown in color. The notes in aroma and flavor compliment each other almost perfectly. Rich cocoa, effervescent coffee, caramel malts, and backing earthy hop. Start to finish, this one is quite simple, though so well done.

Bottle ay Bishops arms Örebro, 2010-12-23
The bartender was friendly to get me a room temp. sample.
AR: rich roastd coffey aroma, some choclate and a bit nuttyness
AP: pitch black with a reddish tone, 5 cm high wee bubbly = fizzy, dark beige head - slowly diminishing
F: loads of carbonation, nich choclate but wee coffeyness - the fizzyness destroyed this porter!

Bottle from Beer Bistro in Chicago.  Pours a rich dark reddish brown; thin head...wonderful smooth taste...almost too smooth to be a porter.  Sweet but not so much to distract.  Definitely a wonderful example of how good a porter can be...almost enough to make you enjoy winter.

Det här är den perfekta portern. Kraftig, kärv, fyllig, fruktig, rund och len. Allt finns där som ska finnas. Fruktig choklad, mörk frukt, kaffe. Inte för mycket av något, inte så stark, och ganska snäll beska, men de andra smakerna är så stora att den inte saknas.

Bottle. Pours a clear and dark brown beer with a beige/light brown head. The aroma is malt and notes of fruit. The flavor is close to the nose with some additional roasted notes. The palate is sweetness, roasted and with a high level of carbonation. Overall a really good beer.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours black with a finger thick, creamy, brown head. the liquid laces dark brown on the edge of the glass. Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts aromas fills the nose. Roasted bitter and choclate sweet flavors. Full bodied and smooth with a gentle carbonation. Dry finish with the roasted notes lingering.
Pours dark brown with a cafe latte colored head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and liquorish. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. A litle to high carbonation.

Pitch black pour with a thin bubbly head. Good amount of lacing around the rim of the glass. Has a creamy coffee aroma, but comes out much more in the flavor. Also a good amount of dark chocolate in the flavor. Very well balanced and enjoyable.

Second beer in a mini Porter tasting:  Founders Porter poured into english pint glass.    Dark thick pour.  Very dark brown head.  Thicker, darker and smokier than the GLEFP.  Sweet aroma of chocolate, coffee, dark malt, vanilla with some smoke.  Smooth and creamy, taste of roasted malt, molasses, chocolate, coffee.  Very different than GLEFP, not as drinkable but a more creamy full mouthfeel.  Exceptional.

350ml bottle at Håndverkerstuene. Pours a relatively solid amount of bubbly, fawn coloured head over a plain black body. Mid-sweet aroma of dark, earthy malts, slightly roasted. Roasted dark malts to the start developing into a rounded taste profile of smooth chocolate offset by bitter coffee grounds. Well rounded finish. Very pleasant (Oslo, 26.11.2010).
Smooth, dark, rich, malty, chocolaty, hoppy. Flavor is mellow, yet rich and complex. Since it is a porter, it isnt quite as thick as a stout. Very solid offering from Founders.

Local Option Chi town. Pours with a dark chocolate hue with a tan hue. Beautiful aroma of coffee beans. Taste follow suits with malty blend of burnt coffee and sweet chocolate. Taste mellows a little to quick for me, but its a porter not a stout. I say that because last weekend was a Founders Breakfasts Stout party and this beer starts down that road then stops.

Thanks to jampics2 for sending a bottle of this my way.

A: Pours a very dark brown with a beautiful tan head and plenty of lacing as it makes its way down.

S: Loads of roasted malt alongside a fair amount of chocolate.

T: Roast and sweet malt combine together with chocolate and hints of coffee.

M: Very nice. A bit dry; nice and full.

D: One of the better porters that Ive had; I would expect nothing less from Founders.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-07-2010

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. A thick, frothy caramel head resides elegantly over the otherwise black body. A sniff detects roasted malts, milk chocolate, hints of coffee and black berries. Taste is not far behind; mocha, milk chocolate again, hints of roastiness and berries. Extremely, perhaps profoundly, well-toned. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy and very pleasant. I agree to what the masses preach: dont think a porter gets much better than this. Rock solid.

Three words: Bold, Flavorful Yummy!  Excellent on the nose. Taste is the flavor of strong roasted coffee, vanilla bean, dark fruit and chocolate malt. A ton of sweetness and maltiness. But the hops help balance out the sweetness making it a very smooth drinker.  This brew has complexity with the hops and roasted malt characteristics.  Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation. Smooth, decadent creaminess to the mouthfeel. This could be an after dinner drink or just a nice sipper on a cold winter night. Outstanding!
Aroma is strongly chocolate. The taste is good, but overrated in my opinion. It is slightly bitter with chocolate upfront and an almost smokey aftertaste.

12 oz bottle: dark brown with coppery edges.  Deep, roasted barley aroma...edging towards to the charred carbon end.  Subtle chocolate milk and cherry pits.  Full, robust mouthfeel: like drinking chilled, liquid dark chocolate that has hints of carbonation.  Burnt grape-nuts after taste with a light lingering bitterness.  Very sold, sessionable porter.

First Snowfall of the Season tasting in Odense. Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma of chocolate and toffee with hints of coffee and licorice. The flavour is certainly dark, but not burned at all - beautiful. Fresh ground coffee, dark chocolate and a full body, with just a little roasty note in the finish

Bottle @ Local Tasting, Nov 2010. Pours black with a large brown head and lacings. Nose is roasted bitter coffee. Flavor adds some smooth chocolate. Bitter and roasted. Smooth and full bodied. Carbonation level is a tad too high. Good.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with pillowing tan head. Great carbonation. Nose of milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla bean, and molasses.  Thin mouthfeel but that seems par for the style. Taste of bitter chocolate, espresso, smoke, roasted nuts and malt. Slightly bitter on the finish.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2011 Stuff is great, just great...has a lot of mouthfeel for a regular strength porter and a lot of coffee.  Pours dark, slow and smooth, lots of hop and coffee in the hose and through the palate.  Full and satisfying finish.

Bottle sampled at Sorbon, Bromma, Sweden. Pours out in dark brown appearance with a rich sticky tan-coloured head. Rich harmonious aroma of roasted malts, luxury chocolate, coffee beans, mild sweet licorice, roasted nuts and spicy hops. Medium-bodied with strong yet elegant notes of mocha, roasted malts, coffee, milky chocolate with undertone of nuts and mild resin. Long balanced finish of bittersweet chocolate, well-roasted coffee, nuts and mild anise. Top notch porter, this.

Bottle at Beer Temple. Nice dark brown body with mocha head. Nose is lots of chocolate and coffee. Quite roasty and inviting. Taste is also of malts, chocolate, dark fruits. Very roasty and most enjoyable. Hats off.

Bottle. Black with a medium-sized light brown head. Aroma: cream, coffee. Taste: toffee, chocolate, coffee, cream, coffee liqueur, some fruiti and berries, with a dark chocolate bitterness. Full and creamy mouthfeel. A really tasty porter.

Thanks to RBlaszak for sending this beer as an extra. This had been on my wants for a long time.

The beer pours a very dark brown to black color with a tan head. The aroma is milk chocolate, coffee and some roasted malt. The chocolate is dominant. 

The flavor is heavy on the roasted malt and bitter dark chocolate. The malt is very heavily roasted and has some burnt qualities to it. 

Creamy, medium to thick mouthfeel and low to medium carbonation. 

An excellent porter. One of the best that I have had.

Big dark brown head. Opaque black body. Roasty chocolatey dusty aroma with alcoholic nutty notes. Dry-sweet roasty chocolate and citrus taste with burnt wooden notes. Mid-to-full body. Mild, dusty mouthfeel. Dry roasty chocolate and burnt grain aftertaste with coffee and roasted rice notes. Nice, complex, full of flavour, and highly drinkable. (0.355l bottle, Håndverkerstuene, Oslo.)
Near black with a light brown head. Malty, chocolate aromas. The flavors were very even, bitterness lighter than expected. No unexpected aftertaste, stays the same throughout. Medium body.

Somehow I had missed this one up to now but now I have tried it both on tap and in bottle.  Both are similar which is good because this is a great beer.   Dark almost black.  Roasted malts in both aroma and taste.  Balanced with a bit of hops and sweetness.  Full flavored but not a thick mouthful.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2014 First ratingBottled at Haket, Göteborg, on November 11, 2010Thanks to a friend for the tasteBlack color, dark brown head. Fruity, un-ripe red berries scent, also cinnamon. Fruity, malty, coffee taste. Roasted and chocolate aftertaste, also grainy. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.7/4/7/4/14=3.6RerateBottle thanks to (non-ratebeer) Matt/Nekrobarr! Sampled on December 2, 2012.Black color, big tan head. Sweet, malty, coffee taste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Coffee aftertaste. Sweet, roasted scent.6/4/7/4/13=3.4355 ml bottle from Systembolaget in Mölndal, sampled on August 4, 2014.Very dark brown to black color, smallish brown head, some lacing left on the glass. Sweet, malty, chocolate, cocoa, roasted, some berries scent. Sweet, chocolate, grainy taste. Grainy, roasted, dry aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, dry grainy medium high bitterness.8/3/7/4/15=3.7

Bottle.
Pours black with a firm brown head.
Rather sweet chocolate aroma. Taste of chocolate, coffe and rosted (slightly burnt) malt.

Bottle from Beermerchants.com. Black pour with a beige head. Good earthy nose. Plenty of chocolate and caramel to keep you occupied. Chocolate, roasted malts and coffee flavours with a slightly nutty taste. Classic porter flavours. Good stuff.
Bottle.  Pours dark black with a thin creamy head.  Aroma of licorice; flavor of licorice, chocolate, hints of coffee, and a noticeable hop bitterness.  A damn near perfect beer.

12 oz bottle courtesy of manny57. Thanks. Pours a dark brown color with a medium l tan head that soon recedes leaving some minor lacing. The aroma is rich with chocolate, dark roasted malts and earth. The flavor is similar with multi-layered chocolates, black walnuts,  and earthy hops. The palate is smooth and creamy with soft carbonation. The finish is long and dry. Overall: A very tasty brew, but its a crime to put it in such a small bottle.

Bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma of light roasted malts and some chocolate. Taste is dry, roasted malts, with some coffe and chocolate. Ends with a good hoppy bitterness.

On tap at local option : pour is a very dark brown with nice tan head. Nice retention and lacing here-  light roast character in the aroma-  mouthfeel is somewhere in the middle as expected. This beer is creamy and robust - fantastic marriage of chocolate malts and hops here. Best porter Ive sampled thus far
Soft but rich porter. Aroma of bitter chocolate and roasted malt. Slightly dry finish.

Bottle. Black pour with a slight ruby shine, medium brown head. Aroma is very roasty and dry. Strong liquorice, chocolate and heavy-duty coffee are also apparent. There are also notes of rope and earth, as well as yeast. A very powerful aroma. Taste is equally powerful, but less complex. It has lots of roast and a large bitterness, but not a whole lot of other subtleties. It is well-hopped and actually quite fresh and sparkly on the palate. Very nice..

Bottle, beermerchants.com. Jet black with a deep tan head. Coffee and chocolate very prominent, whisky creeps in and the finish is long, lingering and blackcurrant makes an appearance, with hops becoming noticeable right at the end. A cracker.

On tap at Founders. Pours a rich black with a thin brown head. Coffee, toasted malt, and burnt sugar aromas give way to coffee and molasses flavors as the beer warms. Sits a bit heavy on the back of the tongue, but nice and creamy.

Draught at local option. Solid black with a big tan head. Sharp roasted aroma with Green bellpepper. Dry and well attenuated with the same sharp green pepper flavor. No detectable hops bnot anwhole lot of malt going on. Sharp phenolics. Not a fan.

Shared with Leafs93 for his 30th.  Pours a dark black color with an off-white head.  Has a roasty aroma with some hints of chocolate.  Has a sweet roasty taste with some gentle bitters and a nice coffee spice.  Mouthfeel is thin to medium.  Great porter.
Pours black with small tan head.  Aroma is roasty caramel, bread, dark chocolate and hint of coffee.  Taste is sweet carmel with a sticky finish.  Not to heavy and not to light, excellent.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2010 Bottle.  Pours oh so dark with a creamy medium-sized tan head.  Aroma and flavor are wonderfully complex:  bitter and milk chocolate, a bit of coffee, some licorice, a touch of bitterness (mostly from the roast), some aromatic hops.  Understated sweetness.  Finishes dry.  Creamy mouthfeel.  One to savor.

Nice aroma of chocolate and roast.  Pours an opaque black, with just a touch of light tan head.  Nice rich roasted flavors start this off, with notes of chocolate and coffee.  Long roasted finish with this one.  This is quite a tasty porter, and one Ill be picking up more of during this autumn.

Bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 6.5%, 45 IBUs. Pitch black colour, big and lasting brown head. Moderate roasty aroma, notes of dark chocolate and coffee. The flavour is roasty and quite dry, with a hint of acidity. Notes of coffee and ashes. Roasty and hoppy bitterness in the afteraste.

Bottle @ City Pub Göteborg: Black colour, creamy brown head. Aroma is Dark choclate, coffee, malty and citric. Flavor is dominated of dark choclate, and Coffee, mixed with nice fruitynes, some raisins too. Medium body and a thin to medium finish.

Pours nice and dark, reasonable tan head. Smells malty, darkly fruity, and chocolate-y - good. Tastes also quite good; just enough hops to balance out the smell, so reasonable bite, but thick enough palate.

Bottle @ home. Deep dark brown color, opague. Roast, chocolate and licorice in both aroma and flavor. Velvety mouthfeel. Medium bodied. malty. Grassy and citric hops. Very well balanced. This is an excellent porter, highly drinkable yet very tasty.

Probably one of the best if not the best porter you can buy. Great roasted aromas and the flavor is spectacular. Silky smooth and nice coffee flavors from the roasted malts. Just the right body that supports the flavor profile. Nice subtly bitter finish

12 oz bottle from Whole Foods Nora. Pours a thickish black with a thin khaki head. Aroma is fantastic-semi sweet chocolate, light roast, dark cherry, bit of soury twang. Taste gets roast up front, followed by a great twangy malt sweetness. Perfect mouthfeel. Not super thick, but a good amount to chew on-more than most porters. Spot on bitterness with no standout hop flavor/aroma  Extremely well balanced, restrained, but full flavored brew. Awesome beer.

dark brown pour with almost ruby highlights and a tan head.
aroma is strong roast malt, coffee, bakers chocolate. Hint of leather.
flavour is more of the same nice roasted maltiness. coffee and bitter chocloate. Some tobacco tones in the finish. Very nice.
